full description: Job DescriptionCompany DescriptionSwell Content Co is looking for content creators that have a passion for creating exciting, scroll-stopping UGC Video Content Creator. With Swell, clients get award winning, high-performing content delivered to you every week to fuel your paid ads, social handles, landing pages, website and more.Role DescriptionWe are looking for a content creator who will collaborate with diverse brands, creating genuine and engaging user-generated content that truly connects with audiences. At Swell, we value creative, highly organized content creators who are at the start of emerging trends on Tiktok, Reels and other social platform.In this role, you will take on the exciting challenge of researching, ideating, and producing scroll-stopping video content for 3-4 brands. Your responsibilities will include brainstorming impactful ideas, capturing high-quality video, and expertly editing content using tools like CapCut and InShot. This position demands a mix of artistic flair and technical skill, coupled with an acute understanding of brand narratives and audience engagement.Responsibilities:Script and propose video concepts that reflect each brand’s objectives. Conduct in-depth research on social platforms to uncover innovative and compelling content ideas for different brands. Record superior video footage, focusing on elements such as composition, lighting, and storytelling. Edit videos with CapCut and InShot to achieve a polished and brand-aligned finish. Stay abreast of current trends in UGC and video content, ensuring our content remains forefront and relevant. Write compelling social copy including hashtagsQualifications:Exceptional creative vision and storytelling prowess. Interest to be in content OR ability to make face-less content at scale. Skilled in video editing software, especially CapCut and InShot. Outstanding communication, organization and written updates. Capable of juggling multiple projects and adhering to tight deadlines. A fervent desire to produce captivating and original content. And understanding of what is exciting on tiktok, reels, insta and other platforms. This is an unpaid, ongoing internship opportunity to get experience with an agency and create a book of content creation. Paid opportunities may be presented during the internship.To apply please email your resume, two examples of content you have created, and any links to your social channels to hello@swellcontentco.com

job title: Vice President of Strategic Initiatives - Clinic
full description: Job DescriptionDo you envision working for a dynamic, mission-driven organization that supports the community while fostering an employee culture of appreciation and fun? If your answer is yes, then an employment opportunity at Directions for Living may be a great fit for you! We offer an excellent salary and benefits package to include employer-paid health insurance premiums for all full-time employees, PTO and paid company holidays, 403b retirement, EAP, and year-round employee wellness and appreciation initiatives.Position Summary:The Vice President of Strategic Initiatives reports to and is responsible to the President & Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the agency. The Vice President of Strategic Initiatives participates in the Executive Leadership Team in developing and implementing a mission, vision, and strategic plan for the agency, setting annual objectives for service programs, and ensuring the implementation of action plans to achieve objectives. The Vice President of Strategic Initiatives will partner with his/her peer (VP-level executives) and will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing, in conjunction with the Vice President of Finance, the operational aspect of the annual budget. The Vice President of Strategic Initiatives represents the agency to all constituencies as designated by the President & CEO. The Vice President of Strategic Initiatives will cultivate existing relationships with public and private funders. Provide effective and inspiring leadership by being actively involved in all programs and services, developing a broad and deep knowledge of all programs Identify opportunities for Directions for Living to leverage cross-program strengths to take advantage of new opportunities and/or to address agency challenges. This is a key performance indicator. Lead, coach, develop, and retain Directions for Living high-performance senior management team with an emphasis on developing capacity in strategic analysis and planning, and program budgetingDirections for Living is an essential services provider. All Directions for Living employees must be willing and able to provide vital support and essential services to the people that we serve in the event of an emergency, pandemic or other disaster situation.EDUCATION EXPERIENCE/REQUIREMENTS: Must hold a Master's level degree from an accredited program in business, psychology, administration, social work, psychology, nursing, or a related field. At least ten (10) plus years of relevant experience in senior administrative or clinical programming.  Clinical and supervisory experience with progressive responsibilities for at least five (5) years.  LCSW or LMHC preferred.  Previous experience in Child Welfare is a plus. full description: Job DescriptionWE ARE GROWING & HIRING 5+ SALES PROFESSIONALS MONTHLY!Base pay is $35,100/year (earning potential of $87k-$129k).Do you want to work for a company that was awarded Great Places to Work and Top Places to Work?Do you want to work for a company that offers FREE benefits & amazing perks?Do you want to work from home/remotely?Do you want to work in a company that has a TEAM FIRST culture and celebrates its team members?Do you want a fun and challenging role that makes you jump out of bed each morning?If you answered “yes” to all, please keep reading!Enchanted Fairies is a national fine arts organization, setting a new standard in the photography industry, on a mission to create beautiful portraits for families of their children that will be treasured for a lifetime while giving back to charities locally and internationally!WHO WE ARE:Enchanted Fairies is a national fine arts organization, setting a new standard in the photography industry, on a mission to create beautiful portraits for families of their children that will be treasured for a lifetime!Additionally, we are centered on our mission to create a massive impact for children nationwide, both in strengthening children’s self-confidence and in donating to charities that work ground-zero to fight hunger, trafficking, and to provide human enrichment experiences to children with life-altering conditions.OUR CORE VALUES: TEAM FIRST: If we take care of our team, the love will just radiate out to our clients! MAGIC NEVER STOPS: We make sure we keep the magic and fun going every step of the way for our team and our clients! EMBRACE CHANGE: We are a fast-growing company and with that comes opportunities best suited for those that are agile and adapt!ROLE:Our Enchanted Fairies’ Portrait Consultants (PCs) present and sell portraits to families to display proudly in their home. They sell Enchanted Fairies’ Portraits to new inbound clients who are on appointment basis and up-sell wall art, albums, and gift portraits to existing clients. Our Enchanted Fairies’ Portraits Consultants manage their own pipeline of Enchanted Fairies’ Portrait Clients. They are also an essential component of our customer experience. PCs advise existing Enchanted Fairies Portrait clients on designing the perfect collections for their home, their walls, and gifts for friends and family as needed. PCs understand that they are more than “sales”. They are motivated by helping our clients create the beautiful artwork for their families meant to last several lifetimes, and PCs work closely with the Customer Service and Concierge teams to ensure clients are able to get exactly what they want from start to finish. Our PCs understand that the sales process itself is a choreographed experience that should have the customer begging to buy.RESPONSIBILITIES:Establish, develop, and maintain positive client relationshipsMove all prospects to proper stage of the pipeline via Infusionsoft throughout the dayMaintain a clear, up to date and accurate Mission’s Portrait pipeline in ISDocument all interactions with all Enchanted Fairies clientsEducate prospects on our products from an expert perspectiveUse both internal and external resources to maintain up to date knowledge of our products and industryCollaborate with the Sales Trainer, Lead Portrait Consultant and Director of Sales to formulate ideas on how to best serve our clientsA weekly sales average of $1,000 is maintained each month. REQUIREMENTS:Must have PC or laptop with a minimum of Windows 10, 8 gig ram & 256 storage. Must have internet speeds of at least 50 Mbps. Must be able to work Wed-Sun, 8am-6pm CSTMust have a minimum of 1 year experience in business to client (B2C) sales, preferably in a luxury industryExcellent verbal communication skills via video conference, phone, etc. Must be great at presentingExcellent at building rapportOpen to learning new processes in salesAre routine drivenOpen to growing rapidlySelf-sufficient and able to properly manage one’s own timeWell organized and able to maintain a pipeline that can be observed and understood by the DOM Benefits & PerksWe believe in Team First, that is why we are not 100% commission based, unlike most companies, we provide a base and commissionFREE Medical, Dental, Vision & Life InsuranceFREE Employee Assistance Program401k w/company match, Short & Long-Term Disability, Accident & Critical IllnessPet Insurance (They're family too!)Quarterly Cruise/Cash Giveaways for Team Members10 Days PTO (starts accruing from the first day)Paid Holidays (with no waiting period)Competitive pay Fast Growth OpportunitiesGreat fit for money-driven peopleTeam Member Discount ProgramGenerous 100% Employee DiscountWe have donated over $2mil to children's charities & are just getting started. At Enchanted Fairies, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and team members.Enchanted Fairies is a drug-free workplace.

Job DescriptionJob Title: Corporate Counsel – ContractsCompany: Aisin Holdings of AmericaDepartment: AHA Legal Affairs DepartmentLocation: Northville, MI or Seymour, INScopeAisin Holdings of America, Inc. (AHA or “Company”) is looking for a Corporate Counsel – Contracts (“Contracts Counsel”) with hands-on prior experience with contract review, transactional support, and management of contract document review workflows to assist the legal department with the contract workload. The Contracts Counsel will provide legal advice, support, and counsel relating to contract documents and transactions for the Company. This role will also assist the Company with overseeing and managing its contract document review program and contract lifecycle management program.The Contracts Counsel will review contracts and provide markups and responsive markups to contracts, draft contracts, and other contractual documents upon request. This position will also routinely participate in negotiating contracts in collaboration with company team members to ensure that the company’s legal position is protected and that it has complete knowledge of the risk involved with the contract/transaction. This position will also collaborate on outsourced contract reviews with the Company’s legal vendors and law firms.In addition to commercial and transactional support, the Contracts Counsel will oversee and manage the Company’s contract document review program. This will include oversight of workflows, including electronic intake of requests for contract review or assignment of contract reviews to legal vendors, ongoing contract negotiations, assistance with program administration, management of all open contracts, and other administrative tasks related to the contract document review program. Prior experience managing or working within a large organization’s enterprise-wide contract document review program is preferred.The Contracts Counsel will report directly to the General Counsel. The position will be based out of the Company’s Northville, Michigan, or Seymour, Indiana office. Attendance for this position will be hybrid, with 50% of the time required spent working on-site (subject to required meetings and travel). This attendance provision is a material condition for employment. This hybrid attendance may change in the future, subject to AHA policy decisions.Position ResponsibilitiesLegal:Legal review of commercial and transactional documents. Legal review of markups of commercial and transactional documents. Draft commercial and transactional documents. Maintain Company employee expectations and communicate effectively with Company employees concerning commercial and transactional document reviews and lead timesProvide advice and counsel to Company employees on legal issues relating to commercial and transactional documents, negotiations, and contract disputes. Work closely and collaborate with Company employees while negotiating contracts and transactions. Work to negotiate with customers, suppliers, vendors, and other outside parties, ensuring that the Company’s legal position is protectedManage and oversee legal vendors and law firms concerning assignment of contract reviews and legal work. Monitor and oversee the legal department’s email address dedicated to contract issues. General review of contract documents received in queue on a timely basis. Assessment and determination of how to handle contracts. Triage and assignment of contracts to internal and external counsel for legal review. Coordinate and facilitate communication of legal reviews between internal/external counsel and team members. Maintain Company employee expectations and communicate effectively with Company employees concerning contract reviews and lead times. Issue legal approvals or denials for contracts. Consistently update cloud-based queue daily regarding the status of contracts. Supervise and manage outside counsel’s review of contracts (i.e., nonlegal issues like timing, cost, facilitation of needed information, etc..). Training team members on using the contract document review program. Any other tasks related to the Contract Document Review Program as needed. Contract Lifecycle Management:Monitor and oversee the Company’s contract lifecycle management software. Upload, tag, and organize executed contracts as needed. Work with team members to assist in uploading of all executed contracts. Work with team members to ensure the tagging and organization of all executed contracts. Work with the Company in helping to identify contract champions at each of its locations as needed. Work with Company contract champions to train and facilitate proper contract lifecycle management system usage. Upload, tag, and organize executed contracts as needed. Work with the Company and its team members to locate, obtain, and upload legacy contracts at each location. Any other tasks related to the Contract Lifecycle Program as needed. Standardized Contracts:Oversee and manage all Company’s standardized contracts. Ability to identify needs for additional standardized contract documents. Train team members on the proper use and employment of standardized contracts. Assist team members with using and implementing standardized contracts as needed. Any other tasks related to standardized contracts as neededTracking & Metrics:Track key performance metrics concerning the contract document review program. Track legal vendor and law firm performance. Provide regular reports on contract document review program metrics to the General Counsel, senior management, and Japan headquarters. Any other tasks related to tracking and metrics as needed. Prior experience managing or participating in an organization’s enterprise-wide contract document review program. Strong business acumen and proficiency in supply chain issues are essential. Outstanding client service mentality. Ability to manage many contracts simultaneously (100+). A remote travel advisor is a specialized professional who assists individuals or organizations in planning and organizing remote travel experiences. Remote travel advisors provide expert guidance and support to ensure a seamless and enjoyable travel experience. Here's a detailed description of their role:Destination Expertise: Remote travel advisors possess extensive knowledge of remote work-friendly destinations worldwide. Job Description: The Community Development Director provides management of the Community Development Department including: Zoning, Planning, Building Inspection, Contracted Engineering. This position guides the development and implementation of the City’s Master Plan, budgets and accounts for departmental expenditures, and works with the general public and staff in planning and implementing economic development projects. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSSupervises and evaluates all departmental staff, handling all employee concerns, directing work assignments, counseling and disciplining employees when necessary, and completing employee performance appraisals. Interprets ordinances and answers questions from staff. Establishes and administers departmental policies and procedures and annual goals for the department. Designates, supervises, and assists the division supervisors in reviewing performance appraisals and recommending disciplinary actions. Prepares the departmental budget and monitors expenditures under the current budget. Represents the Planning and Zoning Department before the Planning Commission, Mayor, City Council, and various other commissions, committees, and groups concerned with planning processes and issues. Signs and reviews purchase requests, payroll, and all written documents leaving the office. Creates, prepares, or requisitions graphic and narrative reports on land use data, including land area maps overlaid with geographic variables such as population density. Serves as liaison between the department and the public, elected officials, and other City of Tybee Island departments regarding planning and zoning. Receives and processes all zoning and lot ordinance complaints by performing on-site inspections, identifying the property owner by parcel number, and notifying the owner by certified mail if the property is in violation of a zoning or lot ordinance. Issues citations and provides pictorial and other evidence to be used in court cases against property owners who do not comply by correcting zoning/lot violations within the stipulated time period. Assists the City code enforcement officers as needed coordinating issuance of citations and monitoring for compliance with City ordinances and permits. Answers the public’s questions regarding planning. Writes reports and studies and types memos and reports when necessary. Makes zoning presentations, reviews site plans, and reads and interprets maps. Serves as liaison between the City of Tybee Island and the Georgia Department of Transportation on project-specific issues. Prepares applications for, and monitors administration of, federal and state grants. Prepares grant reimbursement requests and provides financial planning assistance related to grant administration. Prepares technical reports, studies, plans, surveys, inventories, performance audits, and analysis. Prepares and makes presentations to elected officials and the general public. Attends and reports upon meetings with the Georgia Department of Transportation, various City of Tybee Island committees, and other public agencies or community groups. Manages, develops, promotes, coordinates, and implements community-based economic development projects and activities. Prepares correspondence, reports, forms, flowcharts, graphs, spreadsheets, project schedules, and other documentation. Reviews, processes, responds, forwards, and maintains various documentation as appropriate. Responds to requests for information from government officials, City of Tybee Island employees, the general public, and other individuals. Prepares ADA Plan updates as required. Develops and maintains various databases of information needed to support ongoing or project-specific analysis. Prepares zoning verification correspondence and answers public inquiries regarding zoning and subdivision issues as assigned. Administers the City of Tybee Island’s zoning ordinance and other development-related regulations and conducts research on various issues related to zoning or development regulations as assigned. Provides instruction and direction to the general public and department visitors and receives, responds to, or forwards departmental, governmental, or public correspondence by phone, mail, message, etc. Reviews and processes Manufactured Home Permits, Home Occupation Permits, and Building Permits as assigned. Attends various training workshops, conferences, and committee and public meetings which may require meeting at night or overnight travel and records minutes of meetings as assigned. Acts as the Floodplain Manager and reviews all plans for flood regulation and zoning code adherence. Assists with Planning TransportationAssists with Planning Department/Historical PreservationPerforms other related duties as assigned. Development Review:Reviews site plans and prepares comments for the Development Review Process. Explains zoning, sign, historic preservation, and development regulation requirements for developments and land use to applicants, government officials, and the general public. Provides information to planning staff, other City of Tybee Island departments, elected and appointed officials, applicants, and the general public regarding plan review, site conditions, zoning applications, and other applicable planning information. Reviews and prepares reports on variances, subdivisions, appeals of interpretation of design review, and planned development concepts for the development review process. Assists in the preparation of zoning text amendments for review by the Planning Commission and Mayor and Commission. Monitors the submittal of Plan Review comments from other reviewing departments. Maintains database of applicant and application information. Administers the Community Tree Ordinance as it relates to development. Reviews tree canopy cover plans for compliance with tree regulations for the weekly site plans and preliminary plat review process. Develops and conducts educational programs for and provides written materials to Tybee staff, developers, builders, contractors, and other members of the development community both in the office and in the field to promote compliance with tree regulations. Performs design and analytical work on urban developments in neighborhoods and redevelopment sites/areas. Performs technical research and investigation needed for the preparation of plans, reports, and programs. Prepares and administers grants for various urban design projects or undertaken by the City of Tybee Island. Prepares design related studies and reports at the request of the City Manager, assists with the preparation of the annual budget, assists with special projects within the Planning Department, and may serve as a technical resource for other departments of the City of Tybee Island. Long Range Planning:Processes Type I and Type II applications (rezoning’s, special use permits, planned developments, conservation subdivisions, text amendments), prepares reports on Type I and Type II applications, and presents Staff Report and recommendation to the Planning Commission. Assists in the preparation and maintenance of the Comprehensive Plan and in yearly updates of population estimates and employment data at the City -wide, census tract, and block group levels. Prepares special area studies and presents recommendations regarding the communities land use, economic base, housing stock, basic infrastructure, and public utilities. Reviews and processes environmental area permits and works with developers and property owners to interpret, apply, and enforce the Environmental Areas Ordinance. Prepares special reports on topics such as the spatial location of new development and the amount of acreage of vacant land undergoing urbanization (by land use), and Parks and Open Space planning and redistricting. Responds to requests for information on demographic data including census information and acts as the Department's primary liaison with the Census Bureau. Prepares and presents presentations to the public, the Mayor and Council, Planning Commission, and other organizations and groups, effectively communicating in potentially unstable environments/situations. Rural/Urban Planning:Reviews site plans and prepares comments for the Development Review Process when applicable. Explains zoning, sign, historic preservation, and development regulation requirements for developments and land use to applicants, government officials, and the general public. Reviews and prepares reports on variances, certificates of appropriateness, land development plans, and planned development concepts. Develops and conducts educational programs for and provide written materials to City of Tybee Island staff, developers, builders, contractors, and other members of the development community both in the office and in the field to promote appropriate urban design. Performs design and analytical work on urban developments in neighborhoods and redevelopment sites/areas. Performs technical research and investigation needed for the preparation of plans, reports, and programs. Prepares special reports on topics such as the spatial location of new development and the amount of acreage of vacant land undergoing urbanization (by land use), and parks and open space planning and redistricting. Floodplain management:Review all plans for compliance with City and FEMA flood rulesCoordinate Community Rating Service requirements and submit yearly reportsAssist residents with questions regarding the floodplain and flood safety. Conduct damage assessment after major storm events. Park and Beach Planning:Assists in the execution of park and beach planning and design functions within the Department, including park master plans, park site design plans, landscape plans, park standards development and implementation, and related functions. Assembles cost estimates, documents, presentations, mapping, graphics, sketches, and construction documents, as directed. Performs Geographic Information Systems (GIS) analysis and mapping duties as assigned and maintains department GIS database. Assists with field inspections of projects for conformance to approved plans. Guides the development of various park and beach planning documents for the department including park master plans, site plans, construction documents, and design standards. Serves as department liaison for community groups, government agencies, and design consultants. Manages public input processes for planning and design projects and maintains department design, sign, amenity, and architectural standards. Generates RFPs and RFQs for park and beach planning projects, construction packages, and other development documents as needed. Develops work plans, sets project priority, tracks ongoing projects, and sets short- and long-term goals for the for park planning. Zoning and Subdivision:Performs comprehensive review of all civil and construction drawings submitted for buildings permits, prepares a written recommendation for each submittal outlining any areas of non-compliance or general concern, conducts meetings with developers/appropriate representatives to review recommendations and discuss development projects, provides written approval of zoning compliance for all development plans prior to the issuance of building and land disturbance permits, performs on-site inspections of development projects for zoning compliance, and maintains plan review files and records. Coordinates the monthly Planning Commission meeting, presents staff recommendations at the monthly public meetings, and answers any questions asked by Planning Commission. Sets the monthly agenda, assigns requests to appropriate staff members for review, prepares staff recommendations, and prepares minutes. Reviews and prepares zoning recommendations in conjunction with the general public, various planners, and other City of Tybee Island employees, prepares reports and minutes for presentation to the Planning Commission, and delivers public presentations at monthly Planning Commission meetings. Administers the City of Tybee Island’s zoning ordinance and subdivision regulations, assists in drafting amendments to the zoning ordinance, and conducts research on various issues related to zoning. Coordinates the review of subdivision plans and administration of subdivision regulations with developers, engineers, planning staff, other City of Tybee Island employees and the general public and prepares reports for presentation to the Planning Commission and Subdivision Review Committee meetings. Explains zoning, sign, and historic preservation requirements for permitting, compliance, development, and land use to applicants, the general public, and elected and appointed government officials. Reviews site plans for multi-family and non-residential developments for compliance with the zoning ordinance and other related ordinances and regulations. Prepares zoning verification correspondence and answers public inquiries regarding zoning and subdivision issues. Performs inspections of new construction and altered sites for compliance with zoning, sign, and historic preservation ordinance requirements. Assists public in filing sign permits, reviews sign permit applications, and enforces on and off-site sign ordinances. Answers general zoning and planning questions for walk-in traffic and telephone calls from the general public regarding planning, zoning, sign, or historic preservation issues. Assists in the preparation of zoning text amendments for review by the Planning Commission and Mayor and City Council. Review and approve Manufactured Home Permits, Home Occupation Permits, and Address Assignments. Assists in preparing plan review comments and meets with applicants regarding plan review items. Assists in the review of requests and applications to the Historic Preservation Commission for construction. QUALIFICATIONS Education and Experience: Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Urban/Regional Planning, Engineering, Architecture, Landsc

Job DescriptionIf you have a passion for supply chain, freight and transportation and you know how to keep things moving and operations running smoothly, we are looking for you!As the General Manager, you are responsible for the efficient operation of the warehouse, including order fulfillment, shipping/receiving and inventory control activities. Sales experience in maintaining and developing relationships with existing customers as well as the desire to participate with the sales department to grow new business is integral to this role. In this position, you have a starring role in helping us continue to provide outstanding solutions for our nationwide customers.At Diligent, we are constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of. We pride ourselves on a positive work environment that creates happy employees who boost productivity and dedication.We are seeking an experienced General Manager for our Abilene location who has successfully managed a large warehouse freight and distribution operation. Our ideal candidate brings a proven record of success in Operations and Sales with the desire to join a dynamic, growing organization.JOB REQUIREMENTS: Customer account management Prospecting, Presentations, Negotiating & closing new business Manage driver routes and handle all driver issues within the region Work in conjunction with corporate accounting staff regarding customer invoicing, vendor payments and COG efficiencies Plan and oversee implementation of policies, procedures, and programs for all areas of operations.  Maintain weekly reports for region and submit to corporate office Billing Spreadsheet Owner Operator, Independent Contractors Payables Address/Solve Customer Issues Address/Solve Owner Operator Issues Daily Review of Owner Operator Route Paperwork to include, ensure every delivery has a signature, CODs are collected, and Collection Notices are completed.  Owner Operator Engagement Routine Office MaintenanceSALES REQUIREMENTS: Maintain and develop relationships with existing customers Up-Sell additional services including Freight Forwarding to current clients Get referrals from current clients for potential opportunities Develop a database of qualified leads through prospecting decision makers through telemarketing, cold calls, face to face meetings, networking and referrals Gain a clear understanding of customers business and service requirements for operations to support customer and meet expectations Make accurate, rapid cost calculations, and providing prospects with proposals for service Produce agreements including fuel surcharges and insurance requirements Negotiate pricing and service aspects, closing new business Follow up with each A prospect within 24-48 hours of initial contact Follow up on new sales inquiries by telephone and email.  Conduct marketing campaigns in assigned territory with the help of the Corporate Office through direct marketing, email campaigns and sales blitz Maintain accurate records of sales and prospecting activities (Sales Report) Submit report weekly to Corporate Office All other duties as directed by Executive Corporate StaffEXPERIENCE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:Associate degree or bachelor’s Degree preferred Effective Communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to build rapport, ask questions and listen Ability to negotiate and excellent closing skills Aggressive “hunter mentality”, excellent prospecting skills and strong sales ability Strong customer service skills Problem solving and multi-tasking abilities Team oriented Self-motivated, energetic, charismatic, and able to think on your feet Computer skills in Microsoft Office including Excel and Word Microsoft Streets and Trips or equivalent mapping/routing software is required 5 years of general manager experience in a supply chain, warehousing, or distribution environment 5 years of freight forwarding distribution and warehouse experience Knowledge of and experience with computerized scanning equipment Availability to work a flexible schedule, including planned and unplanned overtime, which may include weekends Working knowledge of financial accounting including developing and/or managing a P&L Experience with HR practicesABOUT US:DILIGENT DELIVERY SYSTEMS is an established yet fast growing freight forwarding, transportation, and logistics provider with locations and partners throughout the country to better serve our clients.Founded in 1995, Diligent has been providing local and regional delivery services to several niche industries. We are expanding our services to enable our customers to use Diligent as a complete transportation provider. These services include: Fulltime local and regional dedicated driver leasing positions Over the Road, LTL, FTL shipments Domestic and International Freight Cartage and Small Package / Pallet Network Program. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job title: Senior Director, Talent Acquisition Solutions (Leading Global Pharmaceutical Co.)
full description: Our client, one of the most highly regarded pharmaceutical/life sciences companies in the world is on the hunt for a visionary Senior Director, Talent Solutions to spearhead their talent acquisition strategy into a new era. This role is for the innovators, the change-makers, and those with a keen eye for the fusion of technology and human potential.The position is a unique blend of art and science, requiring a deep understanding of the latest technology, practices, and systems that fuel the Talent Acquisition process to perform extraordinarily. The right candidate will be the driver in our efforts to not only identify and implement cutting-edge talent solutions but also to weave these innovations seamlessly into our organizational fabric, ensuring agility, efficiency, and effectiveness in our talent strategies.Core Responsibilities:Innovative Talent Program Design: Craft and launch global talent acquisition strategies, marrying sourcing tactics with recruitment marketing and a compelling employer brand narrative.Strategic Collaboration: Partner with HR and executive leadership to dissect and optimize talent process workflows, identifying gaps and aligning solutions with overarching business objectives.Trend Analysis and Implementation: Stay ahead of the curve with the latest in talent and technology trends, integrating these insights into strategic planning.Operational Excellence: Supervise the selection, deployment, and advancement of talent systems and technologies, ensuring their alignment with global talent initiatives.Data-Driven Decisions: Leverage analytics to evaluate the impact of talent initiatives, pinpointing opportunities for enhancement.Leadership and Development: Mentor the talent team and business leaders, fostering an environment of continuous improvement and strategic execution.Process and System Innovation: Develop and institute robust processes and systems to underpin global talent strategies.Program Management: Ensure the seamless delivery and execution of talent programs, setting benchmarks for success and efficiency.     Job Requirements:Educational Background: Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.Experience: A minimum of 15 years in Talent (TA/Talent Management Talent Strategy), with a preference for backgrounds in high-tech, biotechnology, or pharmaceutical sectors.Skills Set: A thorough grasp of talent acquisition principles, expertise in talent technologies (including ATS), and a history of implementing transformative strategies. Must have a very high Emotional IQ and the ability to get "buy-in" for new ideas/concepts Leadership Qualities: Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a proven track record of guiding teams through complex scenarios.Analytical Acumen: Strong analytical capabilities, with a knack for leveraging data to inform strategic decisions.Operational Design: Experience in crafting and deploying operational processes that elevate talent strategies.Stakeholder Engagement: Ability to collaborate effectively with a diverse range of internal and external partners.
job function: Human Resources, Strategy/Planning, and Project Management

Job DescriptionSkout's Honor was founded by a team of dedicated individuals who share a common love for pets and a passion for making a positive difference in the world. We are proud to be a fast-growing, award-winning brand in the pet specialty industry that has become known for our product collection spanning cleaning, grooming, wellness, and oral care categories - that are truly life-changing for pets and the people who love them. Our vision is to make each purchase a source of pride for our customers, offering them products from a brand they love and improving the quality of life for pets and their people. Our mission focuses on delivering life-changing results through superior solutions, empowering our customers to make each purchase a socially and environmentally conscious decision. We strive to improve the relationship between pets and their people, ensuring our values of innovation, social and environmental responsibility, and love for pets guide our every action.Role Overview: As the Web & Ecommerce Manager at Skout's Honor, you will play a pivotal role in elevating our website capabilities, ecommerce performance and user experience. You'll be responsible for leading our ecommerce optimization roadmap, spearheading site redesign efforts, and working closely with both internal and external marketing, sales & ops teams to ensure a flawless online experience. We're looking for a dynamic individual with a growth mindset who is ready to drive our online presence forward.DETAILS: This job is full-time, in office, 5 days per week.Responsibilities:Design, develop, and maintain ecommerce websites to ensure optimal functionality and user experience. Implement new features and troubleshoot bugs to support business objectives. Optimize the site for SEO and oversee website performance, focusing on fast loading times, site architecture, and mobile responsiveness. Manage content updates, ecommerce integrations, and digital customer experiences, ensuring a seamless user journey. Drive A/B testing and other online testing methodologies to improve conversion rates and average order value. Collaborate closely with marketing and design teams to align digital strategies and enhance brand experience. Stay updated on industry trends, best practices in web development, and emerging technologies to continuously elevate our ecommerce platform. Qualifications:5+ years of experience in ecommerce, with a proven track record in enhancing online shopping experiences. Expertise in Shopify, including theme customization, app integration, and API integration. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Jquery. Strong understanding of web design principles, UX/UI best practices, and the ability to implement effective solutions based on customer feedback and analytics. Experience with CRM platforms, preferably HubspotA deep understanding of Google Analytics (GA4), Google Tag Manager, Google Search Console and other analytics tools. Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently and collaboratively. Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to articulate technical challenges and solutions to a non-technical audience. Join Us: If you're passionate about leveraging your ecommerce expertise to drive growth and contribute to a brand with a meaningful mission, Skout's Honor offers a unique opportunity. We're not just looking for an Ecommerce Manager; we're looking for a visionary ready to make a significant impact in the pet industry. Apply now to join our team in Oceanside, CA, and help us ensure a better quality of life for pets and their people.Company DescriptionSkout's Honor is an environmentally and socially conscious company, known for making life-changing pet essentials. We love pets and their people. At Skout’s Honor we change what people expect from a pet product by providing innovative solutions to everyday problems that dramatically improve the quality of life for pets and their people. www.skoutshonor.comSkout's Honor is an environmentally and socially conscious company, known for making life-changing pet essentials. This is a remote position.Junior Data Scientist - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $60K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Responsibilities:Partner with engineers, product managers, and business partners to identify algorithmic problems, brainstorm possible approaches, and recommend the best path forward. Develop algorithms iteratively, building in the right level of complexity to solve the business problem at hand and support future improvements. Define success criteria for your models so that you can measure impact and changes over time. You'll be expected to communicate findings and drive continuous improvements. Collaborate with Software Engineers to implement algorithms in production that scale gracefully. Collaborate with stakeholders to prioritize projects and define requirements. Carry out analysis of data produced by our hardware systems and create insightful visualizations to share your findings. Contribute to internal libraries to help other teams with their data science needs including visualization, prediction, optimization, and inference. Requirements & Experience:Advanced proficiency with Python and libraries commonly used for data analysis, e.g., Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, and Matplotlib. Strong understanding of data modeling and statistical analysis. Knowledge of optimization and predictive modeling techniques and experience applying them to real-world problems. Skilled at translating a general question or problem into a clearly defined algorithmic solution. Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Nice to haves:1-year Experience with Data Bricks or PySpark 1 year Experience with product ionizing data models Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Job DescriptionJob descriptionCompany Overview:Alpha Structural is the leading structural, foundation and geotechnical repair firm in Southern California, specializing in all aspects of structural, foundation and soil-related repairs and upgrades on all building types. company: AGB (Association of Governing Boards of Universities and Colleges)
full description: Job DescriptionPresident and Chief Executive OfficerThe Association of Governing Boards of Universities and Colleges (AGB) invites nominations and applications for its next President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO).AGB’s next President and CEO will serve as AGB’s leader and nationally respected advocate for consequential higher education board governance. Reporting to and partnering with the AGB Board of Directors, the CEO will provide strategic leadership for AGB, champion AGB’s best practices of higher education governance, and work with the staff to fulfill AGB’s mission and values. The CEO will maximize relevance for and engagement with the association’s more than 1,300 member boards and over 40,000 trustees, presidents and chancellors, board professionals, and senior officers who have fiduciary responsibility for colleges, universities, multi-campus systems, institutionally related foundations, and state higher education coordinating boards.A visionary and strategic leader, the CEO is expected to confirm and strengthen AGB’s position as the thought leader of higher education board governance, gained over its more than 100 years of service to higher education. Further, the CEO will strengthen AGB’s ongoing alignment with its members, ensuring that AGB is their trusted resource to address current and emerging issues, challenges, and opportunities. Through the CEO’s transformational leadership, AGB will advance its role as a prominent voice in higher education for student and graduate success; the value of higher education and board independence in a democracy; diversity, equity, and inclusion; and other societal values that are fundamental to college and university mission fulfillment.Working with the AGB Board of Directors, the CEO will lead and collaborate with an exceptional AGB staff leadership team responsible for mission fulfillment, content, programs and publications, membership experience, consulting services, marketing, strategic communications, finance, human relations, and executive search services.Above all, the CEO is a leader with proven success running a complex, mission-driven, financially sustainable organization, with significant experience-based understanding of higher education and higher education governance. An advanced degree is required; a terminal degree is preferred.For more information on this role please see the full Profile (https://www.agbsearch.com/sites/default/files/position-profiles/agb_president_v4.pdf)Nominations and ApplicationsThe Search Committee will begin reviewing applications in April and will continue until the position is filled. For best consideration, applicant materials should be received by April 5, 2024.Candidates Should Provide:Letter of interest stating how the candidate’s experiences and qualifications connect with the characteristics and priorities expressed in the position profile. Resume or curriculum vitae. Five professional references with emails, telephone numbers, and a description of the candidate’s professional relationship with each reference listed (references will not be contacted without prior written authorization from the applicant). Please click here (bit.ly/3u33HfV) to apply for the position. Should you have any questions or encounter any difficulties with the application process, please contact AGBCEO@agbsearch.com.The search is being assisted by the following professionals from AGB Search:Rod McDavis, Managing Principal, Rod.mcdavis@agbsearch.com, (804) 514-1982Monica Burton, Principal, monica.burton@agbsearch.com, (917) 825-2961Margaret “Peggy” Plympton, Principal, margaret.plympton@agbsearch.com, (484) 554-4543Andrew Bowen, Executive Search Consultant, Andrew.bowen@agbsearch.com, (802) 345-1279AGB is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Employees are selected on the basis of their qualifications and work experience. AGB does not discriminate against any candidate for employment or employee because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, family responsibilities, physical handicap, matriculation, or political affiliation. AGB also strives to recruit and promote qualified candidates from minority groups, women, veterans, and the disabled.

Job Title: Director, Health Brand StrategyLocations: New York, NY | Chicago, IL | Denver, NYDuration: Full Time, Permanent & OnsiteThe client is a strategic consulting agency dedicated to helping our clients find their true path forward. With creative rigor and genuine collaboration, we help uncover the truths that can inspire direction, change and transformation for our clients. We do this through our expertise in brand strategy, innovation and consumer insight (both qualitative and quantitative) which we deploy across our three business verticals of Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG), Health and Lifestyle.JOB OVERVIEWWe’re seeking a Director. Candidates open to a hybrid in-office schedule in NYC, Chicago or Denver are preferred, but will also consider strong candidates for remote opportunities (CA, MA and DC excepted). We are looking for candidates with previous healthcare experience (pharmaceutical experience preferred), where the work centered around brand strategy, commercialization and insights. There will be opportunity to work across Lifestyle and CPG, however, health will be the primary responsibility. We partner with patients, caregivers + care partners, consumers, and Healthcare Professionals to uncover deep insight, emotional and functional needs, and drivers of growth. We uncover patient and HCP journeys, reveal opportunities for innovation, and help define brand strategy and positioning. We are ambitious professionals who have a keen interest in working with very competitive healthcare clients who are leaders in the field and the flexibility – and empathy - to work across diverse disease states. We’re innovators in the realm of research and new product development, constantly developing new ways to reveal patterns, predispositions and even predictors of human behavior. This position requires you to create and execute a wide range of insight-hunting research, business planning, customer collaborations and ideation sessions. DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCEWe are seeking teammates with strategic development and proven results on big brands, particularly helping to drive strategy and experience in commercialization of brands (pre-launch, launch and inline) a plus. Folks who are currently working for an agency or on client-side are welcomed to apply, as long as they have some previous consulting/service-side experience in foundational insight, brand strategy and/or innovation. Pharmaceutical brand specific experience is essential. We require hands on experience leading qualitative market research projects centered around brand strategy, unbranded/branded communication, creation of new product positioning, messaging strategy and innovation projects; this position requires a robust view and understanding of research, culture, health trends, patient or provider experience; diversity in category and Rx brands. Showing up as a team and rolling up your sleeves to do the work alongside your teammates is a must. We seek to do more challenging, bigger impact work that requires an experienced team and partnership - not just with sr. leadership but with your peers, jr. teammates and operations + project management partners.  Having a fearless growth mindset is critical to your success . This means being able to know we don’t all know everything and there is something new to learn every day, to being humble enough to learn from mistakes, support your teams and embrace a continuous improvement attitude. We are seeking people who love to immerse themselves in a strategic issue through leading sensitive and revealing conversations with patients, caregivers/care partners and HCPs – in homes, research facilities, in office and online, to learn their perspectives.  Practical experience with applied behavioral science and understanding the role cognitive bias has in decision making and how that applies to opportunities for brands is a plus. Mentoring, teaching, actively listening and proactively relaying ideas both up and down the line management chain is a must and is core to positive collaboration. Communication skills are key to fostering rewarding partnerships both internally and externally with clients. Understanding the context of one another’s behaviors and motivations is key to those partnerships. Being able to have positive and constructive conversations is a must.  Our Directors enjoy generating significant new business and being accountable for leading new clients and projects on a consistent basis. Being motivated by and able to demonstrate a track record of this business ambition is key to success in this position. You will be responsible for helping to drive both vertical and company growth through new business efforts via organic growth and new business outreach. Significant experience with pharmaceutical brands required, ideally coming out of another market research / strategy consultancy. Moderating experience required.We create highly-visual, multi-media stories to convey our insights, strategies and innovation ideas. The ability to convey your ideas through photos, videos and stories is important in this position.  Collaborative, friendly and team-oriented, we place an enormous amount of emphasis on our company culture and providing strong career mentoring to ensure personal success and job satisfaction. We are motivated by having our creative-thinking skills consistently stretched, seeing our ideas succeed in the marketplace and working to lead the world’s most famous brands towards growth. MBA or Graduate degree in a Healthcare related focus is plus but not mandatory.Thanks & Regards,Daniel S (Saiyed)Executive Recruiterdaniel.s@brightpathassociates.com

Aidar Health, Inc., is a fast-growing health technology and digital medicine company with the mission to enhance the quality of life of patients with chronic conditions and enable positive health outcomes.  Aidar designs develop and deliver clinically validated breath- and saliva-based sensors and evidence-based therapeutic interventions for various chronic conditions, including heart failure, COPD, infectious disease (i.e., COVID-19), and chronic kidney disease, among many others.  Aidar has developed a revolutionary FDA-cleared medical device, MouthLab, which measures 10+ medical parameters in less than 60 seconds and a cloud-based enterprise platform, which leverages proprietary AI and machine learning algorithms to create a new kind of personalized healthcare experience for chronic disease patients. Aidar Health is looking for a Full Stack Developer/Engineer to join our team to design and test software for medical devices and instruments.  As a Full Stack Developer/Engineer, the individual will operate in all phases and contribute to all activities of the software development and verification process. Candidates must be able to develop requirements, and design and verify software via design control procedures used within the medical device industry. A successful candidate is self-motivated and works well both independently and in a team environment.We are looking for an experienced, pragmatic, and capable Senior software engineer who wants to see the outcome of their work to help people. You will join a small team of engineers that are laying the foundation of Aidar Health’s future. Our engineers work closely with product, design, and clinical teams to define problems and build effective solutions.You will participate in the ownership of the engineering discipline: working to build not only our products but our culture and processes. You will not be hesitant to jump in and fix things because you take responsibility for sustainable engineering. Job DescriptionPosition: Director of Business DevelopmentLocation: Remote Sales (Not required to be based in West Boylston, MA)INTRODUCTIONCurtis Industries, LLC, founded in 1968, is a market leader in the design and manufacture of cab enclosures for a diverse set of vehicles including; Compact Tractors, Golf Cars, and Utility Vehicles. Its customers include well known OEMs and a network of over aftermarket 6,000 dealers. The company’s headquarters and plant operations are located in a recently constructed, custom designed 160,000 square foot facility in central Massachusetts.Curtis has enjoyed consistent growth and is solidly profitable. The Company has been upgrading its engineering capabilities in order to increase the rate of new product introductions, shorten cycle times, and improve customer service. In short, the stage is set for rapid revenue growth.In order to continue to fuel the Company’s growth in revenue and profitability a decision has been made to grow the company’s business development capability.This exciting opportunity exists for a driven, passionate individual with a successful track record of growing revenue by identifying and securing new opportunities. Curtis’s investors and senior management team is committed to continued revenue growth and is ready to make the investments required to support this.The Company culture is open and direct. Curtis values integrity, ethics, continuous improvement, teamwork, courage and innovation.Position SummaryReporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, this important position is responsible for developing strategies that deliver business development and sales growth from existing markets, adjacent markets, and entirely new markets throughout North America.The Director of Business development will lead the development of Curtis’s growth strategy and its tactical implementation. Specific responsibilities include: Identify and pursue new OEM opportunities (new customers and new markets) Leverage the company’s insight into the OEM marketplace to develop and market innovative, new Aftermarket products Identify strategic association partnerships, join key industry associations and maintain healthy relationships to further the company’s reach within the key vertical markets Actively participate as a member of the Company’s leadership teamExecution will focus on market, segment and account selection by industry verticals; engaging engineering, commercial leaders and C-Level executives. The selected candidate will work closely with the Senior Management Team to identify and support newly identified opportunities.Candidate Qualifications And Background The ideal candidate for the role will be an accomplished strategic sales professional who has successfully guided a component manufacturer serving the company’s markets through an aggressive growth phase.  Experience with low-middle volume OEM accounts in Curtis’s core and related markets.  Demonstrated the implementation of sales and marketing strategies and consistently met or exceeded planned objectives.  Curtis is particularly interested in candidates with relevant experience with a track record for making good decisions quickly, with imperfect data. On a personal level, the ideal candidate will be thoughtful, visionary and decisive. The successful candidate will be someone who works in a collaborative manner and is comfortable “quarterbacking” multi-function teams organized around customer needs.The ideal candidate will be “hands on” and lead by example.Desired Education, Experience & Attributes A Bachelors Degree in a relevant area of study such as Business, Marketing, Finance, Engineering or Management 15 years of sales development, impeccable oral, written & presentation skills Experience in strategic planning and decision making, as well as the tactical actions of successfully landing and growing identified business opportunities Experience making significant contributions to the successful growth of a smaller market company Experience in building effective customer relationships with senior executives Experience in leading the development of valid, client-perspective value propositions, bids, proposals and internal business case presentations Experience in contract law and demonstrated contract negotiation Experience with CRM systems Experience in creating completion plans and creating monthly reports illustrating accomplishments & opportunitiesAbility to sell solutions and related servicesSelf-Starter, ability to function independently without daily managementKnowledge of technical processes & mechanical productsSolid proficiency in Microsoft Office: Excel, Outlook, Word, & PowerPointSupervisory ResponsibilitiesNo direct reports but must be able to collaborate and influence both internal and external resources.TRAVEL 75%CompensationWe offer an attractive salary with a progressive and a very comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, life, disability and 401(k) Plan with a strong company match. We have a strong team-oriented work environment and provide a challenging and exciting environment that will allow you the opportunity to grow and succeed while making a significant contribution to the success of our Company.Bonus eligible.EOE/ADA/Drug Free Employer.Company DescriptionCurtis Industries, LLC is a Leader in quality cab enclosures and enclosures for Compact Tractors, Golf Cars, and UTV/Powersports Vehicles located in central Massachusetts.This exciting opportunity exists in a rapidly growing, vibrant manufacturing company in West Boylston, MA. Based on successfully executing on our growth strategy, Curtis Industries LLC is experiencing extraordinary growth in our business of providing cab enclosures, snow control products, and accessories for the tractor, utility vehicle, and golf car markets. We are ISO 9001:2015 certified and looking to stretch beyond the requirements of the standard to use elements of our QMS as a competitive advantage.EOE/ADA/ No phone calls please. company: NARFE: The Association for Federal Employees and Retirees
full description: Job DescriptionAs the Manager of Legislative Affairs at NARFE (National Active and Retired Federal Employees Association), you will play a critical role in advancing the organization's advocacy agenda and representing the interests of federal employees and retirees.In coordination with the SVP, Policy & Programs, you will be responsible for implementing strategies to influence policy, coordinating lobbying with political activity and grassroots advocacy efforts, and building relationships with policymakers.This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the protection and enhancement of federal employee and retiree benefits and rights.Key Responsibilities:Legislative Affairs & Government Relations: Establish, maintain and build relationships with members of Congress, their staff, administration officials and other key stakeholders involved in federal employee and retiree issues. Advocate for NARFE's positions through meetings, briefings, and written communications. Assist in the development of advocacy strategies to support NARFE’s policy objectives.Political Engagement: Represent the Association at political events connected to contributions from NARFE-PAC, the Association’s political action committee, to campaign committees. Assist in the development of NARFE-PAC’s strategies to facilitate relationship-building with policymakers.Policy Analysis and Monitoring: Stay updated on legislative and administrative policy developments at the federal level. Assist with analysis of bills, amendments, and committee actions to assess their potential impact on federal employees and retirees. Provide guidance on potential impacts and recommend responses.Advocacy Communications: Draft and disseminate concise and persuasive written materials, including official letters, policy briefs, fact sheets, and talking points. Write monthly articles on advocacy topics for NARFE magazine.Coalition Activity: Collaborate with like-minded organizations, associations, and coalitions to build strategic alliances and maximize the collective impact of advocacy efforts. Participate in meetings, conferences, and working groups to promote NARFE's legislative agenda.Qualifications And RequirementsBachelor's degree in political science, public policy, or a related field. Minimum 5 years of experience in legislative affairs or government relations. Some experience working for a member of Congress or congressional committee preferred. Demonstrated experience in building relationships with policymakers and stakeholders. Strong communication skills, including a proven ability to communicate effectively regarding complex policy issues. Strong knowledge of the legislative and administrative process. Knowledge of issues affecting federal employees and retirees preferred. Strong understanding of political process. Proven ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Commitment to NARFE's mission and values. Experience with a membership association preferred. Experience in public speaking preferred. Experience in grassroots advocacy and mobilizing supporters preferred. Work Environment: The organization is currently operating on a hybrid work schedule (In office 3 days & Remote 2 days/week). The headquarters office is conveniently located near Braddock Road metro station in Old Town Alexandria.We provide our employees with flexible / hybrid work schedules, competitive benefits package including medical, dental, LTD/STD, AFLAC, Health & Dependent Care FSA, 401(k), transit/parking benefit, 11 paid holidays, generous vacation and sick leave offered along w/paid parental leave, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), and opportunities for Professional Development. Free parking available.Salary Range: The starting rate is $72,000 – 80,000 annually. The final candidate's relevant experience/skills will be considered before an offer is extended. Actual starting pay will vary based on non-discriminatory factors including, but not limited to, experience, skills, specialty, and education.Come join NARFE and help us protect the earned benefits of the federal community. NARFE is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.Company DescriptionThe National Active and Retired Federal Employees Association (NARFE), a non-profit membership association more than 140,000 current and retired federal employees, is dedicated to protecting and enhancing the earned pay, retirement and health care benefits of federal employees, retirees and their survivors and providing the information and guidance needed to understand and maximize complex federal benefits. NARFE is the go-to resource for the federal community, policymakers, and the media on issues related to legislation and federal benefits. NARFE is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.The National Active and Retired Federal Employees Association (NARFE), a non-profit membership association more than 140,000 current and retired federal employees, is dedicated to protecting and enhancing the earned pay, retirement and health care benefits of federal employees, retirees and their survivors and providing the information and guidance needed to understand and maximize complex federal benefits. NARFE is the go-to resource for the federal community, policymakers, and the media on issues related to legislation and federal benefits. NARFE is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture.

job title: Graphic Designer/Content Creator - Marketing Communications Specialist
full description: Job DescriptionIntercomp Company Graphic Designer/Content Creator - Marketing Communications SpecialistJob #2440Job Description:Intercomp Company, a worldwide leader in manufacturing weighing solutions for transportation industries is looking to fill a full time Marketing Communications Specialist position. This position will generate marketing materials within various markets and participate with marketing and sales teams to provide support and input to meet and exceed company sales objectives.We are seeking a talented and creative graphic designer and content specialist to join our team. As a graphic designer, you will play a crucial role in shaping our brand identity and communication strategies. The candidate will develop written content that effectively promotes our brand and products to our target audience. The ideal candidate should have experience in graphic design, marketing automation tools and written skills to create engaging content that accurately describes our products and solutions across multiple platforms and channels.Responsibilities: Design and Branding: Create aesthetically pleasing graphics, illustrations, Photoshop work and visual elements for various media including websites, advertisements, social media, video and print materials including catalogs and brochures.  Develop and maintain guidelines for consistent branding across all channels.  Content Creation and Digital: Work closely with the marketing team to create written content that describes products, solutions and is aligned with market strategy for editorials, brochures, social media, press releases, PowerPoint, application notes and emails.  Managing website content including uploading, updating, and creating text, images, videos, and other multimedia assets. SEO knowledge is a plus.  Design responsive email templates, banners, and social media graphics.  Collaboration and Feedback: Collaborate closely with cross-functional team members, including product management, sales, engineering and marketing to create compelling content.  Incorporate feedback from stakeholders to refine designs and improve content communication.  Quality Control and Deadlines: Maintain high-quality standards in all design and written work.  Meet project deadlines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. Job DescriptionJob Title: Tig WelderLocation: Allentown PA Shift/Hours: 1st Shift [6:50 am – 2:50 pm] Salary: $24.00 per hour (To Start)Reports To: Production Supervisor/ManagerSumitomo Cryogenics of America, Inc. (Allentown) is currently seeking a (Tig Welder) to join our production team. The Tig Welder will work within the production environment, utilizing their hands-on skills, experience and learned knowledge of our products to ensure manufactured products are produced in accordance with customer and company standards.Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to: Perform all duties required to properly Tig weld, with the ability to work from drawings, sketches, procedures, or verbal instructions. Develop, establish, and modify welding techniques and methods, using all types of welding equipment and procedures. Weld, braze, solder, cut, and gouge all types of materials in all positions on components, assemblies and systems manufactured and designed by SCAI. Understand and apply welding symbols and maintain proper sequence of assembly and accuracy of fit-up. Use hand, power tools and precision measuring instruments as necessary. Maintain required certifications under applicable codes if necessary. Operate all Tig Welding equipment necessary for the performance of the duties of the job. Physical Requirements include: be able to lift, push, pull, and move items over 10 – 40 lbsMinimum Requirements:Ability to Tig weld on thin wall stainless steel using fusion & weld wire techniques. High school Diploma or GED; 18 years of age or older. Consistent ability to report to work on time and work scheduled hours; able to adhere to attendance guidelines. Ability to multitask and self-prioritize work in order to successfully accomplish job duties. Ability to work both individually and in an established team setting. Ability to actively listen, understand and effectively communicate and follow verbal and written instructions in English. Basic Computer Skills. Ability to interpret (read) and work from blue printsPrevious forklift experience preferred. Ability to pass a personal background check and/or clearance at time of hire and as required by Customers is required. Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorshipPhysical RequirementsRegularly required to stand up to 8.0 hrs. Frequently required to walk, climb stairs, stoop, kneel, bend, and or crouch. Occasionally required to lift up to 40 lbs. occasionally required to exert up to 40 lbs. of force to push/pull objects or equipment within a production environment. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and the ability to adjust focus. Must be able to hear audible alarms and communications. Must be able to work at various heights. Required to use wrists, hands and fingers to manipulate various items. Able to work in an environment that has extreme temperatures, humidity, hazardous/loud equipment, and slippery surfaces.

TytoCare works with leading health plans and providers worldwide, to roll out Home Smart Clinic solutions that enable accessible, high-quality primary care from home, with no compromises. Job DescriptionPosition SummaryLeads day-to-day activities pertaining to the Inventory Department. Schedules daily Cycle Counts and stock checks. Submits inventory adjustments and location updates. Executes all inventory reports. Effectively delegate’s workload to department personnel. All while maintaining a clean and safe work environment.Essential ResponsibilitiesIn addition to the Responsibilities of “Inventory Clerk”:Create and print inventory tags for the days count. Incrementally distribute inventory count tags to Inventory CountersCreate and maintain inventory spreadsheets to effectively schedule inventory counts. Run variance reports, and submit to the Accounting department. Research Identified count discrepancies given by the Inventory CountersMake Stock adjustments as needed. Conduct Stock checks for shipping and sales. Manage a group of 2-3 personnel. Maintain a filed history of counts. Maintain open communication with Receiving Supervisor and upper management regarding any issues that may arise. Maintain spreadsheet inventory plan for fiscal year inventory counts. Maintain a clean and safe work area. Information and Activities Critical to Process QualityInventory Tag Creation:Create tags for material to be countedRelease made tags to inventory counters to be counted and returned. Maintain a spreadsheet that shows what items have been counted and what needs to be counted. Run variance report once counts are completed and issue to accounting for inventory correction. Identify count discrepancies and research root cause of the discrepancies. Report issues that cannot be readily resolved to the Receiving Supervisor or Operations Manager. Make stock adjustments as needed for material that is no longer available. Assist with stock checks requested by sales or the shipping dept. Manage the inventory counter personnel within the warehouse and coordinate pipe counts with the receiving personnel in the pipe yard. Hold all previously ran variance reports for later reference. Have a copy of the inventory plan for the fiscal year as a reference to which items have and have not been counted. Manage the flow of daily tickets dispersed to inventory crew. Research items found to be discrepant to establish where an error may have occurred. Maintain a safe work environment. Duties are not limited to those described above, and may be expanded as needed. Company DescriptionBlue Raven Solutions, including Triman Industries, Inc., and Crestwood Technology Group, LLC (collectively, the “Company”) is a portfolio company of AE Industrial Partners, LP (“AEI”), a private equity firm specializing in aerospace, defense & government services, space, power & utility services, and specialty industrial markets.
