Title: Supply Chain Analyst Duration: 9 months Location: Irvine, California, 92606 (onsite)Pay rate starts from: $40/hr. on W2   Summary: The main function of a supply chain analyst is to assess and ensure the compliance of client, its Vendors and entities of client with all government import or export laws within assigned countries and regions.  Key Responsibilities: • Coordinating Returns to suppliers and track all the rework activities. • Execute processes and procedures (e.g., SOPs, work instructions) and may provide recommendations for updates for applicable Supply Chain functions • Collaborate with departments (such as, clinical, sales, marketing, legal, etc.) within client in order to assess needs and perform actions required, across the entire supply chain continuum (e.g., plan, source, make and deliver) seeking to manage product flow including issues with limited scope • Assess global vendors to ensure cost, quality, delivery, technical, and service capabilities to meet requirements in collaboration with team members; identify and resolve supply chain issues • Perform routine analysis to improve supply chain operations • Execute supply chain related projects (e.g., NPD introductions) • Other incidental duties assigned by Leadership Additional Skills: • Good computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite, Global Supply Chain, and Quality systems (e.g., JDE) preferred • Good written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal relationship skills including negotiating and relationship management skills • Ability to develop compliance processes and procedures • Good problem-solving and critical thinking skills • Good knowledge and understanding of clients policies, procedures and guidelines relevant to local and/or global supply chain including FDA and ISO laws and regulations applicable to medical device industry • Good problem-solving skills • Strict attention to detail • Ability to interact professionally with all organizational levels • Ability to manage competing priorities in a fast paced environment • Must be able to work in a team environment, including immediate supervisor, other team members in the section or group, and vendors/suppliers • Adhere to all EHS rules and requirements and take adequate control measures in preventing injuries to themselves and others as well as to the protection of environment and prevention of pollution under their span of influence/control  Education and Experience: • Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field preferred • 2-4 years of experience required

Job DescriptionFLUENT IN SPANISH (SPEAKING/READING/WRITING) IS A REQUIREMENT DUE TO OUR WORKFORCE.Dedicated team is seeking an experienced Residential Administrative Coordinator!What We DoWe are men and women who believe it requires investment to be great. We're dedicated to our craft because we know the quality of our effort is seen in the concrete product we create, whether others will see it or not. Although many will never see what is below their flooring, we take great pride in providing the highest quality concrete foundation that not only looks great but will withstand the test of time.Our team always has top of the line equipment and software to ensure a smooth process. We have been serving Colorado Springs builders, general contractors, and homeowners for 25+ years and are looking forward to many more.THE OPPORTUNITYThe Administrative Assistant is responsible for the overall office support of the entire residential division including executive support to Directors/Managers/Owners. Responsible for managing day-to-day business activities, customer and employee interactions, streamlining procedures, and intra-office communication.What You Will Be DoingSharing in the responsibility to answer and screen all incoming office calls; greets and directs visitors accordingly and takes and retrieves messages for various personnel. Providing general office clerical support as needed, i.e., prepare and/or scans documents, weekly and monthly reporting for field personnel, committees, marketing, and others as needed. Develops maintains and distributes office communications to and for all departments, coordinates and tracks contests and awards, coordinates, and plans travel. Assist in planning for meetings and taking meeting meetings. Assisting executives in checking and answering emails, managing, and communicating calendar events and appointments, sorting documents, answering phone calls, other correspondence as necessary, and organizing office and files. Tracks, updates and reports all residential division timekeeping daily and reporting any and all discrepancies. Assists with potential new hire applications, scheduling interviews and new hire orientations as needed. Providing support to field operations such as printing field paperwork, assisting in troubleshooting cell phone issues and other tasks as requested. Maintaining the office and its cleanliness, ordering kitchen supplies, office supplies and other stocked supplies within allocated budget. Assisting with marketing administrative duties including but not limited to; digital and social media coordination, website updates, direct mail marketing, maintain and updating reports, all event support, prepare marketing follow up and sales packets, work in CRM to support marketing and estimating team in lead tracking and follow ups. Works closely with outside marketing as the need arises. Contacting vendor for IT support/troubleshoots for members of the office and provides support with equipment/software/phones training, as necessary. Assisting in the organizing and planning of employee-related events. Assisting in recording and submitting expense reports for various personnel to accounting for division as requested. Providing translation services as needed. Running errands for office needs, as applicable. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.What You Will Bring To Our OrganizationBi-lingual skills. Minimum 1 year reception/customer service experience. Knowledge of operating general office equipment and MS Suite PC skills. Knowledge with Phone/Tablet technology (preferrable Apple equipment)Self-driven with a “can do” attitude and willingness to go above and beyond. Minimum of 1+ years of marketing experience preferred. Working Conditions & Physical RequirementsWork is performed in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopies and filing cabinets. This is a full-time position, and the hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm, but subject to change based on business needs. While performing the duties of this job, you will frequently sit at a desk for prolonged periods working on a computer. You will regularly be required to reach with hands and arms and frequently required to stand; talk or hear; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, feel or operate objects, tools, or controls. An occasional requirement to climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. You may at times lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. Junior Database Developer - onsite Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $62K - $77KA valid work permit is necessary in the USAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.DescriptionYou will be responsible for developing, testing, improving, and maintaining new and existing databases to help users retrieve data effectively. As part of the IT team, you will work closely with developers to ensure system consistency. You will also collaborate with administrators and clients to provide technical support and identify new requirements. Communication and organization skills are keys for this position, along with a problem-solving attitude.Ultimately, you should be able to ensure our database systems run effectively and securely daily.Requirements:Proven work experience as a Database developer In-depth understanding of data management (e.g., permissions, recovery, security, and monitoring) Knowledge of software development and user interface web applications Hands-on experience with SQL Familiarity working with.NET Framework, JavaScript, HTML, and Oracle Excellent analytical and organizational skills An ability to understand front-end users requirements and a problem-solving attitude Excellent verbal and written communication skills BSc degree in Computer Science or relevant field BenefitsOpportunities for professional development and growth. Collaborative and inclusive work environment. Exposure to cutting-edge technologies and industry-standard tools. Opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects. Work with a talented and passionate team. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.Pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Job DescriptionRegional Vice President of SalesRemoteBenefits: Janek offers paid medical, dental, vision, life insurance benefits, retirement plan with match up to 4%, 2 weeks PTO w/tenure-based increases. In-depth knowledge of the sales performance industry and understanding of regional market dynamics. Strategic thinking and the ability to translate business objectives into actionable sales strategies. Exceptional communication, negotiation, and relationship-building skills. Analytical mindset with the ability to use data and metrics to drive decision-making. Proven ability to identify and capitalize on new business opportunities. Adaptability to a dynamic and fast-paced work environment. Well versed in CRM applications (Salesforce or equivalent) and sales automation tools. Proven enhanced attention to detail, strong organizational skills and follow-through are required. Excellent written, verbal, organizational and customer service skills. Positive attitude, strong interpersonal skills; proven ability to work unsupervised. Advanced skills with Microsoft Windows and Office environment (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook) and standard office equipment. Experience with online meeting presentation software such as Microsoft Teams, WebEx or Zoom. Knowledge And AbilitiesRequires the ability to gather and analyze facts, to devise solutions to problems, to prepare clear and concise reports, follow instructions, pay attention to details and to perform with a high level of accuracy, completeness, and legal compliance. Ability to work in a team environment; work effectively with others, provide effective client service, display strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbally and in writing, organize, prioritize, research, and plan. Ability to correctly interpret, explain and apply policies and procedures, understand, and follow oral and written instructions, ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing. Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with those contacted in the course of work. Requires repetitive movement, sitting, writing letters and memos, face-to-face discussions with individuals or teams, use of electronic mail, telephone conversations, contact with others (face-to-face, by telephone, or otherwise). Requires repeating the same physical activities or mental activities over and over; requires being exact or highly accurate, requires meeting strict deadlines. Basic Skills: Active learning, active listening, critical thinking, basic math to include adding, subtracting, multiplication, division, reading comprehension, speaking, writing. Requires good oral and written communication skills, organizational skills. Job DescriptionWe have a very exciting opportunity for an experienced, entrepreneurial Business Development Manager to join our team. The selected candidate will lead the strategic efforts to grow profitable revenue in aftermarket parts sales as well as service products (start-up services, maintenance plans, service contracts, etc.).You will be responsible for strategy development, service product development, as well as recommending the technology and organizational structure to accelerate growth in these very profitable business segments. You will be will be fully responsible for – and accountable to – meeting or exceeding revenue growth targets, maintaining or growing market share and expanding margin in the aftermarket and service categories.We are seeking a high-energy, results driven professional capable of articulating a strategic vision and executing that vision to deliver business results. You will have a strong entrepreneurial approach, excellent communication and executive presence and be seeking an opportunity to grow and develop with a market-leading diversified industrial company.This position reports to the VP – Marketing and Product Management, with frequent direct oversight of the Executive Leadership Team.A successful candidate will be responsible for: Development of a comprehensive Aftermarket and Service growth strategy.  Utilizing best practices in ecommerce, digital marketing, CRM, and sales/channel management Conduct comprehensive and detailed competitive market analysis, identifying competitive threats and developing mitigation actions as countermeasures.  Prospect, develop and close business with new and existing customers.  Meet or exceed annual sales targets for both Aftermarket and Service.  Regularly travel to perform customer consultations to determine needs and solutions and obtain VOC used to identify new products and services. Travel up to 50%.  Prepare and give value-based technical presentations to explain to customers how the products and services work and the impact to their facilities.  Work with the customers and Engineers, Plant Managers, and Maintenance Teams to ensure the products and service meet their needs.  Communicate and train the sales channel to equip them to sell Aftermarket and Service.  Secure orders, guarantee product standards, and assure product delivery.  Plan for modifications to products to meet consumer demands.  Help customers solve their productivity challenges.  Recommend new and improved aftermarket and service products to our customers and explain how their facilities will be cost-effective. A qualified candidate will be proactive, dedicated, and possess these basic requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or Marketing. MBA desired.  An entrepreneurial mindset approach to drive category growth.  Demonstrated experience using ecommerce, CRM, and digital marketing to drive business growth.  8+ years Sales, Marketing, Product Management or other relevant experience in a technical B2B company Confidence presenting to and persuading plant-level manufacturing customers.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to manage pivotal relationships with stakeholders and leaders across the organization.  Proven results identifying business opportunities and a track record as a deal closer in highly technical sales markets.  Significant personal motivation, goal orientation, diligence, and attention to detail. Excellent negotiation, communication and presentation skills.  Experience networking and building relationships with clients, customers and suppliers.  Plastics industry product experience is a plus. Metrics: Strategy Development and Execution Revenue and Margin Growth in Aftermarket and Service

We provide a career path that rewards performance with growth and opportunity. Our benefits package is designed to support your well-being and professional development, all while working in an environment that fosters teamwork and innovation.Make Your MarkAre you ready to fuel our growth and your career? If you're a motivated individual with a dynamic blend of skills and experiences outlined above, we want to hear from you. We value each other, love our country, and support our troops and first responders.While we respect everyone's freedoms and liberties, we do so while protecting our company culture. Our company is led by a fearless, faith-based, freedom first, American-loving patriot who won't tolerate woke mobs and cancel culture. We will never ask a member of our team to put on a mask or take an experimental jab just to keep your job. We take pride in our commitment to quality, efficiency, and customer satisfaction. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a skilled and motivated Production Team Leader to join our team and help us achieve our production goals.Our client's core values: (These guide how we hire, fire and promote)Go above and beyondLive with integrityWork with efficiencyCommunicate with clarityAct with intentionalityProduction Supervisor Role:As a Production Supervisor, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and managing our production processes. You will be responsible for leading a small team of assembly workers, ensuring that production targets are met, and maintaining high-quality standards. This role requires strong leadership skills, excellent communication skills, fantastic interpersonal skills, strong technical and computer skills, and the willingness to operate warehouse equipment and get your hands dirty when your team needs a hand..Production Supervisor Responsibilities:Team Leadership: Lead, motivate, and supervise a team of assembly workers, fostering a culture of teamwork, safety, and productivity. If you don't have amazing interpersonal skills, please don't apply. Production Oversight: Monitor and manage the assembly process to ensure that production targets, quality standards, and deadlines are consistently met. Training and Development: Provide training and guidance to team members, ensuring they have the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in their roles. Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce quality control procedures to maintain high product quality and prevent defects. Process Improvement: Continuously seek ways to improve production efficiency, reduce waste, and optimize resources. Inventory Management: Keep track of inventory levels, and collaborate with the supply chain team to ensure materials and components are readily available. Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and standards to create a safe working environment for all team members. Reporting: Prepare and submit regular reports on production performance, challenges, and improvements to the management team. Problem Solving: Address any production issues, conflicts, or disruptions in a timely and effective manner. Communication: Foster clear and open communication within the team and between departments to ensure a smooth production process. About You:High school diploma or equivalent; a bachelor's degree in a related field is a plus. Previous experience in a production or assembly role with a minimum of 5 years. Proven leadership experience with the ability to motivate and guide a team. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to make decisions under pressure. Knowledge of quality control processes and procedures. Proficiency in using computers, iPads, production management software and tools. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Understanding of safety regulations and a commitment to maintaining a safe work environment. Attention to detail and a focus on process improvement. The ability to operate forklift, Walkie stacker, pallet jack. Strong mechanical mechanical knowledgeAbility to move boxes weighing up to 50 pounds. Ability to work while standing, walking, bending or twisting for long portions of the day. Reliable TransportationAdditional Information:401(k) matchingHealth insuranceHealth savings accountPaid time off#INDRBR#ZRBR

Job DescriptionDay and Night Shift available. Schedule: Day- 5am- 5pmNight- 5pm-5amInspecting Machined parts and wellhead/Frac equipment.JOB SUMMARY: Inspects and audits the processes and product to ensure they conform to the company’s quality standards. Performs a variety of inspection tasks to determine compliance including receiving, in process and final inspection of parts, subassemblies and finished assembled products.Required as the primary job function, Experience with Precision Measuring Tools performing Geometric Dimension & Tolerance inspection of machined parts, to detailed blueprints, with additional desired skill with CMM, Faro, Calypso/CAM2 or other CMM experience. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Essential duties and responsibilities include the following.Practice safe work habits and comply with all quality, safety, health and environmental policies, procedures, programs and regulations. Visual and dimensional inspection of wellhead and valve components to ensure conformance to Engineering drawings and specifications. Perform in-process inspection for setout/staged equipmentPerforming Final Inspection of all outgoing equipmentCompletes quality documentation accurately and legiblyVerification of job packages for complete signoffsMeasure dimensions using precision instrumentsHardness test partsReports time against jobsProcessing Nonconformance Reports (NCR) at location. Assisting with Field Performance Report (FPR) investigationsProcessing Engineering Change Notices (ECN) including inspecting inventory and processing NCR’sPerform other regular duties as assigned or requested. REQUIREMENTS:EDUCATION, TRAINING, EXPERIENCE:High School diploma or general education degree (GED): or a minimum of 2 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Required as the primary job function, Experience with Precision Measuring Tools performing Geometric Dimension & Tolerance inspection of machined parts, to detailed blueprints, with additional desired skill with CMM, Faro, Calypso/CAM2 or other CMM experience. CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:None RequiredAdditional desired skill, ASNT Level II MT and PT, not the primary job function. Additional desired skill, AWS CWI, not the primary job function. JOB KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:Working knowledge of Quality Systems, Mechanical, Electronic and Hydraulic experience. Proficient in dimensional inspection of wellhead and valve components. Must understand, use and properly apply dimensional inspection equipment such as tape measures, scales, OD and ID micrometers, calipers, depth gages, thread inspection equipment of all types. Ability to read and interpret wellhead and valve component engineering drawings, Basic Computer Skills, Basic Language Skills, Strong Mathematical Skills and Basic Reasoning Ability. Must perform and pass an annual eye test. Strong math skill and proficient readingKnowledge of Quality SystemSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: This job has no supervisory responsibilities.PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Regularly required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. Regularly lift and /or move up to 10 pounds, frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential function.Normally work in an inspection and assembly area. Occasionally may be exposed to hazards such as loud noise, heavy equipment, temperature extremes, toxic and caustic chemicals; risk of electrical shock. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Disclaimer: This job description indicates the general nature and level of work expected of the incumbent. It is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the incumbent. Incumbent may, and probably will be asked to perform other duties as required. Each employee, regardless of classification, is required to maintain a safe, orderly and clean workplace, using safety precautions and observing safety rules at all times.Cactus Wellhead is an equal opportunity employer. Cactus Wellhead prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type. It affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Job DescriptionPharmacy TechnicianFairfax VAMUST:The Pharmacy Tech should have the following:Licensed as a Pharmacy Tech in the state of Virginia1+year of experience working in a healthcare facility1+ year of experience preparing and mixing IV bags1+year of experience compounding solutionsExperience Working With Chemotherapy Solutions PreferredWilling to get an IV Certification as well as an Oncology Certification if not currently certifiedDUTIES:The Duties of the Pharmacy Tech include but are not limited to the following:Prepare and mix IV bagsCompound medications and review labels in detail for accuracyEnter information regarding compounds into EMRReturn and dispose medications properlyMaintain and update inventory and store as requiredCalculate doses appropriatelyAdvocate for patients and their safetyManage supplies for the preparation of IV bagsDocument detailed information in EMRManage clinical research products according to SOPs, GCP, and GMPAssist with preparing documentation for auditsScan protocol documents into EMR clinical research system

Job DescriptionWe are seeking individuals with previous retail experience preferably gained within a high end or luxury market. This position plays a critical role in being the first client interaction, greeting clients warmly and maintaining the flow of traffic.Qualifications:**Passion for Flowers:** A genuine love and appreciation for flowers and floral arrangements is essential to inspire customers and provide expert advice. **Customer Service Skills:** Strong interpersonal and communication skills to assist customers, answer their questions, and create a positive shopping experience. Bilingual - English/Spanish Proficiency is required. **Product Knowledge:** In-depth knowledge of various types of flowers, plants, and floral arrangements, including their care and maintenance. **Creative Eye:** Ability to assist customers in selecting or customizing floral arrangements that suit their needs, occasions, and preferences. **Sales Experience:** Experience in a retail sales role is strongly preferred. **Adaptability:** Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, especially during peak floral seasons like holidays and special occasions. **Team Player:** Collaborate effectively with colleagues to ensure a smooth workflow and contribute to the overall success of the store. **Basic Math Skills:** Ability to handle cash transactions, calculate prices, and provide accurate change. **Availability:** Flexibility in work hours, including weekends and holidays, as flower sales often peak during these times. **Customer-Focused Attitude:** Dedication to making customers feel valued and satisfied with their purchases. **Professional Appearance:** Maintain a neat and presentable appearance, including adhering to a dress code if applicable. **Computer Skills:** Basic computer skills. **Positive Attitude:** A cheerful and positive demeanor is crucial for creating a welcoming and inviting atmosphere in the boutique. ResponsibilitiesAs a Client Advisor and Sales Associate, you will be an ambassador of the Brand, ensuring that every Client is treated according to the J'Adore Les Fleurs promise. The ideal person for this position will manifest the JLF promise to build a genuine relationship and cherish the Client’s time spent at the our boutiques or over the phone. Must have appreciation for art, beauty and luxury. Facilitate in the seamless client experience by warmly greeting clients upon arrival or on the phone and sharing relevant information regarding our products and services. The Client/Floral Advisor will play a crucial role of consistently providing a superior level of service to clients, while increasing client conversion and retention, to drive business revenue, and inspire brand loyalty. Provide honest and confident feedback to customers about style of flowers and advice on the best floral arrangement for the occasion. Lead the development of new customers, converting walk-in traffic to clients and brand ambassadors by creating energy, excitement and desire around the product and brand. Optimize the client experience through providing clients with prompt, professional, warm and courteous service. Build genuine relationships with clients through thoughtful and consistent outreach. Build lasting relationships with customers. Demonstrate a can-do attitude in every situation to constantly raise the level of service provided and consistently exceed client expectations. Maintain consistent follow up with clients regarding orders and delivery times. By striving to discover your Clients and their every need you will tailor their experience within our store in order to elevate their experience and impression of JLF while also ensuring to build long lasting relationships which will be maintained through the usage of our in-house clientele tools and systems. Company DescriptionOver the past seven and a half years, J’adore Les Fleurs has built a reputation for being the go-to florist amongst the high-standard fashion set consumers, meaning they don’t shy away from the most intricate details to ensure perfection each time you bring home your JLF bouquet. In those years in business, the company has grown increasingly dominant in its space with a crystal clear roadmap that stems from the high demand amongst A-list celebrities and huge collaborative efforts with well-known fashion and beauty brands. These collaborative efforts have served the likes of companies such as L’Oréal, Prada, Tiffany, Gucci, Anastasia Beverly Hills, Two-Face, Morphe, Fabletics, and more. In doing so, J’adore Les Fleurs has honed their ability to reflect the sender’s taste like none other, striving to stay consistent with their brand color schemes through the colors of their flowers, hat boxes, other containers, and more! Regardless of the extensive clientele list from world-renowned companies and massive A-list stars, their attention to detail reflects the level of care each J’adore Les Fleurs Bouquet receives – hence the importance of personalization and customized design is of utmost importance to the company. About LumidaLumida is an innovative SEC-registered investment advisor, pioneering in blending alternative investments with a focus on health and community. Our mission, "Invest Beyond the Ordinary," reflects our commitment to offering exceptional investment opportunities.The OpportunityWe are seeking a research analyst who is expected to conduct in-depth research to support decision-making and strategic planning by the CIO Team. This role will involve consuming and generating research and analysis across macro, company earnings, and digital assets.The work also includes monitoring of investment themes, trends, performing competitive analysis, and supporting the research activities of the CIO team.Background in finance, economics, or quantitative or engineering fields is a must.Core ResponsibilitiesAssist/Conduct research on various topics (eg., macro, sector views, company earnings, protocol research, etc.) and contribute to our newsletter and other written publicationsBuild and maintain Lumida ‘chartbooks’ covering Macro, Crypto, Banking Sector, and various Investment Themes.Remain up-to-date on market trends through extensive reading and research, translating insights into actionable strategies.Consume a vast quantity of research and generate notes from select podcasts, buy-side and sell-side research, select company earnings call, protocol reports, and create meeting minutes from our monthly CIO process.Monitor portfolio net exposures to sectors, factors, and investment themes, suggesting exposure adjustments as necessary.Track the performance of thematic baskets, such as meme stocks, biotech stocks, bitcoin-sensitive equities, GLP1s, China-focused stocks, and heavily shorted stocks and generate a daily narrativeImplement long and short strategies developed by our research and portfolio management team.Actively review portfolios for tax loss harvesting opportunities and implement strategic substitutions.Assist with trade analysis – slippage and order executionMaintain a culture of personal accountability and strive for excellence in market performance.Candidate ProfilePassion for markets and investing, and ability to operate on a decentralized research basis.1-3 years of experience in a professional work environment.A background in finance, economics, or a technical engineering field is beneficial.Strong analytical ability and excellent written communication skills.Strong preference for candidates pursuing CFA Charter.Adept and fluent with Google Sheets, GPT prompting, and other trading tools, Koyfin, Trading ViewHistory of high achievement in demanding environments, such as athletics.Open to various levels of experience, with a deep commitment to mastering financial markets.Joining LumidaAt Lumida, you will join a team that values the holistic growth of both clients and employees. We offer an environment conducive to continuous learning, intellectual development, and impactful community engagement, all built on a foundation of exceptional investment expertise.Contact usPlease send your CV and cover letter to - diana@lumida.comDeadline: 12th April, 2024

job title: IT Know it All Field Technician
full description: Job DescriptionWe would like to offer you an opportunity to tell other people how to use their computers. You can show them how much you know, and how little they do. Afterwards you can make jokes about the users and enjoy the laughter of our team. You can do all of that in the picturesque Five-Towns area of Long Island.You would be showing off your knowledge with the followingMicrosoft Windows – All versions. *If you claim to know Windows NT you will be tested thoroughlyMicrosoft Office * Open Office doesn’t count, even if everyone knows it’s faster, better, etc etc etcNetworks, Firewalls, Switches. *Yes, we know you set one of those up for your aunt’s dog walkerVirus / Spyware Removal *Computers get those on their own, even when users didn’t do anything wrongMastery of English Language * How else would you be able to show off your knowledge?At times you will have to visit the people in person, for that you would need a CAR and a VALID DRIVER’S LICENSES. Sometimes you will even have to bring them some equipment to replace what they broke, so you need to be able to lift up to 40lb, we will test that, so start working out!If this sounds like a perfect way for you to spend your day, send us a description of what you know and have already done, and how much you want to get paid to do so.We even have a website dkent.netWe don’t care if you are green, blue or purple, we do not discriminate.Company DescriptionDK’s Enterprises, an established (25 years) Managed IT services firm, has an immediate opening. We are the outsourced IT department for our clients.DK’s Enterprises, an established (25 years) Managed IT services firm, has an immediate opening. We are the outsourced IT department for our clients.

company: AMPP: Association for Materials Protection and Performance
full description: SummaryJob DescriptionManages the accounting and treasury function for AMPP and its affiliated organizations. Promotes diligent financial stewardship for the organizations. Serves as a business partner to all department leaders.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Financial Oversight, Operations, and ManagementOversees the financial operations of the organization including, but not limited to: timeliness of financial and accounting records, organization’s cash flow, daily accounting activities, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Inventory, and G/L, to ensure compliance with US GAAP. Oversees the month-end, quarter-end, and year-end accounting close to ensure timely completion and accurate accounting. Manages the year-end audit for all AMPP entities and maintains a good working relationship with external auditors. Works closely with FP&A on monthly financial reports, and annual budgeting and forecasting efforts Oversees the treasury function including monthly cash forecast to ensure financial resources are handled and accounted for properlyManages, reviews, and recommends changes in accounting systems in coordination with the IT Team on various operational applications and systems Serves as the team lead for implementing the new Financial Management System (FMS) and in working cross-functionally as well as with the CFO and the accounting & finance team, to ascertain a successful implementation. Safeguards assets and financial resources by implementing disciplines of internal controls and auditsReviews financial statements and monthly management reporting package to ensure accuracy prior to publishingPrepares reports/PowerPoint slides of financial performance for presentation at Finance Committee meetingsWorks with product/service owners to ensure business operations are adequately supported in regards to accounting and financial reportingResearches technical accounting issues relating to non-profit organizations (e.g. FASB statements, bulletins, and interpretations) and serves as an advisor to staff on non-profit accounting, reporting, and auditingProvides support and oversight to chapter financial operations. Ensures consistency in financial practices across all chapters globally. Coordinates and consolidate chapter financial reports for global analysis. Ensures compliance with federal, state, and local legal requirements. Develops and implements internal controls to mitigate financial risks. Oversees the preparation and filing of tax returns and other financial compliance documents. Develops and maintains accounting policies, and monitors practices to ensure complianceOversees the documentation of accounting processes and procedures to facilitate staff training and supportIdentifies, develops, implements, and oversees process improvements to maximize efficiencySUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILTIES Carries out management responsibilities for the Accounting staff in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.Team Leadership and DevelopmentManage and mentor finance department staff. Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the finance team. Qualification RequirementsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION And EXPERIENCEBachelor’s degree in Accounting, required (Master’s degree preferred). CPA, required. A minimum of 10 years in accounting, preferably for a non-profit organization. Must have experience with nonprofit chapter accounting, compliance, and reporting; as well as global/international accounting, preferably in an association. Must have a strong understanding of international accounting practices. Strong leadership and team management abilities. Experience should be within a corporate environment similar in complexity as AMPP. Experience in international operations, as well as accounting systems implementation is a plus. Company DescriptionAre you ready to embark on a career that does more than just meet expectations—it transforms them? At AMPP, we're not just a team, we're a community bound by a shared commitment to excellence, innovation, and a culture we call CLASS: Connect, Listen, Anticipate, Simplify, and Serve. Our mission is to society, assets and the environment from the effects of corrosion. We are driven by a passion to create lasting impact. We offer more than jobs; we offer journeys—enriched with competitive benefits, a supportive environment, and opportunities that will not only shape your career but also the way you see the world.Are you ready to embark on a career that does more than just meet expectations—it transforms them? Required Qualifications2+ years of programming experience in languages such as Python, Java, SQL 2+ years of experience with ETL tools and database management (relational, non-relational) 2+ years of experience in data modeling techniques and tools to design efficient scalable data structures Skills in data quality assessment, data cleansing, and data validation Preferred QualificationsKnowledge of big data technologies and cloud platforms Experience with technologies like PySpark, Databricks, and Azure Synapse. Job DescriptionJob Description The Purchasing Manager will manage procurement of all site material (including subcontracts), equipment and services necessary for manufacturing and ensures efficient movement of materials required for meeting production schedules. Promote positive employee relations and adherence to company policies and procedures. Ability to work as a team Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work with demanding customers on a daily basis. Familiarity with computerized management systems such as ERP/MRP and familiarity with AS400 system is a plus. At Tecton , we are on a mission to bring Machine Learning to every customer and product interaction on the planet. We build an enterprise-grade, world-class Feature Platform – the infrastructure that powers real-time ML applications and systems in production.Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.Tecton is funded by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Kleiner Perkins, along with strategic investments from Snowflake and Databricks. We have a fast-growing team that’s distributed around the world, with offices in San Francisco and New York City. Our team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at leading tech companies like Uber, Google, Meta, Airbnb, Lyft, and Twitter.As a member of Tecton’s Infrastructure Engineering DevOps team, you will contribute to and own the foundation for building, automating, and scaling Tecton. You will leverage your experience with cloud architectures, distributed systems, containerization technologies (Kubernetes), and Linux system internals to design, build, and maintain our multi-cloud deployments, ensure our systems are secure in-depth, and work closely with the rest of Tecton’s Infrastructure Engineering team to scale and optimize our core compute and online serving systems.Prior experience with machine learning is not required. We are looking for exceptional DevOps, infrastructure, and software engineers who are driven to find simple solutions to complex challenges. Position Overview:Reporting to the Director of Reimbursement, the Customer Service Manager is responsible for the oversight of all customer service teams and initiatives, including organizing, preparing, and disseminating information, along with implementing policies or updates to policies based on findings. The Customer Service Manager will provide training for new hires or existing staff transitioning to the customer service team. The Customer Service Manager will oversee bad debt and patient collection practices, as well as general communication with patients. This role will provide level 2 support in response to escalated customer service issues and requests. This role will mentor staff, create a positive and inviting culture, build team spirit, and ensure that patients are provided with an outstanding customer service experience while providing helpful guidance towards solutions.Responsibilities:Manage patient account representatives to ensure that the CBO’s vision and culture is being adhered to at all times. Serves as the point person regarding customer service inquiries and escalations. Responsible for pulling all requested information in conjunction with bad debt processes and disseminating the items to the appropriate parties. Implements process recommendations, updates policies, and monitors corrective action.Tracks performance and productivity for the customer service team and leads initiatives for improvement in efficiency and quality.Handles a high volume of in and outbound patient phone calls. Manages multiple projects simultaneously and resolve issues identified.Resolves patient and staff inquiries, requests, and complaints in a manner that reflects empathy, support, respect, and professionalism at the core of ever interaction. Escalates complaints and recurring issues to the attention of the department director.Responsible to drive culture in a positive and professional manner, building team cohesion, and employee engagement.Other duties as assigned.Required Skills:Requirements:5+ years of previous RCM management experience in a large multi-specialty group, an Ambulatory Surgical Center or Outpatient hospital preferred.Demonstrates competence in management and leadership skills to develop and implement organizational strategies and opportunities for improving ASC growth.Maintain current knowledge and adhere to appropriate regulatory standards such as Medicare.Must be able to multi-task and handle competing priorities while meeting or exceeding deadlines.The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with internal and external clients. Expert level experience with Microsoft Office Products- ability to create and build spreadsheets and reports in Excel. Strong technological understanding and appreciation for the automation of all functions related to the revenue cycle, and the engagement of the customer in that automated process. Experience working collaboratively with IT will be important.

This includes the utilization of metrics and systems to validate all project benefits.Provide input for the annual budget and assess monthly spend to plan (wages, travel expenses, training, etc.)TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)Demonstrated knowledge and experience in the application of Continuous Improvement methodology in both traditional and transactional processes. Lean, Six Sigma, Design for Six Sigma, and Theory of Constraints.Expert in data collection systems, data analysis and statistics including Gauge R&Rs studies, Statistical Process Control and Process Capability.Strong verbal and written communication skills, including training and “Train the Trainer” experience.Proficient in Statistical Software tools such as MinitabEducation And ExperienceBachelor’s degree (B.S.) in a technical discipline (engineering, etc.) from a four-year college or university required.Minimum of six years’ experience in a leadership position, preferably in a manufacturing or engineering environment interacting with other disciplines throughout the company including Operations, IT, R&D, Legal, etc.Lean Six Sigma Black Belt required. Master Black Belt or Project Management Certification preferred.Experience with SAP, Business Objects, & Business Warehouse desirableWANT TO LEARN MORE? How You Will Make a Difference:Provide project management and technical Lean and Six Sigma guidance to business leadership and operations teams!Multi-site responsibility and influence – High level of business and operations exposure!How you will do it:Strategic implementation and execution of business-critical improvements: Identifying, leading, executing, and training using proven methods and diverse professional experience.ARE YOU READY TO MAKE THE TURN? APPLY TODAY!Inclusion & Diversity: As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, supporting them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.119,200.00 - 149,000.00 - 178,800.00 USD AnnualIf your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying! Their innovative approach focuses on delivering exceptional customer experiences through their web and app products. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact in shaping the future of the platform and driving growth.Key Responsibilities:Lead the product development lifecycle from ideation to execution, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, marketing, and customer support.Define and prioritize product features and enhancements based on market research, user feedback, and business objectives.Develop a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors through data analysis, user research, and competitive analysis.Drive initiatives to improve activation and retention metrics, identifying opportunities to enhance user engagement and satisfaction.Optimize the customer experience across all touchpoints, ensuring a seamless and intuitive journey from browsing to checkout.Implement strategies to foster customer loyalty, including loyalty programs, personalized recommendations, and targeted promotions.Work closely with design and engineering teams to translate product requirements into user-friendly interfaces and technical specifications.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science, or related field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.Proven track record of 3+ years in product management roles, preferably in eCommerce or consumer-facing technology companies.Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and make data-driven decisions.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with diverse stakeholders.Experience leading cross-functional teams and driving projects to successful outcomes.Passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences and driving business growth.

company: City of Chicago Department of Law
full description: JOB ANNOUNCEMENT SUPERVISING PARALEGAL  DEPARTMENT OF LAW Litigation DivisionsThe Department of Law will assign candidates selected for hire to any of these divisions to meet operational needsNumber of Positions: 2 Starting Salary: $74,244.00 Under general supervision, coordinates and supervises the work of paralegals providing paraprofessional legal, administrative, and clerical support to attorneys.Essential Duties Supervises and trains division paralegals while being responsible for own assignment of cases for which supervising paralegal gathers information, drafts discovery answers or documents, and communicates with client departments, witnesses, and outside agencies;  Prioritizes and makes work assignments for staff to ensure that attorneys receive needed support and assistance with caseloads;  Monitors the preparation of legal documents (e.g., summonses, depositions, subpoenas, discovery response, agreements) and related summaries by staff and reviews completed work to ensure accuracy and consistency with departmental policies;  Trains and instructs subordinate staff on paralegal functions, legal research techniques, and departmental operating procedures;  Maintains staff time records;  Reviews and examines legal digests and conducts in-depth legal research for attorneys' use in-court proceedings;  Provides technical assistance to paralegals engaged in abstracting complex transcripts and briefings;  Consults with division attorneys and private counsel to identify, gather, review, and produce discovery materials and facilitate the case discovery process;  Oversees the maintenance of court documents;  Supervises the indexing and filing of court documents, depositions, and/or creates and trains staff on customized computer applications for these purposes;  Creates and supervises the production of visual exhibits (e.g., graphs, tables, charts) used at trial and hearings and develops methods and procedures to display the information as required;  Oversees the filing of court documents for various litigation efforts;  Serves as a liaison with other City departments to facilitate information exchange . Additional Duties May Be Required For This Position.LOCATION:Law DepartmentADDRESS: 2 N. LaSalle StSHIFT:Monday through FridayHOURS: 9:00 am – 5:00 pm THESE POSITIONS ARE IN THE CAREER SERVICE. Job PostingMar 28, 2024, 12:00:00 AMBU10Minimum QualificationsGraduation from an accredited college or university with a bachelor's degree, and a paralegal certificate from a paralegal training program accredited by the American Bar Association, PLUS two years of work experience as a paralegal or legal assistant; or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experience.Preference Will Be Given To Candidates Possessing The Following Previous supervisory experience  Previous experience as a litigation paralegal  Previous experience preparing standard court filings, such as: appearances, subpoenas, notices of filing, discovery responses, FOIA responses, and preservation letters  Proficiency with analyzing, indexing, duplicating, and organizing documents and data produced in discovery  Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat  NOTE:  A copy of your official transcripts, professional license, or training certificates will be required at the time of interview, if applicable. NOTE:  Applicants will be required to provide a writing sample before they come in for an interview. Writing Sample Criteria Applicants Must Submit a Writing Sample Prior To Their Scheduled Interviews. All Writing Samples Submitted In Consideration For Employment Must Comply With The Following Criteria The sample may either be a professional project report, academic project report, an official communication related to a professional or academic project, or a work-related report or communication The writing sample submitted must be no more than five (5) pages The writing sample must be accompanied by a cover page explaining: The sample's original purpose (e.g., a writing class, a professional project, a memorandum for an employer); When (MM/DD/YYYY) and for whom the sample was written; The extent of editing by any third party (if any) If the writing sample is an excerpt from a larger document, identify that larger document and provide context, if necessaryIf an applicant chooses to submit a writing sample containing confidential or privileged information, the applicant must identify the steps taken, (redactions, name changes, or consent from the client or employer) to preserve the confidential or privileged nature of the document.Selection RequirementsThis position requires applicants to complete an interview and submit a writing sample. The interviewed candidate(s) possessing the qualifications best suited to fulfill the responsibilities of the position will be selected.Residency Requirement: All employees of the City of Chicago must be actual residents of the City of Chicago as outlined in Section 2-152-050 of the City of Chicago Municipal Code. Proof of residency will be required.ALL REFERENCES TO POLITICAL SPONSORSHIP OR RECOMMENDATION MUST BE OMITTED FROM ANY AND ALL APPLICATION MATERIALS SUBMITTED FOR CITY EMPLOYMENT.City of Chicago is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Military Friendly Employer. City of ChicagoBrandon JohnsonMayor Applications for this position will be accepted until 11:59 pm CST on April 16, 2024.

If you're looking for dry ice, you'll find it with Airgas. As the largest supplier of dry ice, Airgas has established a series of production plants across the nation to develop a secure source supply. Distribution Branches are located in strategic locations throughout the country to provide service to key industries including universities and labs. Quality, reliability, and service are the key drivers that enable Airgas to grow with organizations who depend on dry ice and cold shipping supplies.JOB PURPOSE: The Plant Manager will be responsible for all manufacturing, safety, training, personnel, maintenance and other activities as required to insure high quality of product and customer satisfaction.DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Managing all plant operations to insure budgetary goals are met or exceeded. Ensure Airgas Dry Ice products meet or exceed our Quality Control standards, using specified SOP testing methods. Responsible for maintaining a safe and clean working environment; Comply with Federal, State and Corporate safety and environmental regulations. Responsible for the maintenance of the facility to include the understanding of and ability to explain basic mechanical theory to direct reports, coordinating vendors, projecting and establishing preventative maintenance programs and schedules, while directing the maintenance staff to insure that all equipment is properly maintained and operational. Effectively manage daily operations in a changing, fast-paced environment with a work force ranging in skill level from temporary workers to highly skilled technicians.Responsible for implementing new and best processes of production. Responsible for process improvement and problem solving to maintain efficient costs and improve quality. Manage any special projects / improvements as directed. Work with other Plant and Branch Managers to ensure accurate and timely delivery of production requirements.Interface with regional sales, management, and customers to ensure high customer satisfaction. Recruit, hire, train, and discipline employees according to corporate guidelines and policies. Ensure timely and accurate data entry related to product sales, purchasing, and receiving of raw materials and supplies. Fulfill all record keeping requirements related to the day-to-day operations in a timely manner to include: shift scheduling, performance evaluations, safety training documentation, disciplinary actions, associate development, and specific job related training. Perform other duties as assigned by upper management.Qualifications, Experience, and AbilitiesA Bachelor's degree in a related field of work is preferred. Equivalent accumulated work experience and/or military experience is eligible for consideration. An Associate's degree or High School diploma with formal technical training in conjunction with extensive relevant experience will also be eligible for consideration.Minimum of 10 years’ experience in a supervisory role of more than 15 production personnel in an industrial environment.Process reliability and/or project engineering background is preferred.Ability to lead, communicate and operate alongside a workforce ranging in skill level from temporary talent, front line employees, various levels of management and senior leadership.Experience driving a best in class safe manufacturing environment, through the creation and implementation of effective plant safety programs is necessary.The candidate must be a self-motivated team player who can communicate with, and relate to, people at all levels within the organization and who has a proven track record for success while operating a Just-In-Time manufacturing operation.Must exhibit a high level of enthusiasm, with a “hands-on style” and a strong work ethic with the capability to adapt to the rapidly changing environment of this fast paced, service oriented company.A firm belief in providing exceptional customer service, with a strong commitment to company values, and building a healthy organization through talent management and people development is an essential quality to be able to successfully fill this role. Flexibility to maintain a Facility operating on a 24/7 schedule.Must be able to work a flexible schedule to meet production requirements and customer expectations; available for on-call as needed.Must be able to stand on hard surfaces for prolonged periods of timeMust be able to safely handle bundles of dry ice of up to 60 lbs.Work Environment60% of the time in an office/administrative setting.40% of the time actively in the plant to be available, engaged and supervising the production team.Plant environment is an unconditioned work space (i.e. warm in summer, cool in winter). Hazards require the use of personal protective equipment (i.e. hard hat, safety glasses, hearing protection, and safety shoes). Dry ice is extremely cold, and therefore requires that gloves be worn when directly handling dry ice. Looking for a great company to work for? You’ll Find It With Us! Airgas LLC offers a competitive compensation and excellent benefits package, which includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Prescription Drug, Life & Disability Insurance, 401(k, Tuition Reimbursement and more.

Job DescriptionAre you a detail-oriented Quality Control (QC) professional with a passion for excellence and a background in aerospace, aviation, or military parts? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to take your career to new heights!Join a leading company in the aerospace and defense industry where your expertise will play a pivotal role in maintaining the highest standards of quality for products that are critical to national security and aviation safety. We are seeking individuals with a keen eye for detail, a strong understanding of quality control processes, and experience in aerospace, aviation, or military parts to ensure our products meet and exceed industry standards. Job DescriptionABOUT AGNEWe are the largest retailer-owned, wholesale grocery Distribution Center in New England, making us a profitable and stable company. We are dedicated to serving the needs of independent grocers. We also put our employees first. As a member of our team, we offer you a supportive employee environment, stable employment with opportunities for growth, and a full benefits package.We are currently looking for a Safety Specialist in our Risk Management/Loss Prevention department. This is a full-time position, Monday to Friday, 8am - 5pm. As a safety specialist you will be responsible for assisting with the development, implementation and adherence to company safety, drug & alcohol programs, and environmental programs to ensure the safety for employees and visitors. The person in this role ensures compliance with applicable company policies and local, state, and federal regulations and conducts safety & environmental inspections, accident investigations, and safety training.This position requires on-site work at our Pembroke, NH office. Unfortunately, we are unable to provide relocation assistance at this time. Candidates must be local or willing to relocate at their own expense. POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES/ACCOUNTABILITIES:Ensures regulatory compliance as mandated by local, state, and federal agencies including the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) State of NH, DES, EPA, and local agencies. Participates in the Company’s Incident Review Board. Assist with management of the administration, planning, and development of the worker’s compensation insurance program and claim activities for all AGNE locations. Represents AGNE and AG Supermarkets in the coordination of providing information to claimants, adjusters, attorneys, and insurance companies. Conducts routine and follow-up safety and hazard inspections of all company facilities. Assists with annual operating budgets and provides fiscal direction. Ensures building maintenance is in compliance with DES and EPA regulations. Analyzes accident and incident reports for trends. Makes recommendations and/or takes action for correcting unsafe conditions and actions. Assists with the development and implementation of policies and procedures consistent with those of the company to ensure efficient and safe operations of all company facilities. Maintain plans and assists with training for Emergency Response. Serves as facility Emergency Response Coordinator. Provides senior management with data necessary for the Company to negotiate the most favorable and cost-effective coverage of workers’ compensation insurance. Leads company safety committees for all locations. Represents the company to internal departments of AGNE, and externally to governmental agencies. Responds to emergency situations and prepares reports of findings and submits recommendations. Keeps abreast of pending regulatory developments through reference sources; obtains insight on legislative agendas at state and federal levels. Performs other duties as assigned or required. ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: Bachelor's degree with 4 years experiences directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified. Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community. Strong understanding of environmental safety regulations. Knowledge of federal, state, and local safety regulations, protocols, and/or procedures. Strong presentation skills needed. Ability to develop, implement, and enforce safety programs, procedures, and protocols. Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations. Skill in performing safety inspections and ensuring compliance with OSHA safety standards. Ability to investigate and analyze information and to draw conclusions. Knowledge and understanding of the principles and procedures for the investigation and processing of workers compensation insurance claims. Ability to use independent judgment and to manage and impart confidential information. Ability to prioritize workflow and meet deadlines. NON-ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCE: Certified Safety Professional (CSP).PHYSICAL DEMANDS & WORK ENVIRONMENT:Work involves moderate exposure to unusual elements, such as extreme temperatures, dirt, dust, fumes, smoke, unpleasant odors, and/or loud noises. Physically able to conduct inspections. Light physical effort. Requires handling of average-weight objects up to 10 pounds or some standing or walking. Effort applies to no more than two (2) hours per day. Work environment involves some exposure to hazards or physical risks, which require the following basic safety precautions. GREAT CAREERS START WITH A SUPPORTIVE WORKPLACE!Here at Associated Grocers, we achieve our mission through integrity, a supportive employee environment, concern for the communities we serve, efficient and innovative operations, and a commitment to excellence. AGNE is recognized in New Hampshire as an employer of choice. We attract great people, with great passion working for a great purpose. Employees who build a career at AGNE enjoy:Medical/dental/vision insuranceHealth savings account with employer contribution401K matchProfit sharing programFlexible spending accountLife and AD&D insuranceTuition reimbursementEmployee purchase programEmployee assistance programPaid time offVacation time offPaid holidays/personal/sick daysComputer purchase programVolunteerism policyWell-being program with incentivesCommittee ParticipationAnd more! Join our dynamic team today, click "Apply Now" and if your application is selected, we will give you a call to discuss the job, and your skillsets in greater detail.Company DescriptionAssociated Grocers of New England, Inc., was organized in February 1946 by an enterprising group of 18 Independent Retailers who resolved to form a company with greater purchasing power than they could realize individually. It first operated as New Hampshire Wholesale Grocers in an 18,000-square-foot warehouse facility in Concord, New Hampshire. From the start, these retailers recognized an opportunity to build upon their own mutual strength. It wasn't long until they changed the operating structure of the company to form a purchasing and distribution cooperative known as Associated Grocers of New England, Inc.In 2006, the current, state of the art, 380,000 square foot Distribution Center constructed on 74 acres in Pembroke, New Hampshire became AG New England's home. The design of this new facility effectively doubled the capacity to expand and enhance product offerings. The property allows for future building expansion to upwards of 650,000 square feet.This impressive facility offers retailers an expansive variety of products as well as retail support services such as advertising, marketing, merchandising, store design, equipment, bookkeeping and retail systems. A dedicated team of 300 plus employees services over 600 independent retailers in the six-state New England region and Upstate New York/Albany area.Associated Grocers of New England, Inc., was organized in February 1946 by an enterprising group of 18 Independent Retailers who resolved to form a company with greater purchasing power than they could realize individually. It first operated as New Hampshire Wholesale Grocers in an 18,000-square-foot warehouse facility in Concord, New Hampshire. From the start, these retailers recognized an opportunity to build upon their own mutual strength. It wasn't long until they changed the operating structure of the company to form a purchasing and distribution cooperative known as Associated Grocers of New England, Inc. In 2006, the current, state of the art, 380,000 square foot Distribution Center constructed on 74 acres in Pembroke, New Hampshire became AG New England's home. The design of this new facility effectively doubled the capacity to expand and enhance product offerings. The property allows for future building expansion to upwards of 650,000 square feet. This impressive facility offers retailers an expansive variety of products as well as retail support services such as advertising, marketing, merchandising, store design, equipment, bookkeeping and retail systems. A dedicated team of 300 plus employees services over 600 independent retailers in the six-state New England region and Upstate New York/Albany area.

Research Skills: Ability to conduct in-depth research and gather information from credible sources. Creativity: Capacity to generate innovative and engaging content ideas. Adaptability: Capability to adapt writing style and tone to suit different audiences and platforms. SEO Knowledge: Familiarity with SEO best practices and keyword optimization techniques. Time Management: Efficiently manage multiple projects and meet deadlines. Collaboration: Work well within a team, accepting feedback and contributing to the creative process. Portfolio: A portfolio showcasing previous writing work and expertise is often beneficial. A bachelor's degree in English, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, or related fields is typically preferred but not always mandatory. Proven experience as a content writer, copywriter, or related role is advantageous, whether through internships, freelance work, or employment. Benefits:Generous 401(k) Matching: HFB provides a robust 401(k) plan with a 100% match for the first 3% of an employee's contributions and a 50% match for the next 2%. Comprehensive Health Coverage: Access to health insurance to ensure the well-being of our team members. Employer Contribution to HSA: HFB contributes towards the Health Savings Account (HSA), promoting financial health. Dental and Vision Coverage: Enjoy the benefits of dental and vision insurance for a complete healthcare package. Life Insurance: HFB provides life insurance coverage, demonstrating our commitment to the security of our employees. Company Performance Bonus Plan: In addition to competitive salaries, employees are eligible for a bonus plan based on company performance. Paid Time Off (PTO): Take advantage of our PTO policy to maintain work-life balance and recharge. Paid Holidays: Celebrate 11 paid holidays throughout the year, giving you time to relax and enjoy special moments. Job DescriptionGL Seaman & Company is adding a Project Manager to its Interior Construction team representing DIRTT Environmental Solutions. DIRTT is the leader in pre-fabricated custom interior construction including walls, floors, ceilings, modular power and networks. We create beautiful workspaces. We provide extraordinary service to our clients, and we believe in hiring the best talent. If you have experience in interior construction, we'd like to hear from you.The Interior Construction Project Manager is responsible for bringing the customers’ vision to reality. They will represent our business interests on job sites ensuring a positive customer experience from start to finish. Success is achieved by being detail-oriented, hardworking, responsible, resourceful, and pro-active with a can-do attitude and problem-solving nature. You must be a self-starter, possess an energetic personality, think on your feet, work well independently and in conjunction with the Interior Construction team and be committed to creating extraordinary customer experiences.The Construction Project Manager is involved in the project from the start to consult with general contractors and other vendors to keep things moving smoothly. They will simultaneously manage multiple projects from order acceptance through the completion of the project. They will represent DIRTT by GL Seaman at the job-site by providing a stellar customer experience and ensuring the installation is carried out seamlessly.Working closely with the Sales Associate and Designer, and often times, the customer or customers’ general contractor, the Project Manager will facilitate all aspects of installation for our clients. This roles requires exceptional attention to detail while overseeing multiple jobs with various deadlines.Key Responsibilities include:Review and understand production drawings for accuracy with a thorough understanding of entire scope of projectManage all aspects of project schedulesManage all aspects of installation and deliveryServe as primary on-site contactConduct site surveys and verify field dimensions for accuracyUnderstand all local code requirements including construction, millwork, and power/dataManage project costs through RFI/change order processesRecord and submit deficiencies to the manufacturerCommunicate with clients, general contractors, and other project managersDedicate to learning DIRTT capabilities and project execution proceduresPossess a high HQ – “Hospitality Quotient” – we are in the service business – making others feel good, makes you feel good. Preferred Qualifications:Experience with prefab/modular solutions (walls, floors, power/data, etc.) a plusAbility to read and interpret construction drawings and floor plansExpertise in construction methodology and the building processPracticed and positive interpersonal and organizational skills with ability to foster and leverage relationships; comfortable interfacing with clients, architects, general contractors, vendors and internal teamAble to multitask efficiently in fast-paced environment with a sense of urgencyMust be extremely organized, with good time management skills and the ability to work independentlyExceptional customer service skills with a passion to provide solutions to meet client needsMust be results oriented with focus on accomplishments and long and short-term goalsExcellent written and oral communication skillsIntermediate fluency of Microsoft Office Suite; experience with AutoCAD or other 3D software a plusAssociate or Bachelor’s degree in Project Management, or Construction preferred2-3 years minimum experience, or in a related industry a plus3 years Construction background is preferredThis is a fluid position in/out of the office requiring reliable transportation to travel to local client locations, job sites, etc.Company Hours: M-F 8:30am-5:00pm | This is a fulltime, exempt, salaried position. | Generous Benefits AvailableCompany DescriptionAbout GL Seaman & Company | www.glsc.comGL Seaman & Company is a Platinum Award Winning MillerKnoll Certified Dealer and preferred partner for DIRTT prefabricated construction solutions. For nearly four decades, GL Seaman remains committed to providing extraordinary customer experiences and representing the highest quality office furnishings and interior constructions options available. Rich in design heritage, MillerKnoll continues to create timeless modern office furniture.DIRTT Environmental Solutions offers highly customizable, sustainable architectural interiors that can be reconfigured easily to meet changing space planning needs. Leveraging technology to bring to life new construction practices, DIRTT solutions improve not only the way people build and interact with their surroundings, but they also drastically reduce construction waste and are flexible to meet ever-changing client demands.As one of the largest full services dealers in the Southwest, GL Seaman & Company works tirelessly at maintaining its standing as one of the top dealerships in North America. We offer competitive salaries and many generous benefits.GL Seaman & Company is an inclusive Equal Opportunity Employer.
