SQL Developer - Remote Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $55K - $65KA valid work permit is necessary in the US/CanadaAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Description:As an SQL Developer, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and optimizing database solutions, enabling efficient data storage, retrieval, and manipulation. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver effective solutions that meet our clients needs. This is a unique opportunity to work on diverse projects, tackle complex data challenges, and make a significant impact in the world of data.Responsibilities:Collaborate with stakeholders to gather data requirements and translate them into efficient SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions. Design, develop, and maintain database schemas, ensuring data integrity, security, and performance. Write complex SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes. Optimize SQL queries and database performance, identifying and resolving bottlenecks and inefficiencies. Develop data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure accuracy and reliability. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate SQL code into applications and reporting systems. Conduct data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decisions. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in SQL and database technologies. Requirements:Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as an SQL Developer or Database Developer, working with complex databases. Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases (e.g., MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server). Solid understanding of database design principles, data modeling, and normalization. Proficiency in writing complex SQL queries, stored procedures, and functions. Experience with performance optimization and tuning of SQL queries and database indexing. Familiarity with ETL processes and tools (e.g., SSIS, Informatica) is a plus. Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and dimensional modeling is desirable. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to analyze complex data requirements. Excellent attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions. Effective communication and collaboration skills to work with cross-functional teams. Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.The pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Headquartered in Westfield, Massachusetts, Savage Arms has been producing firearms for more than 125 years. Savage is one of the world's largest manufacturers of hunting, competition and targeting shooting centerfire and rimfire rifles, and shotguns. Our firearms are best known for accuracy, performance and innovation. The entrepreneurial spirit that originally defined the company is still evident in its ongoing focus on continuous innovation, craftsmanship, quality and service. Learn more at www.savagearms.com We currently have an opening for a Director of Engineering in our Engineering department. In this position, the Director is expected to be responsible for the direction and control of all engineering functions. Duties include development and recommendations of policy, methods and procedures, management of operations, supervision of personnel and other similar duties pertaining to engineering management.   ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Direct and control the operations of the engineering functions. Develop, recommend, implement, monitor and ensure that policies, methods, and procedures for each operation area are being followed.  Continually evaluate the engineering process and impact on the overall operation. Provide insight and vision as to the strategic direction for the technical and design aspects of the product. Develop both long and short term goals and objectives for the department and individuals. Ensure proper staffing of the units and training for individuals.  Maintain and ensure the integrity and safety of engineering plans, processes and designs.  Develop annual budget requests and administer approved budget for the department, programs and projects. Provide effective project management to assure that identified tasks and projects are properly organized, planned, executed and reported. Provide technical and operations guidance to subordinates; establish priorities and time lines. Monitor projects and ensure timely and accurate completion. Review project work to ensure specifications are met. Participate in and/or handle engineering projects of a complex nature. Allocate personnel resources to ensure all routine and high priority work is accomplished. Maintain a working liaison with other departments. Provide effective support, communication and assistance with the inspection, manufacturing, materials and service functions of the organization, to permit focused and effective results.Perform other similar duties inherent to the position of Director of Engineering or as requested and required by the VP Operations.   MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:BS in Engineering Discipline with MS preferred, along with 10+ years engineering experience with 5+ years managing in a Manufacturing environment.Duties require effective verbal and written communication skills, visual acuity to both written material and computer screen data, and effective interpersonal skills, and the physical ability to work and move in factory environment.  Savage Arms is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Job DescriptionOne of the nation’s largest independent testing facilities seeks an Analytical Chemist with a minimum 2 years experience testing products for the pharmaceutical, nutritional cosmetic, personal care, medical device or allied industries. The position requires a working knowledge of testing products in a GMP regulated facility.Responsible for performing physical, chemical and instrumental techniques on APIs, raw materials and finished products according to schedule. Must have the technical ability to understand client requirements and assist in the preparation of testing protocols.Run instrumentation such as, but not limited to: ICP-MS, HPLC, GC, UV, IR, AA, DSC, KF on products according to compendial, client and internal methodologies. Prepare standards and samples for analysis. Perform physical, chemical and instrumental techniques on APIs, raw materials and finished products. Execute method transfer and validation protocols. Document work clearly and accurately. Perform technical writing and peer review as needed. Operates and maintains laboratory equipment and instrumentation required for cGMP analysis of samples. Capable of working in a fast paced environment. Education And ExperienceBachelor's degree in chemistry or other related degree, preferred. Minimum 2 years of product testing experience in a GMP laboratory. ICP-MS/OES experience preferred. Previous data acquisition software (Totalchrome, Empower, etc.) experience required. Excellent scientific and organizational skills. Strong communication skills (written and oral) with an attention to detail. Ability to learn new techniques, multitask, follow instructions and comply with SOPs. Self motivated and have the ability to work independently and as part of a team. Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship. Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:Ability to stand/sit in office and laboratory environment. Ability to use a personal computer and Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook) experience required. Vision accuracy and color detection are required for this positionAbility to wear/use personal protective equipment as required such as lab coat, goggles, gloves, masks, etc. Ability to lift up to 30 lbs. Aldinger is hiring for a remote-based Director of Corporate Development (M&A). As the Director of Corporate Development, you play a crucial role in leading and executing the strategic initiatives that align with Aldinger’s growth and expansion goals. The Director of Corporate Development will report directly to the CFO as well as work closely with senior executives, legal teams, financial advisors, and various stakeholders to drive successful transactions that align with Aldinger’s strategic decision-making. This role will support the CFO in building and tracking financial models, as well as integrating acquired entities into the existing business structure.As the Director of Corporate Development, you will:Collaborate closely with CFO and executive leadership to define the company's merger and acquisition strategy and objectives.Assist in sourcing, assessing, and evaluating potential merger and acquisition opportunities that align with the company's strategic goals and growth objectives.Analyze financial statements, business plans, and market data to assess the viability and potential value of acquisition targets.Coordinate and assist in outreach activities to potential targets with senior executives.Collaborate with legal and financial advisors to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.Develop tools used to optimize and evaluate historical, current, and future merger and acquisition transactions.Aid in developing integration strategies to smoothly transition acquired entities into the existing business operations.Assist in developing and maintaining financial models to simulate various business scenarios and support strategic decisions.Lead annual budgeting process to establish financial goals and objectives.Monitor actual financial results against budgets and forecasts, identifying and addressing variances.Aid in conducting in-depth financial analysis to provide insights into business performance and trends.Support CFO in making necessary adjustments to integration strategies and business plans based on performance metrics.Build relationships with internal and external stakeholders, including investors, legal advisors, and financial institutions.In order to be successful in the role you must possess:A Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, or a related field.A minimum of 4 years of experience in similar roles, ideally in investment banking and/or private equityExcellent negotiation, critical thinking, communication, and interpersonal skills.Strong understanding of financial analysis, strategic initiatives, valuation techniques and deal structuring.Demonstrates a willingness to take on new tasks with a general attitude that no task is too small, impossible, or cannot be improved.Strategic thinking and ability to align merger and acquisition activities with overall business objectives.Ability to work effectively independently, in cross-functional teams, and manage complex projects.Intellectual curiosity and hunger to learn and collaborate.Comfortability and flexibility to travel as needed.The Director of Corporate Development is multifaceted, requiring a combination of strategic thinking, financial acumen, and negotiation skills. This role plays a pivotal role in assisting in the company's growth trajectory through well-executed mergers and acquisitions activities.With 50 years under our belt, we at Aldinger are filled with gratitude and pride. Since 1972, we have been providing top-quality calibration services for test and measurement equipment in Texas and beyond. Over the years we have stayed true to our commitment to excellence, constantly updating our processes and equipment to ensure that we are always at the forefront of our field. If you are ready to work for an innovative and growing organization, please apply today!

Job DescriptionTitle: Field Service Technician (High Voltage)Shift: Day Shift, will be traveling domestically around the US and sometimes internationallyPay: $27.00 to $30.00+/hr, perks included with travelingWho we are:Our client manufactures custom magnetics including transformers, reactors, chokes, inductors, and custom enclosures. They are looking to grow their team at their facility near Warren, OH.Field Service Technician (High Voltage) Role:We are looking for a field service technician that will be traveling to customer sites to assist with machines and equipment. This will include travel around the United States and internationally.Field Service Technician (High Voltage) Responsibilities:Installation, repair, and maintenance of induction power supplies, coils, furnaces, refractory linings, water systems, hydraulic systems, pneumatic systems, material handling equipment, and PLCs. Works with AC circuitry ranging from 480 to in excess of 3000 VAC, and DC circuitry ranging from 680 – 3,000 VDC. Good customer relation skills, as pertaining to the servicing of such equipment, are also required. Complete service reports using Microsoft Word, and expense reports using Microsoft Excel. Travel is mandatory, domestic and international, as necessary to perform these services in our customers' sites, and may be as much as 80% of the time on the job with occasional travel in excess of 4 weeks continuous. As required, train less experienced personnel, handle customer calls, look up customer drawings, and assist the Service Department support staff in any way necessary during the normal course of business. May also be required to work in assembly or test departments, and perform other duties as assigned by his/her direct supervisor. Accountability and good judgment are vital to this position. Mature decision making is a desired quality. Decisions are required; employee must analyze facts and determine action using a wide range of procedures but within limits of standard practice. Must fully understand the complete realm of safety issues associated with working on high-voltage electrical circuitry, and with working in industrial locations. Additionally, must make sound judgments with respect to company liability issues. Must understand that as a Service Engineer he/she is the most visible employee of the client that a customer sees, and good interpersonal skills are a very important part of this job. The employee must be able to deal with a variety of different persons under high stress conditions and must be able to assure those customers of their ability, as a representative of the client, to solve their problems. Must dress and act per company policies and use good business practices. Must follow all company procedure, and use discretion and good judgment with regard to confidential information pertaining to Customers, Company plans, designs, blueprints, development programs, etc. Will be in possession of company owned equipment and must use good judgment in maintaining and protecting this equipment. All equipment must be returned to the client upon termination from employment for any reason. About You:A college degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering Technology or equivalent is preferred One-year work experience in an industrial environment is desirable. Benefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insurance#ZRBR

The Day is looking to hire an Assistant Editor who will work with our team to help with audience growth. Under the direct supervision of the Managing Editor, the Assistant Editor manages, develops, and serves as the primary editor for more than a dozen specialty publications and magazines and provides newsroom editorial support for seven weekly newspapers and an associated website. The successful candidate has strong news and story judgment and possesses excellent organizational skills. The Assistant Editor will work collaboratively with editors, reporters, freelancers, and photographers to tell impactful stories in Shore Publishing’s variety of magazines. This is a unique opportunity to help play a key role in shaping our image. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate success in growing newsletters; has a firm command of SEO; best headline writing practices, and must love news.Responsibilities Serve as origination editor, coordinating all Shore Publishing-specific magazines andspecialty publications. Ensuring deadlines are met for said publications. Provide editorial newsroom support, serving as copyeditor for weekly announcementand calendar files and news content pre-layout. Job DescriptionOn Call Program AssociatePart Time San FranciscoAgency OverviewFounded in 1889, the Felton Institute (formerly Family Service Agency of San Francisco) has a history of innovation in services for vulner­able children, families, and adults for 130 years. Felton’s mission is to respond to human needs with cutting edge social services and treatment that combine the best social science research with cultural sensitivity, a deep respect for the consumer, and a commitment to social justice. With over 46 programs in 15 languages at sites throughout the San Francisco Bay Area and surrounding counties, our comprehensive array of services reaches across all racial, ethnic, cultural, and linguistic lines. At the heart of our work is the belief that individuals and families in crisis must have access to services and resources to help them build on their inherent strengths and develop self-sufficiency. Felton offers a dynamic, challenging, and supportive work environment where staff is encouraged to increase their skills and enter new domains.Program DescriptionSan Francisco Suicide Prevention’s 24-hour Crisis Line provides immediate crisis intervention and emotional support to everyone who calls. Since 1962, we have been answering the telephone around the clock, whenever we are needed. We have been able to maintain this service for over fifty years through the wonderful dedication of over 200 trained individuals who volunteer their time to answer the phones and help their neighbors through a crisis. All volunteers are trained and supervised by a professional staff, and all receive ongoing training to hone their skills with the newest developments in the field of suicide prevention.Position OverviewProvide overnight, weekend and various shifts coverage on all SFSP’s 24-hour hotlines and all crisis lines. This position reports to and adheres to agency’s policies/procedures and programs.Specific Duties And Responsibilities (Essential Functions)Service DeliveryAnswer calls from clients calling the Crisis lines or Access Line. Assess callers needs and provide emotional support in a non-judgmental manner. Empower callers to look at options and make their own decisions. Provide information and referrals to callers when appropriate. Assess suicide risks and determine plan of action. Provide Access Line Intake and referral support if working Access Line. Provide crisis intervention and emergency services as needed. TeamworkWelcome, help train and support volunteers on the hotlines as needed. Participate in continuing education presentations as needed. Contribute to a positive work environment and culture by showing respect to co-workers and engaging in positive team dynamics by concentrating on work duties engage in pro agency work culture. Compliance & QARecord client contacts database and communicate concerns to Supervisor Enters participant information by inputting alphabetic and numeric data on system. Maintains data entry requirements by following data program techniques and procedures. Keep files and data secured to protect participant confidentiality. Ensures compliance with legal/ethical and confidentiality standards. Performs other duties as assigned by the Program Director or Supervisor. QualificationsMust successfully complete SFSP Crisis Line Volunteer training program or equivalent prior experience. AA in social work, psychology or related area, or similar education or training in suicide prevention / mental health. Must have demonstrated successful performance and experience on the Crisis Lines. Ability to communicate well, both verbally and in writing. Ability to work independently and with others. Attention to detail. Experience working with vulnerable populations. Experience with crisis interventions, suicide callers and call center work Demonstrate ability to engage and support clients with challenging situations and suicide ideation Able to manage emotions and reactions to different situations. Stays calm and clear under pressure. Ability to work effectively both individually and as part of a diverse team. Experience with evidence-based practices and de-escalating clients Able to exercise good judgment and maintain healthy boundaries with clients and staff. Able to stay awake and alert during shift Strong computer skills: MS office, data entry, write clear and accurate narrative reports

You will be taking over engineering from one of their partners who will be retiring within the next year. At Tecton , we are on a mission to bring Machine Learning to every customer and product interaction on the planet. We build an enterprise-grade, world-class Feature Platform – the infrastructure that powers real-time ML applications and systems in production.Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.Tecton is funded by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Kleiner Perkins, along with strategic investments from Snowflake and Databricks. We have a fast-growing team that’s distributed around the world, with offices in San Francisco and New York City. Our team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at leading tech companies like Uber, Google, Meta, Airbnb, Lyft, and Twitter.We are building  Rift  - a new fully managed compute environment that allows data scientists to construct powerful batch and streaming feature pipelines in Python. This differs radically from technologies like Spark, which have a steep learning curve and significant overhead to manage, operate, and debug. Our new environment leverages popular open-source technologies such as Ray, Arrow, and DuckDB.As a staff-level engineer building Tecton’s managed compute, you’ll play a critical role in architecting, designing, and scaling our first-ever managed compute platform that will serve as a compute engine used by every Tecton customer. As part of this team, you will be working in one or more of the following areas to build the next generation of Tecton infrastructure:Distributed compute and resource managementQuery optimization and distributed executionCross-platform integrations with state-of-the-art data platforms such as Snowflake and BigQueryFault-tolerant workloads on a lambda-based architectureData security ResponsibilitiesOwn and lead large technical domains starting from the problem definition and technical requirements along with implementation and maintenanceLead multi-engineer projects of strategic importance to Tecton spanning cross-functional teams including design, product management, and other engineering teamsDrive efforts to improve engineering practices, tooling, and processes along with mentorship for senior engineersDevelop a deep understanding of the fundamental problems our customers face in building ML systemsBe a generalist as needed. We’re a small, but growing engineering team and each engineer needs to be versatileReinforce Tecton’s “Fast, but Focused” core valueQualifications And Values7+ years of experience in building product software systems2+ years of technical leadership experience for a group of engineersExperience working in large Python, Java, Kotlin, or Go codebases and running cloud-native production systems using Kubernetes, AWS, and DockerExperience with distributed systems, SQL, and NoSQL databasesBias to action and passion for delivering high-quality solutionsStrong communication and ability to write detailed technical specificationsExcitement about coaching and mentorship of junior engineersBSc, MS or PhD in Computer Science or related fields$216,000 - $258,000 a yearThe estimated US base salary range for this position is $216,000 - $258,000 annually for employees based within California & New York. In addition to base salary, we offer competitive equity & comprehensive benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life, 401(K), flexible paid time off, 10 paid holidays each calendar year, sick time, leave of absence as per the FMLA and other relevant leave laws. Individual compensation packages are based on multiple factors such as location, level, role scope, and complexity, as well as additional job-related factors such as skills, experience, and expertise.Tecton values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from the application through to the interview, please contact us at recruitingteam@tecton.ai.This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

A leading advanced material business working across the chemical and process industry is seeking a self-motivated Global Business Development Manager to join their growing commercial team as they explore future growth markets with an established and constantly expanding portfolio of specialty products aimed at the sustainability market.This global leader in advanced materials offers highly-customised, bespoke solutions to some of the most innovative, world leading chemicals, petrochemicals, polymer and process engineering companies worldwide. They continue to expand their offering of advanced material solutions, and have a strong footprint in emerging markets such carbon capture, carbon utilisation, bio-catalysis and sustainable catalyst technology. As a medium-sized, established player in the market, they are agile and well-positioned to adapt to the emerging green economy, renewable energy and materials landscape.In this role you will proactively identify, develop and commercialise new business opportunities within existing and prospective global customers. You must commercialise existing technology platforms, as well as identify new opportunities for innovation colleagues to use their world-leading capabilities to develop new technologies to satisfy unmet customer needs. Market analysis will be crucial – especially in the area of carbon capture and carbon utilization projects, where you will work closely with R&D partners to drive new innovation. It’s critical you are able to effectively build a pipeline of business with a long-term view, opening up and nurturing relationships with a 1-3+ year path to commercial outcomes.An experienced and influential new business developer who has the technical credentials to back up their commercial work will thrive in this role. You must be confident with the introduction of highly-technical products at a senior level within prospective customer organisations. You should be experienced working cross-functionally, and ideally have a good level of understanding of contract development relationships, licensing agreements, and risk management strategies.If you have a strong New Business Development background in a chemical/materials setting, with exposure to adsorbent and ion-exchange applications for process challenges, and wish to join a well-resourced and growing business where you can have a real impact, then this could be a great opportunity for you.For this position, it is essential you have:BS-level education in Chemistry, Materials Science, Process Engineering, or similar – additional (MS, PhD, MBA) qualifications highly desirable.10+ Years’ work experience, with a combination of Technical and Business Development functions.Demonstrated track record of leading NBD projects from prospect, through product development to contracting and tangible commercial outcomes.Strong product knowledge around adsorbents, catalysts, ion-exchange products, functionalized materials, or porous materials.Experience in relevant applications like carbon capture/ utilization, purification/ separation processes.The ability to travel regularly in the USA, as well as globally as required.Demonstrated success at developing and closing a strong and varied pipeline of new business related to specialty products for carbon capture and/or purification applications.Please either apply directly or get in touch at oliver.davies@southall-sage.com for a confidential discussion about the position.

Job Description:This Inside Sales Manager position is responsible for helping generate revenue by assisting the sales team in developing accounts and obtaining orders; ensure data quality in sales tools and customer satisfaction; ensure compliance of the local Lead to Cash process with the Division’s recommendations.Company Profile:Stäubli is a global mechatronics solution provider founded in 1892. Stäubli's commitment is to partner with customers in nearly every industry to provide comprehensive solutions with long-term support. Stäubli has four dedicated Divisions: Textile, Electrical Connectors, Fluid Connectors, and Robotics. Stäubli operates in 29 countries, with agents in 50 countries on four continents. Stäubli has a global workforce of 5700 employees and growing. Stäubli North American headquarters is located, in Duncan, South Carolina, with over 200 employees supporting all four divisions.Roles & Responsibilities:As Commercial Operations Manager in charge of the Inside Sales team, you are part of the local management team and report directly to the Robotics Division Manager.You ensure smooth, reliable, and efficient application of the global Lead to Cash process, including management of customer orders by the Inside Sales team. You maintain regular communication with the Production Units (France and Germany), the Sales team and customers concerning delivery schedules and tracking problems (delays, payment…). You supervise the dunning process.You build KPIs and reports to analyze the results of your team’s job and ensure continuous improvement. You implement corrective actions when needed and contribute to your team’s performance.You assist the Sales team in the field, clarifying commercial and technical questions with the Production Units. You also assist the Sales team to follow up on leads and quotes.You manage and follow up contracts (local frame agreements, confidentiality agreements…); you communicate with the Central team about Global Frame Agreements, relay information to your local Sales team and ensure data quality on Global Accounts in our ERP and CRM applications.You manage the demonstration and consignment robot asset in our dedicated tool RENT, and the associated consignment contracts with customers.You maintain and monitor data quality in local ERP and CRM applications (customer master data, product catalogue descriptions, price lists…).You take part in internal and external audits as Manager of the local Lead to Cash process.As a local referent for ERP and CRM applications, you maintain communication with the Sales team to relay information from the Customer Journey Excellence Central team and to identify and report local issues or new requirements. You clarify information and you ensure that Divisional tools and processes are applied locally. You contribute to the training and skills development of the local Sales and Inside Sales teams.Requirements:Bachelor's in business administrationStrong experience in customer service / inside sales in an international environment.Travel <5% of the time.Skills:Customer, process and result oriented.Good analytic and reporting skillsProfessionalism, attention to detailTeam oriented and collaborative work style.Staubli offers a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, an excellent work environment, extensive training, technologically advanced products, and growth potential.

full description: At Tecton , we are on a mission to bring Machine Learning to every customer and product interaction on the planet. We build an enterprise-grade, world-class Feature Platform – the infrastructure that powers real-time ML applications and systems in production.Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.Tecton is funded by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Kleiner Perkins, along with strategic investments from Snowflake and Databricks. We have a fast-growing team that’s distributed around the world, with offices in San Francisco and New York City. Our team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at leading tech companies like Uber, Google, Meta, Airbnb, Lyft, and Twitter.Tecton is looking for a GTM Operations candidate to work with our Director of Sales Operations and GTM functional leaders to refine and execute our go-to-market strategy. You will be a critical member of a growing GTM Strategy & Operations team. You will be tasked with supporting Tecton's sales, customer success, and marketing functions and partnering with cross-functional teams to identify system, data, or process needs that can drive revenue growth.ResponsibilitiesStrategy Execution: This is a strategy execution role; your primary mission is to partner with functional leaders in shaping and executing GTM strategyAssist in GTM Planning, including, but not limited to, territory segmentation, account assignments, quotas, gearing ratios, incentive compensation, etc.Translate function leaders’ business strategy into technical requirements and proactively advise on process improvements and automation opportunitiesIdentify and lead strategic initiatives to directly impact revenue and retention.Process & Operations:Partnering with our pre and post-sales function leaders to design and improve business processes to drive efficiency, address gaps, and enable automationAuthor and deliver leadership reports, including weekly, monthly, and quarterly business insights regarding our operations' health and customer baseWork cross-functionally to identify potential revenue risks and implement scalable processes and impactful solutionsAnalyze data to identify trends, risks, and opportunities for growth and retention metrics improvementSystems:Implement and manage GTM tools - Ensure the teams have the tools they need to succeed by developing a deep understanding of our GTM strategy pre- and post-sales, tech ecosystem, usage patterns, and department budgetDesign and maintain Salesforce objects, field definitions, and workflows, and translate business requirements into technical requirements for our adminsDevelop and manage a detailed roadmap for multiple systems and data projectsQualificationsBachelor’s Degree preferably in an analytical field - Mathematics, Business, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc. Master’s Degree or MBA preferredA minimum of 5 years of related work experience is requiredYou have demonstrated the ability to communicate complex concepts concisely and clearly to all levels of employees, from the Executive level to the employee baseExcellent written, interpersonal, and presentation communication skills; comfortable and confident presenting new concepts to large audiencesStrong understanding of core business processes in a B2B SaaS environment: sales, marketing, product development, customer support and success, professional servicesDemonstrate a pragmatic approach to problem-solving and highly analytical - able to manipulate large data setsStrong stakeholder service orientation and analytical and problem-solving skillsExcel or Google Sheets super userAbility to manage multiple concurrent projects, work independently, and thrive in a fast-paced, constantly changing environmentStrong workshop facilitation and presentation skillsWillingness to learn and an openness to giving and receiving feedbackDeep experience in using GTM tools: Salesforce, Excel, GDrive office suite, Data enrichment tools/databases (ZoomInfo or others), Outreach$133,000 - $187,000 a yearThe estimated US base salary range for this position is  $133,000 - $187,000 annually for employees based within California & New York. This role is eligible for performance-based bonuses as well as our competitive equity & comprehensive benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life, 401(K), flexible paid time off, 10 paid holidays each calendar year, sick time, leave of absence as per the FMLA and other relevant leave laws. Individual compensation packages are based on multiple factors such as location, level, role scope, and complexity, as well as additional job-related factors such as skills, experience, and expertise.Please apply even if you don't meet all the qualifications and competencies noted. It's rare that someone checks all the boxes, so we encourage you to break down walls!Tecton values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Summary:We are seeking a passionate and skilled ML Data Engineer (Band 4B) to join our team inUSA. You will play a pivotal role in building and maintaining the data infrastructure andpipelines for our cutting-edge Generative AI applications. You will collaborate closely withthe Generative AI Full Stack Architect and MLOps Engineer to ensure the quality, security,and accessibility of data for our Generative AI models.Responsibilities: Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, pre-processing, andtransforming data for Generative AI model training and inference. Build and maintain efficient data storage solutions, including datalakes, warehouses, and databases, appropriate for large-scale generative AI datasets. Implement data security and governance policies to ensure the privacy and integrityof sensitive data used in Generative AI projects. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to understand data requirements forGenerative AI models and translate them into efficient data pipelines. Monitor and optimize data pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. Stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in data engineering tools andtechnologies (e.g., Apache Spark, Airflow, Snowflake, Data Bricks ) and apply them toour Generative AI platform. Document data pipelines and processes for clarity and transparency. Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders about dataquality and availability for Generative AI projects.Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field, orequivalent experience. 6+ years of experience in data engineering or related roles, such as data pipelinedevelopment, data storage, or ETL/ELT processes. Proven experience building and maintaining data pipelines for machine learningprojects. Strong understanding of data modeling principles, data quality measures, and datasecurity best practices. Proficient in programming languages like Python, SQL, and scripting languages(e.g., Bash, Shell). Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) for data storage andprocessing. Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Passion for Generative AI and its potential to solve real-world challenges.Band 4B: Senior individual contributor with substantial data engineering expertise andleadership experience. Manages complex data projects and initiatives with independent decision-makingauthority. Provides technical guidance and mentorship to junior team members. Has a demonstrated track record of success in delivering impactful data solutions.

At Agency of Valor, we are committed to every one of our agents success. We are a family run independent insurance agency looking for team-players, who have an entrepreneurial passion, and a strong commitment to serve clients. Both full and part time sales and insurance agency development positions are available.Here is who we are looking for …· Goal setters: You know how to set goals and effectively develop a plan to execute on those goals.· Servant leaders: You are a true leader that seeks to serve your team.· Strong work ethic: You recognize the irreplaceable value of hard work and what it takes to achieve your financial goals.· High integrity: You uphold high standards of professionalism and ethics and embrace the opportunity to become a highly visible member of your community.· Proven history of leadership/management: You have a proven background in building and managing within a business development role.Requirements:· Life and Health Insurance License (Preferred)· Excellent communication and presentation skills· Must be a self-starter, motivated, and driven to succeedAs the demand for both life insurance and financial services increases, (especially with our aging population), it is important for us to find the right qualified professionals to help us serve our clients and families.With our proprietary lead generation and training systems in place, you will have the opportunity to build your own business, and earn what you are willing to work for.But we don't stop there. We also have a leadership development program that enables the most ambitious sales professionals develop their own agency.· Health & Dental Insurance Benefits Available· Meet With Clients over the internet utilizing ZOOM, Facetime, etc.: All leads are provided, no cold calling or prospecting· One of America's Fastest Growing Companies: Inc 5000 #1022 for last 6 years· Luxury All Expense Paid Vacations: Free, world-class travel to reward you for your production· Passive Income: Eventually you'll have the ability to replace your personal production· Untapped Market Potential: Demand nationwide has not been sufficiently met by our products· Team Culture that seeks to promote without over-working you: At our core we believe in balanceDiscovering a mutual fit in our hiring process is very important to us, as we don't align with everyone, and we recognize you feel the same way. We look forward to learning more about you!

The Senior Compliance Associate plays a pivotal role in administering the Compliance Program for each of the regulated entities. This position involves testing controls, reviewing and updating firm policies and procedures, and providing compliance support to various business units. Here are the main responsibilities:Assist in overseeing responsibilities for various entities at the Firm, including policy monitoring, testing, and controls.Drive efficiencies across the department and systems, implementing improved processes to reduce redundancy and leveraging technology for enhanced efficiency.Contribute to the implementation and testing of Compliance policies and procedures.Proactively review business activities to identify potential regulatory, compliance, and reputational risks.Review marketing and sales literature to ensure compliance with FINRA and SEC rules, as well as Global Investment Performance Standards and firm policies and procedures, including social media efforts.Assist in reviewing and drafting RFPs, questionnaires, and other standardized responses.Manage daily surveillance of investment guidelines and related processes, seeking process improvements and implementing them proactively.Provide training and mentorship to junior Compliance professionals.Stay current with new regulations and changes to securities rules and regulations.Provide regulatory and compliance advice to business and control units.Conduct compliance audits of outside sales professionals and branch office locations as necessary.Assist with regulatory and ad hoc filings as needed.Participate in creating new policies and procedures to support new business, including identifying conflicts of interest and determining appropriate controls to mitigate risks.Perform special projects and other duties as assigned.Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.Minimum 5 years of compliance experience required (mutual fund, investment advisor, and broker-dealer experience preferred).Securities Industry Essentials (SIE) exam, Series 6/7, and 24/26 licenses requiredStrong computer skills in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint.Detail-oriented with strong organizational and follow-through skills.Excellent communication skills - both verbal and written.Team-oriented, self-starter, and willingness to share ideas.Some travel required.

We build an enterprise-grade, world-class Feature Platform – the infrastructure that powers real-time ML applications and systems in production.Tecton’s founders developed the first Feature Store when they created Uber’s Michelangelo ML platform, and we’re now bringing those same capabilities to every organization in the world.Tecton is funded by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, and Kleiner Perkins, along with strategic investments from Snowflake and Databricks. Job DescriptionSr Plant Plastic Process EngineerGlobal CPG leader is looking for a Sr Plant Process Engineer to support plastic extrusion and thermoforming operations.Relocations assistance is available.Responsibilities include:Lead Engineering support for plant to include plastic extrusion, thermoforming, and printing. Norit is one of the global leaders in producing activated carbon for a wide range of applications including pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, food, biogas, chemicals, water, automotive and others. Without knowing it, you have undoubtedly used our product indirectly. For our US organization, that includes 2 manufacturing facilities in Pryor, Ok and Marshall TX, corporate office (Horsham, PA) and remote employees, we are looking for an experienced HR Business Partner. This position entails collaborating with functional and manufacturing leaders to deliver HR solutions for the designated employee base (around 150 employees). Tasks vary from staffing, employee relations, compliance, compensation, team development, and guiding organizational change initiatives. Because of the diverse spread of employee population, locations and business needs, the role combines the necessity to switch gear between strategic and tactical activities. The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced entrepreneurial setting and possess the ability to cultivate relationships across various business units. This role offers a fulfilling opportunity for individuals interested in addressing strategic, region-wide, or company-wide matters, while also overseeing day-to-day tactical HR operations.  As an HR Business Partner, you will: Stay updated on and align HR practices with goals, capabilities, and development priorities of supported sites and functions,Identify and establish relationships with key clients and stakeholders across supported locations, functions, and among HR colleagues,Investigate and resolve employee complaints promptly; escalate significant issues to VP, Human Resources,Coach Managers to improve employee performance; review performance improvement plans before communicating with employees,Provide guidance on administering HR policies for fair treatment and supportive work environment. Implement new HR and business policies and programs for the employee population in the US,Collaborate with functional and site leaders to understand skill gaps and upcoming business needs, develop solutions that would help close these gaps,Work with global HR colleagues ’on HR strategic priorities and collaborate on tactical functional topics to improve efficiency reduce manual work while enhancing employee experience,Oversee HR Operations in the US, including Global HRIS, Payroll, Compensation and Benefits: ensure data governance and accuracy, equity, fairness and compliance across HR operational processes,Actively promote Norit values and cultivate an environment where employees understand and embrace our company's principles.  What are we looking for? Degree or certification in Human Resources / Business Administration, 5+ years of related HR experience, preferably within an international organization, Experience in a manufacturing environment,Possess strong business acumen to effectively translate business needs into HR actions, Proactive in dealing with ambiguity, addressing emerging issues promptly, and being responsive to both management and employees, Demonstrate an action-oriented approach, capable of leading change within the organization, Possess the ability to influence others while maintaining an attitude of respect for individuals at all levels of the organization, Good decision-making skills, ability to work independently in a leadership position, Have strong conflict resolution abilities, including effective communication and a leadership presence, Display organizational agility by effectively multitasking, meeting deadlines, and maintaining confidentiality, Possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Office, including intermediate Excel skills, experience with HRIS. What do we offer? Competitive salary base with variable pay, Generous 401(k)plan, medical insurance, A flat organizational structure that fosters collaboration and empowers employees to take ownership of their projects, Exciting work challenges and opportunity to shape HR programs, practices, policies, and influence organizational culture, Opportunities for professional growth and development as we take on new projects.

Job DescriptionWe are a small PI firm in Seattle handling a high-volume of cases. We currently have three attorneys and two paralegals. Job DescriptionPay Range: $25 - $30/hr. depending on experience.Darwin’s Natural Pet Products is seeking an Accounting Specialist to join our Finance department. The Accounting Specialist will perform accounting functions around month end close, accounts payable and assist the accounting department with daily tasks as needed. If you are someone that enjoys a variety of responsibilities to fill your day, then this Accounting Specialist position is for you.Darwin’s Natural Pet Products makes high quality, premium raw dog and cat food and delivers it directly to pet owners around the U.S. Our growing business started 17 years ago and is a combination of both manufacturing and direct-to-consumer retailing with a strong online subscription focus. This position will be in-person at our Tukwila, WA headquarters but has the potential for a hybrid work schedule for the right person.Darwin’s offers full-time employees a comprehensive benefit package including:Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance5% Company contribution to 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan (no employee contribution required)Free Life and Long-term disability insurance, Employee Assistance Program6 paid holidays (including 2 flex days)10 days PTO annually60lbs of free premium pet food monthly ($450 value). Free on-site snacksPet-friendly officeEssential Duties and Responsibilities: Support the day-to-day management of accounting department. Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure. Support accounts payable function by preparing and entering invoices into accounting software and other programs, setting up new vendors, running reports and troubleshooting invoice discrepancies. Assist with design, testing and integration of accounting system implementations. Document existing processes and providing recommendations to improve them. Preparing journal entries, analyses, and account reconciliations and assisting with monthly close processes. Perform daily accounting operations to assure the accurate and timely preparation of financial statements and reporting, tax returns, and budgets. Assist with expense reports and credit card administration, including reconciliation and review tasks. Assist with audit requests and tax schedules as needed. Serve as department back-up for various functions. Ad hoc duties and project support in accounting and finance as assigned. Desired Qualifications:A bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field or equivalent experience. A minimum 3 years of industry experience, 2-3 years manufacturing accounting & sales tax experience preferred. Strong understanding of accounting concepts and financial statements. Ability to work on weekends and evenings as needed to meet applicable deadlines. Tech-savvy in MS Office Suite and able to learn new systems quickly, intermediate/advanced level in Excel, including proficiency with lookups and pivot tables a plus. Hands on experience with core ERP software a plus. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Demonstrated problem solving and process improvement skills. Ability to work well as part of a small team. Ability to set priorities and goals and follow through on multiple tasks simultaneously. Passion for ensuring healthy pet lifestyles – with the ability to understand and empathize with pet feeding issues – is a plus. FLSA Status: Full-time, Non-Exempt

Job DescriptionJUNIOR ACCOUNTANTWho We Are: We are not your average accounting firm! We are a bookkeeping, accounting, tax and consulting firm located in Doylestown, PA. We provide our services both onsite and virtually for a wide variety of clients with no particular focus on any one industry. What that means for our staff is responsibility for many different types of accounting tasks rather than just focusing on only one area of the whole accounting picture. It also means exposure to an assortment of clients which creates an awesome opportunity for learning and growth.Why Work Here? When asked to describe our culture in one word, the top answer from our staff was “Flexible.” We don’t just talk about work/life balance here, we really mean it. We work really hard to ensure we deliver the highest quality of service for our clients but we value our free time too. Job DescriptionKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:Excellent verbal and written skillsStrong organizational skills, detail-orientedTrustworthy, able to handle sensitive informationCooperative and friendly, willing to ask questions and take initiative in tasksAssociate’s degree (minimum requirement), preferably in Logistics, Business Administration, or related fields. 2-3 years of experience in a similar role preferred. Preferred prior experience in preparing customs and shipping documents. Preferred prior knowledge of shipping regulations and policies. The primary job task of the Purchasing Assistant (Imports) will be assisting in the procurement process by tracking orders, and maintaining purchasing records.This position plays a crucial role in ensuring timely and cost-effective procurement of products and materials based on the Company’s needs.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.Prepares documents and forms to move goods efficiently through the importing process. Reviews paperwork, invoices, and other documents to ensure shipping, handling, customs, storage, and production fees are billed and paid correctly. Enters invoices for payment and works closely with the Accounting Department to ensure timely payment of invoices. Maintains a database that tracks products through the import process. Monitors and examines stock and sales levels to maintain and obtain about three months of stock on all items, to allow for production and shipment time. Places purchase orders with the parent company in Italy, and obtains all signatures required for stock orders. Updates Company databases and systems with order details (production and availability dates, quantities, discounts) and communicates with Customer Service Department on product and order availability. Combines purchase orders to efficiently build a container, working closely with suppliers, customers, brokers, and internal departments (accounting, customer service, sales, warehouses), to ensure efficient and cost-effective orders. Electronically receives materials into the transitory warehouse, receiving invoices from freight forwarders and brokers, allocating the costs, and processing invoices for customer payment. Tracks shipments using freight forwarder and broker websites and direct contacts, and coordinates exams with brokers and US customs when necessary, while keeping internal customer service department in the know on all delays and holds. Assists with the claims process related to product shortages, overages, or shipping errors or delaysAssists with the evaluation of offers from vendors, with an end goal of improved pricing. Maintains familiarity with the supply chain procedures and creates and interprets cost analysesConducts market research to identify pricing trends. Other tasks as needed or assigned.

and working knowledge of creative sourcing tools and strategiesExperience with contract negotiations with candidates, 1099 contracts, a plusExcellent communication skills and phone etiquetteDemonstrates strong interpersonal skills within a service environmentExcellent organization, prioritization and problem-solving skillsExercises accuracy and attention to detail, as well as discretionPHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENTMust have use of sensory skills to effectively communicate and interact with other employees and the public through use of the telephone, email, video conference and face to face contactMust have manual dexterity, visual acuity and hearing acuity to effectively use and operate office related equipment such as but not limited to a computer, copier, scanner, camera, phone, headset, keyboard and mouseMust be able to sit for extended periods of time at a keyboard and workstation with low periods of reaching and standingEQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENTIngenovis Health is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. full description: Job DescriptionBiotechnology company is hiring a Research Associate II within the Pathobiology department to contribute to histology and pathology workflows in support of pre-clinical in vivo pharmacology studies. This position will support drug development in diverse therapeutic areas such as inflammation, fibrosis, oncology, and virology. The successful candidate will provide scientific and technical overview for tissue-based methods that span sample processing, assay development, whole slide scanning, image QC, analysis, and data reporting. A successful candidate will enjoy working in a team; carefully follow scientific protocols and apply meticulous attention to detail.ResponsibilitiesCompile both quantitative and quantitative histology data and prepare pathology reports. Work closely with project pathologists to organize, generate, and communicate pathology data. Curate digital pathology database to provide organized access to whole slide images. Support sample management and lab operation activities. Whole slide scanning of histology slides for pathologist review or quantitative image analysis. Beneficial Experience (not required):Tissue-based procedures to include IHC and in situ hybridization. Hands on experience with in vivo pharmacology model workflows. Tissue processing of fixed tissue for histology applications. Digital pathology experience, including image analysis and database software. Experience with statistical analysis software. Basic histology procedures, including fixed tissue processing, embedding, and microtomy. QualificationsBachelor’s degree or higher in an area of biological or medical science. 2+ years of histology lab or related experience. Complete working knowledge of Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Ability to interpret, communicate, and present scientific data. Highly motivated with a “can do” attitude and commitment to work as part of a teamTop 3 Required Skill Sets: Histology, IHC, Pathology Data AnalysisTop 3 Nice to Have Skill Sets: Whole Slide Scanning, Statistical Analysis,Unique Selling Point of this role: Work alongside pathologist to oversee the histology/pathology process from sample collection through data reporting. This role has both lab and office/computer based responsibilities. Company DescriptionR&D Partners is a national staffing firm focused in the areas of: Scientific, Clinical Research and Engineering. Our team offers well over 200 years of combined staffing experience providing consulting, direct hire & outsourcing solutions with our west coast offices in San Francisco, Redwood City and San Diego, CA and our east coast offices located in Harrisburg, PA and Tampa, FL.The cornerstone of our success: a knowledgeable and experienced recruiting team.Our life sciences recruiters, clinical research recruiters and engineering recruiters are uniquely specialized. After a detailed assessment of our clients’ needs, we can then identify appropriate candidates utilizing our established network of professionals. R&D Partners takes a proactive approach to recruiting, establishing relationships with experienced passive candidates so when the time is right, we can combine our candidates’ talents with our clients’ opportunities.R&D Partners is a national staffing firm focused in the areas of: Scientific, Clinical Research and Engineering. Our team offers well over 200 years of combined staffing experience providing consulting, direct hire & outsourcing solutions with our west coast offices in San Francisco, Redwood City and San Diego, CA and our east coast offices located in Harrisburg, PA and Tampa, FL. Amida Technology Solutions is a DC-based technology company focused on solutions for data interoperability, data utility, and data security. We create open-source solutions that collect, reconcile, transform, and standardize data for business intelligence, predictive analytics, decision support, and user transactions. We specialize in taking data from inception to impact.Our team is comprised of creative, forward thinkers who are passionate about using cutting-edge technology to make a difference in people's lives and have a positive impact on our country. We offer an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment that values fresh ideas, candid conversations, and authentic teamwork.Amida is currently looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in Washington, DC, hybrid, or remote. In this role you will work across our client engagements, providing expertise in data collection, data analysis, data mapping, data profiling, data mining, and data modeling. You will be responsible for inspecting, cleansing, transforming, and modeling data and will address issues related to data completeness and quality, as well as contribute to and produce technical and data process documentation.What You Will Do:Use expertise in data science and statistical methods and tools to extract insights from a diverse range of Veterans Administration data as part of a larger project teamCollaborate with data engineers, data quality analysts, and visualization specialists to build data pipelinesReview and synthesize research reports, technical documentation, and other sources to help frame analysis plans and aid in the interpretation of resultsPrepare and present the results of analyses in the form of visualizations and PowerPoint slidesLeverage big data tools and frameworks (e.g., PySpark; SparkSQL) to access, process, and analyze large-scale datasetsInteract with VA program staff to gather requirements and develop analysis plansRequired Skills:M.S. and/or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics (or related)5+ years of recent professional experience in data science, data mining, data analysis, business process analysis, and/or healthcare analytics5+ years working with Machine Learning methodologies5+ years of programming experience in a subset of Python3+ years of programming experience in SQLAbility to conduct data profiling and predictive analysis using a variety of standardExcellent ability to communicate concisely and effectively with software engineers and clientsAbility to obtain a Public Trust security clearancePreferred Skills:Prior experience working with Healthcare data, or in the Healthcare fieldExperience with data visualization tools and methodologiesCommunication is the key to success at Amida. Our people are known for their can-do attitude and their ability to work effectively with client teams. We pride ourselves on having a collegial, multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds and experience. Our best team members pay intense attention to detail in all aspects of their work, have a strong sense of initiative, and are willing to be opinionated about the best ways of doing things. A sense of humor is an asset at Amida.We help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you're looking for an opportunity to help important organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.

Job DescriptionResponsibilities: Assist with research, analysis, and implementation of various client billing requirements including but not limited to, billing rate arrangements, phase/task coding, and timekeeper approval.  Process requests from various departments in the billing system to update client and matter settings.  Monitor and update various client discount arrangements; including setting tracking alerts.  Entry and upkeep of client arrangements in firm deal database.  Assist with year end and ad hoc updates to client and timekeeper changes in billing rate arrangements. Essential Functions of Job: Collaborate with Pricing Operations Manager and intake team on maintenance initiatives including but not limited to: rate updates, phase/task code updates, matter tagging, client deal information updates.  Work with the relevant stakeholders to ensure that client financial arrangements are properly articulated, updated, and documented in Firm’s pricing database.  Manage the data-mining process for new and existing matters. This includes gathering and maintaining information on fee arrangements, matter types, cost drivers, task coding, among other items.  Monitor compliance with Firm budgeting and pricing policies, as well as the financial aspects of client guidelines and terms; provide guidance to attorneys and support staff as needed.  Collaborate with Billing, eBilling, and Practice Specialists to ensure most current client financial arrangements are communicated and properly administered.  Collaborate with lawyers, practice management colleagues, and the marketing department to respond to RFPs, pitches, and other pricing proposals.  Work with partners to enter budgets and other fee arrangement data into online matter management tool, then monitor and provide regular status reports to partners and management. This will be done in conjunction with the Budget Control Analyst.  Prepare recurring and ad hoc reports related to all aspects of practice management.  Complete special projects as assigned.

Job Title:  Sr. Data AnalystLocation: Deerfield Beach, FL Onsite Requirements: Hybrid – 2/3 days onsite Job-Type: 12-month contractReferral Bonus: +/- $150 per month for the entire duration of the contractEmployment Eligibility: Gravity cannot transfer nor sponsor a work visa for this position. Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. for any employer directly.Our client is a $20B, Fortune 200 company in the automotive retailing, distribution and services industry. They are currently ranked in the Top 20 companies to work for in the US by Fortune Magazine, Top 20 best companies for diversity and have an amazing work culture and impressive long-term growth prospects.Job Summary:The Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible developing an understanding of the relationship of the data that supports business processes and applications. The analyst will gain insights into the data and the movement of the data from data entry to final data destinations in the back-end files and reporting systems. Candidates must possess the technical capabilities to extract, retrieve and analyze data on their own. Be able to dive in and research new and complex data sources to understand how the data is moving in the system and how the data is stored to identify any anomalies that may exist. The analyst should possess strong interpersonal communication skills to be able to bridge the gap between business and technical users to relay both business and technical concepts as it relates to data. The analyst will be required to document findings and ensure that mappings and lineage are well documented and stored into knowledge storage repositories. This assignment is for a project that will interact with business and IT to understand business processes and the related data. Must be able to be on a hybrid schedule (Deerfield Beach office) with flexibility to be in the office more, as required.Job Requirements:o 5+ years of experience as a Data Analysto Senior-level proficiency with SQLo Ability to independently complete data lineage projects and source-to-target mappingo BA or BS Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science or a related fieldo Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively communicate with technical and business teamso Executive/business presenceo Ability to develop trusted partnerships with stakeholders and other employees.

full description: Job DescriptionWorks-in-Progress Associates (WPA) is seeking an experienced Assistant Project Manager to become an integral part of our team! The Brooklyn Animal Care Center (BACC) project will include demolition of the existing building and construction of a new two-story 23,845 SF building on the same lot. The new facility will house admissions, adoptions, medical services, and boarding for dogs, cats, and rabbits. Support spaces will include open-air courtyards and a dog run, offices, restrooms, and storage. Site work will include parking for staff, visitors, and shelter vehicles, as well as site lighting and low-maintenance planting throughout.Minimum Requirements:Baccalaureate Degree in Business, Engineering, Construction Management, Accounting or related field from an accredited college or universityMinimum 4 years of full-time experience as an assistant project manager in the construction industry. A driver's license valid in New York State. Demonstrated proficiency with all applicable software packages including but not limited to MS Windows; MS Office (including Project, Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint), and Adobe Acrobat. Must be authorized to work in the United StatesMust be willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations. Primary Responsibilities:Reviewing shop drawings and technical info and follow up with GC/Designers to comply with spec and contract documents. Ensuring approvals obtained in line with the submittal schedules and release for Just in Time (JIT) delivery to site of critical long lead items. Assist in reviewing and commenting on safety Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) in line of safety with NYC Department of Design and Construction's (DDC’s) requirements and pertaining to field conditions prior to start of work. Formulating logs (safety certs., LEED update logs (high level), Insurance certs, document controls, etc.) and tracking on a daily and monthly basis. Following up with GC regarding submissions of critical docs (PLA, 2-week look ahead)Assisting the PM in writing meeting minutes and updating the bi-weekly reportsAssisting/conducting meetings as needed related to document controls for LEED, BIM coordination, commissioning, etc. and documenting/publishing minutes. Assist in reviewing payment requisitions and verifying field quantities. Benchmark document safety review / upload as needed for DDC communication. Populating DDC payment requisition and uploading on DDC’s website. Additional Responsibilities, as needed:Attending meetings and writing minutes of project meetingsMonitor the project schedule and budget. Provide document control oversight and perform document control when needed. Prepare for preconstruction meeting (agenda, early action letter)Oversee Setup and maintenance of project files. Process / distribute / review submittals, RFIs, project documents, correspondence. Generate progress pay estimate or reviews contractor payment application for accuracy; ensures audit proof documentation is compiled for each pay estimate. Manage RFIs, including distribution and log. Perform labor compliance / EEO reviews / interviews. Perform claims management tasks. Perform schedule reviewing tasks. Prepare correspondence. Reviews certified payrolls and extra work bills for compliance with prevailing wage laws; conducting or coordinating labor compliance interviews and documenting nonconformance. Oversee Maintenance of all project logsDraft change orders/change noticesContract close-out. Other duties related to construction site activities as needed. Skills:Ability to build and strengthen long-lasting client relationships by providing reliable service and project solutions. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with all management levels. Must have excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. Must have strong organizational and time management skills. Must be able to adapt and prioritize, meeting deadlines, in a fast-paced environment. Operate with a sense of urgency, quickly responding to clients. Demonstrated leadership, responsiveness, and accountability. Detail oriented with strong analytical skills. Proactive and take initiative. Company DescriptionWPA is a woman-owned Owner's Representative firm and we manage construction projects for mostly nonprofits including schools, hospitals, libraries, etc. in the New York City area. Technical Business / Systems Analyst100% RemoteContract role We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Technical Business and Systems Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong and diverse technical background as well as an understanding of the lottery business and understands or can gain a quick understanding of the IT systems and solutions that support the various lottery implementations. This role will be responsible for interfacing with various SMEs on technical teams and being the key interface to our centralized RFP team who are crafting comprehensive and compelling responses to Requests for Proposals (RFPs) related to lottery technology solutions. This individual will work closely with many various distributed technology teams to gather necessary information and create detailed and cohesive technical response to various RFPs. The proposal should effectively address client needs and requirements while following a central theme. In this role, you will be reviewing and analyzing RFP documents to understand client requirements, evaluation criteria, and submission guidelines. While we have a central team that does much of the main content, this role will include content creation and will require high-quality written content for RFP responses, including executive summaries, technical solutions, implementation plans, and pricing strategies.  You will be the bridge between our various technical teams as well as the business side preparing the RFP response. You will collaborate with subject matter experts, sales teams, and other stakeholders to gather relevant information and ensure accuracy and completeness of proposals. You will customize proposal content to align with client needs and preferences, highlighting the unique value proposition of our lottery technology solutions.  Quality is critical so you will also provide reviews and edits to ensure proposals are well-written, cohesive, and align to the product being offered. You will also need to manage proposal timelines, milestones, and deliverables to ensure timely submission of high-quality proposals. Over time, you will be responsible to maintain a repository of proposal content, templates, and best practices for future reference and continuous improvement. In addition to a strong technical background and a good understanding of systems, software development, databases, cloud technologies, messaging and other technical topics, what other experience is required?  • Lottery Experience - We ideally would like to find someone that is familiar with the various systems used to run the lottery in various states in the US.• Good documentation experience and samples of documents you have written to explain how technical systems work ....some demonstrated expertise in software, infrastructure, public cloud, networking, terminals/kiosks, etc. This is a 6–9-month contract to start and you can do this work 100% remotely from where you live in the US. We prefer someone that is working EST or CST hours as we typically are working EST hours. This contract engagement could go longer or could become a full-time role over time. Full benefits are available during the contract engagement.Thanks,Nandit
