Job DescriptionDo you have a talent for interior design, great conversation, and a desire to help your clients create beautiful outdoor and indoor living spaces while you work with exquisite products? Do you have experience with networking and building rapport and opportunities to grow your clientele? If the answer is yes, come join our amazing team as a Design Consultant.Who We AreGabriella White is home to our family of brands - Gabby, Summer Classics, and Wendy Jane. We are growing in all areas of the business and are proud to be family-owned and operated since 1987. Together, we furnish life's best moments, from the every day to the exceptional. We are united by our vision as well as our collective spirit and our culture is shaped by our core values: Dedication – Enthusiasm – Synergy – Integrity – Goal-Oriented – Nimble, or simply put DESIGN.As a premier innovator, manufacturer, and retailer of luxury furniture and accessories, our brands are loved by designers and design-minded consumers for creating timeless outdoor living and transitional, eclectic furniture and accessories for every part of the home. We’re always looking for talented people to join our team and grow together.What We Offer Competitive health, dental, and vision plans 401(k) plan with match after 12 months Employee Assistance Program and Chaplain Services to support mental and emotional well-being Paid sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental time Monthly incentive and/or bonus opportunities Generous Employee Product Purchase discountWhat You DoExecutes client’s vision and leads in all design projects by creating layouts, making product suggestions, and presenting recommendations including scheduled house calls with a minimum of 2 per month. Welcomes our guests into the showroom by providing a friendly, informative atmosphere and assists with guests needs and shares our brand story. Provides updates to the guests’ order on a regular basis and follows through after delivery. Inputs all custom sales for clients with accuracy. Assists with printing and tagging of merchandise in the showroom per brand standards. Assists in the implementation of the sales floor plan and merchandises accessories and rooms within the showroom. Checks order acknowledgements weekly and communicates updates to clients by phone and follow up email. Utilizes Customer Relationship Manager (CRM) daily and frequently updates client’s information. Cleans and helps with upkeep of showroom. Assists with annual inventory and periodic cycle counts. Part-time: Less than 30-hour schedule per week. What You BringTraining and/or Education in Design, Industrial Design, Business, Marketing, or trade membership in Design field highly preferred. Knowledge of the design industry including fabrics, applications and general design practices preferred. Minimum of one year experience in design or luxury retail environment required. Demonstrated ability to sell luxury products. Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication and presentation skills. Proficient computer skills including knowledge of MS Office and iPad required; Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system(s) preferred. Technical knowledge of space planning and ability to use planning software such as RoomSketcher preferred. Problem solving skills and positive, professional demeanor required. Ability to work hours including frequent weekend hours and additional hours during special events.

Junior CNC Programmer - Hybrid (3 days in office) Job, 1+ Year ExperienceAnnual Income: $62K - $78KA valid work permit is necessary in the USAbout us: Patterned Learning is a platform that aims to help developers code faster and more efficiently. It offers features such as collaborative coding, real-time multiplayer editing, and the ability to build, test, and deploy directly from the browser. The platform also provides tightly integrated code generation, editing, and output capabilities.Summary:Determine, maintain, and develop methods of steel, copper, and coil fabrication. Create CNC Turret programming, order tooling and assist fabrication personnel. Work with software vendors for customization needs.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Responsible for the efficient usage of programmed materials. Provides support to efficiently build quality products and meet market demands. Studies and recommends techniques to improve existing CAM and internal software products. Analyzes and determines the most effective material size for production and recommends alternative materials to engineering when appropriate. Troubleshoots NC Programming issues. Maintains current CNC programs and tool libraries. Selects and recommends tooling purchases for new equipment in conjunction with engineering. Coordinates the purchase of tooling with the tooling department. Supplies management with cost data for product pricing. Create and adjust CAD files. Collaborates with engineering regarding design enhancements for cost improvements. Assist in product development and cost reduction. Qualifications:One-year certificate from college or technical school. Benefits401(k) Health insurance Tuition reimbursement Why Patterned Learning LLC?Patterned Learning can provide intelligent suggestions, automate repetitive tasks, and assist developers in writing code more effectively. This can help reduce coding errors, improve productivity, and accelerate the development process.Pattern recognition is particularly relevant in the context of coding. Neural networks, especially deep learning models, are commonly employed for pattern detection and classification tasks. These models simulate human decision-making and can identify patterns in data, making them well-suited for tasks like code analysis and generation.

Company  :Cogent Communications is a multinational, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access and Ethernet transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services in over 206 markets globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A generous base salary, structured tenure pay increases and an uncapped commissions plan offers you an unlimited earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment. Matching 401k and stock options are also included. Responsibilities  : Hunting to identify new business opportunities within a global sales territory and target market segments of IP Transit, Content creators/hosters, Carriers/wholesalers and Netcentric companies.  Through direct calling, email and contact efforts you will identify, qualify, and generate these new business opportunities by working directly with Key Decision Makers.  Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through onsite customer meetings as needed.  Use consultative and relationship building selling techniques to identify current and future connectivity solutions.  Help Cogent customers and prospects by positioning our services for new business by leveraging the global network footprint that includes commercial and retail buildings, carrier neutral hotels, data centers and colocation facilities.  Qualifications  : 3-8+ years of solid, B2B sales experience in a telecom arena with collocation, wholesale experience and data transit and transport.  Proven experience with a track record of success in a direct hunting, B2B sales role and quota achievement.  Demonstrated ability to identify, qualify and generate new business through extensive prospecting and research.  Strong oral and written communication skills are a must.  Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment with revenue deadlines.  Working knowledge of computer applications such as Microsoft Office and a CRM are a plus.  A college degree is preferred but not required.  If this sounds like you apply today!  Compensation: Pay Range: $40,000 - $90,000Commission: UnlimitedAdditional Compensation Potential: National Account Managers have an achievable upside opportunity to grow base pay by up to $25,000 - $35,000 based on performance. Our recruiting team will tell you how!Work Environment: To best support your success, this is an in-office position five days a week, allowing for focused mentorship, training and personal coaching. full description: Job DescriptionMission: (Why we exist as a company)“When one person stands to gain over another, the facts must be uncovered.”We believe that is the essential role of a survey company. We find the facts. We are not the mediator. Attorneys can discuss the meaning and implications of the facts that we uncover, and decisions can be made after the facts are known, but someone has to be willing to discover the truth.Our great state has been under the rule of six different sovereigns, each with equally complex legal principles. Discovering the truth, and making good decisions isn’t always simple.Vision:To protect the lands of TexasBuilding on our reputation that began in 1986 here in Brazos County, our vision is to grow the company to cover all of Texas within the next 10 years. That’s aggressive, but possible. Our plan is to create a culture 1st brand where people matter and quality is a priority. That means a lot of room for growth and opportunity for our staff.Core Values: (How we operate as a company)We took some time to articulate the culture and values that matter to us as a company. Culture isn’t having bean bag chairs, foosball tables, or free lunches in the company cafeteria (Although we do love Fuego tacos on Friday mornings.) Below is a list of our values along with a brief description of what each one means to us:Call Brad when you’re stuck: We once had someone get stuck in a company truck. Instead of calling the office, he called another crew to pull him out. That crew got stuck also. In the end, they called the office and it got handled, but wasted a lot of time. This value is about creating a judgement free zone. It’s ok to make mistakes here. Just let us know so we can help get it fixed. This also means that leadership has to create an environment that is safe to share what went wrong. You’ll be a part of this.Everyone’s welcome at the party: While we do work hard, we also want to have some fun at the party… where everyone is welcome. This is more than just saying you are welcome to be here, but actually feeling it to be true.Tree to Tree (Close enough) isn’t real: For some, “Good enough” is good enough. Where others may have cut corners, it is important that we hold ourselves to a higher standard. Just because there’s a fence there, that doesn’t mean it’s real. Let’s do the work and dig deep, even when it would be easier to call it.Real facts, good opinions: Our work is about precision, and then, making a decision based on information that has been in flux since the 1800s. Texas was once under the rule of six flags, with equally complicated rules for land surveying. We embrace the chaos, while making good judgements about the facts.Treasure hunters that share the map: if we share what we know, we all grow.Don’t move the stones: We respect traditions of the past and know that rules exist for a reason. While we seek to improve, we know that there are boundaries that are to be respected.Travel the untamed frontier: Survey work can be rough, and every job comes with a certain amount of adventure. You have to be ok with uncertainty and working in the elements to truly enjoy the profession. This also applies to learning new things, growing as people, and wanting to improve in all areas of life.Location:Our office is located in Aggieland (Bryan/College Station, in Brazos County, within the Texas Triangle of Dallas, Austin, and Houston, is a great community to raise a family. It isn’t Dallas, or Austin, or Houston. But we think it’s special and hope that you will love it too. If you are an Aggie that wants to return home, you will appreciate the unique environment here and what it can mean for quality of life for you and family.This community is growing, and so are we. Our plans call for us to hire close to 100 people over the next 10 years.The Office:The rest of this job posting attempts to describe the company that we aspire to be. To get there, we need good people and are committed to doing what it takes to improve and accomplish our goals. A “Culture 1st Brand” is what we are building, where we are focusing on a culture of accountability and performance… where people (and how they are treated) matter. If you’ve ever worked somewhere that didn’t provide both, you know how powerful that is when you go home from work each day.Every three months we take time away from work to meet for strategic planning. Together, every member of the team is invited to share what’s working, (what isn’t), and to contribute to a worthwhile goal of becoming better as people, as a team, and as a company.We do have fun, but we also get work done. Movie references sometimes can break the tension of a rough day while eloquently summarizing a situation to make it easier to understand.Normal Job Description Details:Survey Types We Currently Provide:Topographical SurveysLand Title Surveys (Though not a title mill)ALTA SurveysLand Boundary SurveysPartition SurveysBoundary SurveysSurveying for Platting purposesForm SurveysAs-Built Surveys of all sizes and scopeConstruction Surveying and StakingElevation CertificatesUtility Surveying and StakingBuilding EnvelopeWe use Carlson Survey, are improving our benefits, offer health insurance, financial performance bonuses when the company does well, and some other cool things that no one else offers.Note we are looking to hire for this position Summer 2024

Coordination includes calendars, reserving conference rooms/ordering catering if required, setting up conference calls, and video conference calls as needed.Assist with the preparation of various communications such as memoranda and paperwork. full description: Our client is a global leader in Pharmaceutical research and development. They are focused on innovation, continued growth and making an even greater impact as they advance their leading HIV prevention and treatment portfolio and accelerate cutting edge treatments for cancer. They are looking to add a Research Associate to their team.Description: Perform all facets of tissue processing, embedding, sectioning, and staining, handling delicate or challenging specimens with expertise. Ensure the preparation of high-quality sections for microscopic examination. Efficiently manage both clinical and non-clinical sample logistics and management, ensuring proper handling, processing, and storage in compliance with established protocols. Perform routine staining techniques such as H&E on tissues with precision. Perform high-resolution scanning of stained slides, ensuring accurate digital capture for downstream analysis, with an emphasis on standardized image naming and meticulous data organization. Implement QC measures for histological integrity, covering equipment upkeep, standard practices, accurate sample handling, issue resolution, and data accuracy checks. Manage reagents and consumables inventory, optimizing stock levels and procurement. Uphold and enforce laboratory safety protocols and regulatory compliance, including hazardous material handling and disposal, to maintain a safe working environment. Streamline laboratory workflows and techniques to boost efficiency and quality of output. Collaborate on research projects, contributing to the development of new technologies and the improvement of existing processes. Participate in experimental design, data analysis, and the dissemination of findings. Mentor and train junior staff in histological techniques, safety protocols, and laboratory procedures. Pursue continuous learning to adopt industry advancements and share insights with the team.Top 3 Required Skill Sets:  Advanced Histology techniques and Equipment Proficiency Quality Control and Lab Management Analytical Skills and Attention to DetailSkills:histology, tissue preparation, tissue sectioning, quality control, analytical, digital pathology, molecular pathology, project managementTop Skills Details:histology,tissue preparation,tissue sectioning,quality control,analyticalAdditional Skills & Qualifications:Required Years of Experience: 5 yearsRequired Degree or Certification: BS Degree in Histotechnology, Biology, or related fieldAbout ActalentActalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.Diversity, Equity & InclusionAt Actalent, diversity and inclusion are a bridge towards the equity and success of our people. This position will counsel prospective applicants on the admissions process and opportunities at the University of Montana.Responsibilities Include:Providing one-on-one and group admissions counseling to diverse populations. You can too!Position: Remote Sales RepresentativeWhat's Cool About Us:Earn up to $30,000 in training bonuses (besides your regular commissions) during your first 120 days – cha-ching!Work a chill 3-4 day week for that sweet work-life balance.No more cold calls! job title: Senior Director of Technical Program Management (Bank Tech)
full description: Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, VirginiaSenior Director of Technical Program Management (Bank Tech)Are you interested in leading programs that deliver on critical business goals and build large scale products & platforms?About Capital One: At Capital One, we're changing banking for good. We were founded on the belief that no one should be locked out of the financial system. We're dedicated to helping foster a world where everyone has an equal opportunity to prosper.We're a bank, but we don't think like one. We're always thinking about what's next, about how we can innovate and inspire, and about how we can develop the tools our customers need to improve their financial lives - by leveraging best in class technology. That's where you come in.About the team: As a Sr. Director of Technical Program Management (TPM) on Capital One's Enterprise product & platform organization, we're looking for someone that can help us build solid platforms on mobile and web surfaces that will help Capital One customers have incredible experiences. The platforms are the foundational blocks on which Capital One's various lines of businesses (like credit card, retail banking, auto finance) will build delightful experiences for our customers.In addition to the technical program, you will also work to pave the way for an expanding TPM discipline within the team, by leveraging your industry knowledge and experience to teach the organization what a great TPM can achieve.Our TPM Sr. Directors HaveStrong technical backgrounds (ideally building highly scalable platforms, products, or services) with the ability to proactively identify and mitigate technical risks throughout delivery life-cycleExperience building and leading a world-class team of technical program managers with a mission to power real-time, intelligent experiences for our customers and associatesLead technology focused discussions with senior leadership by providing valuable insights and recommendations that guide technology-based decisionsExceptional communication and collaboration skillsExcellent problem solving and influencing skillsA quantitative approach to problem solving and a collaborative implementer to holistic solutions; a systems thinkerExperienced TPM leader to grow and develop a team of TPMs, while also building the foundations for the TPM practiceAbility to simplify the technically complex and drive well-educated decisions across product, engineering, design, and data science representativesDeep focus on execution, follow-through, accountability, and resultsExceptional cross-team collaboration; able to work across different functions, organizations, and reporting boundaries to get the job done.Highly tuned emotional intelligence, good listener, and deep seated empathy for teams and partnersBasic QualificationsBachelor's degreeAt least 9 years of experience managing technical programsPreferred Qualifications9+ years of experience designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing.5+ years of experience in building distributed systems & highly available services using cloud computing services / architecture - preferably using AWS5+ years of building & leading experienced TPM team5+ years experience building highly scalable mobile products & platforms5+ years of experience with Agile delivery5+ years years experience delivering large and complex programs - where you own the business or technical vision, collaborate with large cross-functional teams, secure commitments on deliverables and unblock teams to land business impactExperience in building systems & solutions within a highly regulated environmentBachelor's degree in a related technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering)MBA or Master's Degree in a related technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering) or equivalent experienceAt this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.The minimum and maximum full-time annual salaries for this role are listed below, by location. Please note that this salary information is solely for candidates hired to perform work within one of these locations, and refers to the amount Capital One is willing to pay at the time of this posting. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.New York City (Hybrid On-Site): $272,600 - $311,200 for Sr. Director, Technical Program ManagementCandidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate's offer letter.This role is also eligible to earn performance based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). Incentives could be discretionary or non discretionary depending on the plan.Capital One offers a comprehensive, competitive, and inclusive set of health, financial and other benefits that support your total well-being. Learn more at theCapital One Careers website. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.This role is expected to accept applications for a minimum of 5 business days.No agencies please. Capital One is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender reassignment, citizenship, immigration status, protected veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under applicable federal, state or local law. Capital One promotes a drug-free workplace. Capital One will consider for employment qualified applicants with a criminal history in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable laws regarding criminal background inquiries, including, to the extent applicable, Article 23-A of the New York Correction Law; San Francisco, California Police Code Article 49, Sections 4901-4920; New York City's Fair Chance Act; Philadelphia's Fair Criminal Records Screening Act; and other applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations regarding criminal background inquiries.If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation, please contact Capital One Recruiting at 1-800-304-9102 or via email at RecruitingAccommodation@capitalone.com. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.comCapital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).SimplyApply

Description:The Labeling Associate is responsible for Quality Control check and assigning Tissue product a label.Position Overview/ Responsibilities: Receives processed human tissue grafts for accuracy. Ensures proper customer labeling is prepared and performs final quality check. Ensures all paperwork, data entry, labeling, and inspection of human tissue grafts are completed accurately. Locates quarantined donors, prepares for labeling, and applies labels to the appropriate tissues.Compares total number of donor deposits to processing paperwork, verifies labels, and inspects quality of tissue. The tissue will be in packaged slides. The associate will put the tissue under a lit microscope and compare it to a reference sheet to check for things like shape, color, etc.Skills:Quality ControlQuality AssuranceDocumentationLabelingInspectionProductionData EntryTissue ProcessingAdditional Skills & Qualifications:1-2 years of experience in Quality Assurance Labeling or related field preferred Working knowledge of computers and basic data entry skills required High School diploma or equivalent requiredAbout ActalentActalent is a global leader in engineering and sciences services and talent solutions. We help visionary companies advance their engineering and science initiatives through access to specialized experts who drive scale, innovation and speed to market. With a network of almost 30,000 consultants and more than 4,500 clients across the U.S., Canada, Asia and Europe, Actalent serves many of the Fortune 500.Diversity, Equity & InclusionAt Actalent, diversity and inclusion are a bridge towards the equity and success of our people. DE&I are embedded into our culture through:Hiring diverse talentMaintaining an inclusive environment through persistent self-reflectionBuilding a culture of care, engagement, and recognition with clear outcomesEnsuring growth opportunities for our peopleThe company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regard to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please email actalentaccommodation@actalentservices.com for other accommodation options.

Company:Cogent Communications is a global, Tier 1 facilities-based ISP, consistently ranked as one of the top five networks in the world and is publicly traded on the NASDAQ Stock Market under the ticker symbol CCOI. Cogent specializes in providing businesses with high speed Internet access and Ethernet transport services. Cogent's facilities-based, all-optical IP network backbone provides IP services globally. Since its inception, Cogent has unleashed the benefits of IP technology, building one of the largest and highest capacity IP networks in the world. This network enables Cogent to offer large bandwidth connections at highly competitive prices. Cogent also offers superior customer support by virtue of its end-to-end control of service delivery and network monitoring. A competitive base salary and a full benefits package including; Health, Dental, Vision, Paid Time Off ( PTO), Short- and Long-Term Disability, Life Insurance, Holidays, Parental Leave, 401 ( k) plan with employer match, stock options, and an Employee Assistance Program. Most benefits take effect within 30 days of employment, and some require a waiting period.Responsibilities:Design, develop and deliver a sales training program within assigned sales regionCollaborate with sales leadership to identify, recommend, and implement training solutions that maximize organizational efficiencies and performanceAssist in coordination and delivery of new hire training programs, including some coaching and training on certain topics and tasksFocus on newly hired account managers aligned with the Onboarding Program with topics to include: Sourcing/Prospecting, Impact Statements, Qualifying Opportunities, B2B sales processes, technical product launches, CRM/SystemSupport Regional Initiatives to include: Tracking and communicating training progress within the region, launching regional training programs as needed to support the sales organizationConduct needs assessments and identifies areas for additional learning opportunity to ensure the region meets its business objectiveQualifications:Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceDetailed knowledge of all aspects of the Telecom industry to include IP, Data, WAN productsIn-depth knowledge of selling skills conceptsAbility to work in a fast-paced environmentPrevious sales experience; travel up to 75% monthlyCOVID-19 Policy:Cogent has adopted a mandatory vaccination and booster policy which requires all U.S. employees to be fully vaccinated with one booster against COVID-19. Prior to beginning employment, new employees must provide proof of vaccination or apply for and receive an accommodation to be exempt from the policy.By submitting an application or resume for this position, I understand that is an in-office position and agree to abide Cogent’s mandatory vaccination policy.To apply for the Regional Learning Manager position, please submit your resume and cover letter to careers@cogentco.com.Cogent Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job DescriptionSales Engineer - NDT This is an in-office position working in Lawrenceville, GA **The Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) vertical of Rad Source Technologies is focused on solving the complex issues that NDT customers face regardless of vendor. The Sales Engineer is responsible for supporting sales executives in solution selling to prospects, executing strategic deals, modeling financial business cases, and matching customer requirements to proposed solutions. They possess technical expertise, strong communication and presentation skills. Responsibilities include improving existing mechanical systems, developing new product concepts and prototypes, designing, and testing mechanical and electronic systems, and developing various automated systems. In addition, this position will lead the proposal process with an emphasis on systems, drawings, and process.To be successful as a Sales Engineer, you should be able to work within demanding timeframes and develop original, practical solutions to problems. Outstanding candidates draw on a wide range of engineering principles and are not afraid to wander into unchartered territory.Responsibilities:This position will be responsible for System Design layouts, using Solid Works and PDM, for a variety of applications. The Sales Engineer will create a build-to design package with BOMs and assembly directions such that the package can be delivered to a manufacturer without questions. This position will lead the commercial front end process of proposal management including systems, tools, formats, and content. Provides this in conjunction with Net-Suite. Will contribute to Designing, developing, and enhancing electro-mechanical systems. Robotic systems, and mechatronic devices. Develops schematics, logic diagrams, and other control diagrams. Develops mechanical and electromechanical prototypes. Assists in designing and developing advanced test equipment/methods for NDT systems. Identifies areas of weakness in the production line or finished products and makes recommendations for improvement. Identifies current and future customer service requirements by establishing personal rapport with potential and actual customers and others in a position to understand service requirements. Contributes to sales engineering effectiveness by identifying short-term and long-range issues that must be addressed, recommending options and courses of action, and implementing directives. Serves customers by identifying their needs and engineering adaptations of products, equipment, and services. Develops customer staff by providing technical information and training. Provides product, service, or equipment technical and engineering information by answering questions and requests. Design and manufacture custom control systems used in manufacturing, delivery, and manufacturing processes. Assisting with recruitment, onboarding, and training of junior Engineers or Apprentices. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies. Requirements:BSc in mechanical, electrical or mechatronics engineering or similar. Strong mathematical, analytical, and creative thinking skills. Experience in electronic or mechanical design, automated test equipment, embedded system design/programming, robotic automation, and integrated test systemsStrong knowledge of mechanical design, assembly, and testing of electronic and electronic-mechanical assembliesStrong knowledge of CAD software, specifically, SolidWorks, and is RequiredStrong knowledge of material properties for choosing alloys in designs, as well as fastener properties, coatings, and graphics choicesAbility to work in a fast-paced environment with a sense of urgency. Willingness to learn new technologies, processes, and skills. Willingness to work on a small team with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision. Rad Source Technologies, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic as established by law.Disclaimer: This job description may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the job described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of the Employer.Company DescriptionRad Source was founded in 1997 for the purpose of creating non-gamma irradiation alternatives. Even prior to the more recent security issues associated with radioactive gamma sources, the company’s vision was to solve environmental disposal and related practical issues associated with “hot” source equipment.Based on that, we introduced our first products in 1999 incorporating x-ray technology including the first FDA cleared x-ray blood irradiator as well as our laboratory research x-ray irradiator, the RS 2000.Since then, we’ve continued expanding our capabilities and adding to our proprietary x-ray based irradiation technology, developing proprietary x-ray sources and new equipment. We are a global enterprise and our equipment resides in major pharmaceutical labs, healthcare institutions and renowned universities around the world. We are based in Buford, Georgia, USA where our highly qualified and dedicated staff continues to develop our technology, design and produce our equipment.Rad Source was founded in 1997 for the purpose of creating non-gamma irradiation alternatives. Job DescriptionWelder Job Description:FabTech Supply, a division of Chancey Metals LLC, is a leading manufacturer of OEM Parts and Products. With over 90% of our products made in-house, we eliminate most supply chain issues companies face with imported products. When producing high-volume parts, the parts can be grouped, assembled, and/or packaged in a manner that facilitates efficient use in the factory. Various hard-to-control kits and assemblies can become catalog items for ease of ordering and are available from stock.We are a looking for two (2) skilled Welders to join our team. The ideal candidate is reliable and able to work safely with attention to detail, while also looking to improve the processes in place when needed. The ideal candidate would have 3+ years of experience.Responsibilities & Requirements:**Plus if you have prior experience welding aluminum with TIG**Welder with skills that should include:Welding, reading blueprints, cutting, and bending all types of materialsMig and Tig WeldingPlus if working knowledge and experience running Press Brake, Roller and ShearAnalytic skillsAttention to detailTEAMWORK and communication skills are a mustHigh school diploma or equivalent; technical degree is a plusWork efficiently and independently with minimal guidanceAbility to stand for long periods of timeExperience in operation of various manufacturing equipmentWork Environment:Working in a manufacturing or warehouse environment, you will be walking, standing and engaging in movement throughout the day, and occasionally to frequently be required to lift items weighing up to 50 lbs. Due to a large variety of job duties (both routine and non-routine), certain duties also may involve, a variety of physical activities including bending, lifting, stooping, turning, twisting, pushing, pulling, raising arms above shoulders and head, standing, working in enclosed areas, climbing stairs or ladders, and operating heavy machinery. The noise level in the work environment can vary but noise is usually moderate to high. You will be required to wear personal protective equipment such as hard hat, safety glasses, safety gloves, hearing protection, a respirator or dust mask, protective footwear and protective clothing. Work may be performed in cold and/or hot temperatures and the environment can be dusty. At times, the ability to work overtime also MAY be required. The ability to perform these requirements is necessary to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. full description: Job DescriptionSummary Under the direction of the Plant Manager. This position will utilize CAD systems to generate designs for piece parts, component assemblies, testing equipment, and layouts. This position converts CAD models and assemblies into detail drawings that include all dimensions, tolerancing and notes necessary for repetitive manufacturing. This individual will produce simple, accurate, and cost-effective documentation for fabrication and assembly.Essential Duties And ResponsibilitiesThis list of duties and responsibilities is not all inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties and responsibilities as management may deem necessary from time to time.Uses computer aided design/drafting software to develop designs. Creates, maintains and makes revisions to Solid Works models on production drawings (component part, layout, and assembly drawings) that include detailed multi-views and critical details with all necessary dimensions. Generates piece parts, weldments and assemblies of proposed designs in appropriate 2D and 3D CAD system, checks dimension of parts, material to be used, relation of one part to another, and relation of various parts to whole structure or project. Utilizes knowledge of various manufacturing principles, engineering practices, mathematics, materials, and physical sciences to complete detailed designs and drawings. Weldment drawings will show weld symbols, size, and location of welds. Location of parts listed in BOM and critical dimensions will be identified. Supportive referenced dimensioning will be utilized for verifying accuracy and quality of weldment for production and quality personnel. First Article of InspectionsBOM maintenance, job order entry and verificationAssists in creating, testing and evaluating prototypes and production components for performance and durability. Issues work orders to designated departments to be manufactured. Creates and maintains drafting standards utilizing appropriate company guidelines that incorporate OSHA and ANSI. Responsible for setting up and maintaining an organized file system for all Production Drawings. Prepares and enters into an ERP system the Bills of Materials, Production Versions, Engineering Change Notice, and requests Purchase Orders. Checks documentation for compliance with internal Aluma KLM standards. Communicates effectively and professionally with Purchasing, QA, Engineering, Maintenance, and Manufacturing regarding new and revised designs or drawings and submits designs to suppliers for a quote. Responsible for building prototype parts utilizing the appropriate 2D and 3D drawings and assisting engineers with prototype construction and sample builds. Able to complete projects with limited supervision. Verify dimension and material for parts and assemblies. Adhere to Engineering Standard Practices, Lean Principles, company policy and guidelines for attendance and safety. Maintain retention of master production drawings. Good problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Contribute to design process and recommend possible solutions. Works closely with R&D, Production lines, Assembly, FAB, Mill and Saw leaders, as well as dealers, suppliers, and customers on details of product solutions on what problems may arise. Other duties as assigned. Job Skills RequirementsKnowledge of Solid Works and manual drafting practices and techniques. Maintain documentation control using ECN, ECR, ERP and EPDM software. Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, Outlook, and Power Point. Demonstrates ability to meet timelines and prioritize work requirements. Produces the required amount of work required of the position. Quality of Work - Performs work according to requirements with regard to appearance, quality, completeness, etc., whether self-initiated or supervised. Excellent oral and written communication. Continuous Improvement experience. Experience implementing Lean Manufacturing processes. Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills. Education RequirementsThe skills, knowledge, and abilities usually acquired through the completion of an Associate of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering or Computer Aided Design and Drafting along with five years' experience in the workplace.Physical DemandsThe physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the colleague is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, talk, or hear; uses hands to finger, handle, or touch objects or controls. On occasion, the colleague may be required to stoop, bend, or reach above the shoulders. The colleague may occasionally lift, push, or pull up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. Specific vision abilities required include close, distance, color, depth, and peripheral vision. Work EnvironmentThe work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

job title: Fire and Gas Life Safety Project Manager
full description: Job DescriptionMinimum Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or equivalent field preferred. 5-7 years of LSS/FLS and Project Management experience. 3-5 years experience with a facility, construction, or maintenance company, in which working conditions occasionally required the use of PPE due to exposure to environmental/health/safety hazards. Experience working in Labs, Semiconductor Facilities, and/or Biopharmaceutical is preferred. Proficient use of MS-Word, Excel, PowerPoint, ProjectSolid analytical and problem-solving skillsSkills to identify issues and proactively respond to project issuesStrong written and oral communication skills to exchange informationKnowledgeable of departmental processes & policies, and, applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations. Extended standing and moderate to heavy lifting is occasionally required. Requires a good deal of walking and some climbing (stairs, ladders, etc.) on a daily basis. Skilled in operating a laptop and Microsoft applications. Skilled in offering viable solutions for problem solving. Ability to work independently, prioritize multiple tasks & work requests, adapt to needed changes, & comprehend technical language. Effectively communicate both in writing and verbally. Exercise considerable judgment and initiative, manage time effectively, and interact positively with staff and contractors in order to enhance effectiveness and to promote quality service. Tasks and Responsibilities:Life Safety Systems operations and maintenance. Will collaborate with tool installations and operations and maintenance in a high-paced semiconductor plant. Managing system capacity, reliability, and uptime as well as all documentation required to safely operate LSS systems. Managing fire alarm (JCI), fire protection (WSFP, KFPI, Viking), gas detection (Honeywell) vendorsSustaining and construction support for Fire/Evacuation, Early Warning Smoke Detection, and Hazardous Production Material (HPM) alarm systems and detection equipment, Fire Protection Systems (Wet, Dry, Pre-Action, CO2)Act as a liaison to daily tactical operations customer requests. Role model safety practices always. Life Safety System ownership: Fire System – Simplex Grinnell, Toxic and Flammable Gas analyzers/sensors - Honeywell Gas Detection (Midas, Vertex, FTIR, XCD), Early Smoke Detection systems – VESDA, CO2 Systems - KFPIMaintenance of record files & reports via LSS One Drive & Sharepoint directoryLSS presenter for Daily Ops & Weekly Tool Install Tracker meetingsLSS SIPP submission & coordination for Tool Installation & Facilities/Construction projectsCoordinating, scheduling, and managing of PM (preventive maintenance)/Testing/Inspections/Repairs with vendors – Weekly/Monthly/Annually of campus-wide (both Fremont & Livermore) fire & gas systemsFACP testing (Annual) scheduling and support of vendorsFire Protection testing scheduling and support of vendorsCritical spares inventory management (devices, parts, smoke/duct detectors, etc.)Service calls & emails with LSS onsite vendorSubmission Requirements:At a minimum, the candidate’s professional resume must include the following:List of all Educational AchievementList of all Professional Licenses or CertificatesList of Awards ReceivedDetailed Employment History with each company or government agency including:Name & Contact Information of the firm or agencyStart Date and End Date (Month & Year)Positions HeldList of Projects/Programs Managed including project value, location of assignment, roles and responsibilities and contribution to each projectCompany DescriptionPMCS Group is a full service project management, construction management and inspection services firm with over 18 years’ experience in successful project delivery. Since our inception in 2005, our team has supported numerous entities and public works projects in the Southern California region. Our team is currently supporting entities such as the City of Los Angeles, Bureaus of Engineering, Sanitation, and Street Services; Los Angeles County Department of Public Works; Port of Long Beach; Los Angeles County Metropolitan Transportation Authority; Los Angeles Unified School District; Los Angeles Community College District (LACCD), and; California State University Long Beach, to name a few. Our team’s commitment to partnering has led to the successful delivery of over $4B worth of projects without any claims.PMCS has expanded our expertise into the private sector, particularly focusing on large scale advanced technology and mission critical projects. Our team has delivered microchip manufacturing facilities, cleanrooms, labs and large scale data center facilities. We’ve expanded our reach into Northern California, Arizona, Oregon, Washington, Texas, and other states. PMCS supports entities such as QTS Data Centers, Vantage Data Centers, Cologix Data Centers, Intel, Lam Research, Samsung, TSMC, and others.PMCS Group’s project portfolio also includes numerous public facility projects, such as the Port of Long Beach Fireboat Station 20 project, major water resource projects, including the City of LA / LAWA Argo Drain Sub-Basin Facility Project, and major educational projects, like the California State University Long Beach Parkside North Housing Residence Project. We bring extensive transportation and infrastructure project experience, including our work as a joint venture partner on LACMTA’s Purple Line Project and our work on LA County Department of Public Works’ Santa Anita dam.We believe that every project success is based on partnering, collaboration, and consolidating resource pools to provide our clients with the optimum balance of flexibility and responsiveness needed to achieve high quality results for the best value.PMCS Group is a full service project management, construction management and inspection services firm with over 18 years’ experience in successful project delivery. Job Description:We’re Hiring! Alabama Market President – Birmingham, AL Celebrating over 100 years in the community, Citizens Trust Bank remains committed to providing personalized service and financial solutions to meet the growing needs of our customers. We are committed to our institution’s values of Integrity, Collaboration, Innovation, Service Excellence, Respect, Accountability, and Leadership, all of which are needed to continue our mission of empowering generations for financial success. By joining our team, you can expect opportunities to enhance personal accomplishments and professional growth. Interested in this position and meet the qualifications and requirements? Apply at www.ctbconnect.com. Questions? Contact us at 404-575-8262. Position Summary: We seek a talented and experienced Market President to lead and oversee our Alabama market. The Alabama Market President reports to the President/CEO and serves as a senior management team member; provides leadership and direction and manages the Alabama market area’s financial and market strategies and activities to ensure short and long-range profitability and planned growth for the market. Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Leads all market area associates in executing strategic and tactical plans to achieve growth, business development, and financial targets.Coordinates the business activity of the market; targets and maintains extensive contact with individuals, businesses, and centers of influence with a focus on the metro Birmingham and Alabama area; maintains extensive contact with customers and the community; plans and schedules proactive visits to prospective customers; aggressively solicits and competes for profitable business, opportunities, loans, deposits, and other banking relationships; establishes and retains effective and lasting business and customer, relationships; responds quickly to referrals and evaluates the creditworthiness of prospective customers. Achieves all established goals, objectives, and expectations, including funded commercial and consumer loan goals, portfolio growth goals, retail banking and deposit growth goals, fee income goals, and other bank products, services, solutions, and objectives while increasing customer satisfaction and retention.Negotiates complex pricing, loan structure, and loan agreement terms with borrowers.Attends, participates, promotes, and represents the bank in the market at business, professional, and community events, meetings, organizations, associations, programs, functions, and activities to support and broaden the bank’s image and visibility. Serves on the bank, business, and other bank-related professional committees, boards, and other related functions; participates in CRA activities, community organizations, and projects. Analyzes, reviews, and structures new loan requests, including highly complex loans of various loan types and industries; approves loans within loan policy guidelines and up to amounts allowed in lending authority limits and presents all requests in excess of individual lending authority to loan committees for approval.Manages relationships to ensure maximum profitability and credit quality, including new cross-sell business opportunities, monitoring regional loan maturity reports, and ensuring loan renewals and problems loans are handled promptly. Maintains a sound loan portfolio and provides accurate assessments of the loan portfolio; ensures that grading and credit quality standards, legal and technical compliance procedures, and lending policy are consistent; manages the bank’s credit risk program by monitoring the lender liability, environmental liability, loan officer fraud, loan documentation deficiencies, etc.Reports the financial results of market operations, the status of loans, banking competition, and new business developments to executive management and the board; maintains updated pipeline reports and prospect database; reviews and analyzes divisional reports and performance for the market; develops and implements effective action plans to generate expected results; and ensures that established deadlines are met consistently. Provides strong leadership by maintaining a viable organizational structure by dispensing advice, guidance, and direction, creating a positive work environment that promotes good communication, rewards a high level of staff performance, encourages employee development, and plans for management succession.Identifies, recruits, and retains strong talent to create a high-performing team while driving employee and community engagement and a culture of inclusion.Regularly conducts effective and efficient staff meetings; increases employee retention; effectively coaches and trains team members; completes timely performance reviews and meets regularly with direct reports to review job performance and expectations and develop performance goals and objectives; develops clear job descriptions, training plans, career development strategies and plans for direct reports to foster professional growth development and mentor future company leaders; engages, monitors, and develops staff to improve performance and/or enhance skills and capabilities; implements corrective actions plansRegularly attends all Leadership, Board, Officer Loan Committee, Director Loan Committee, Deal Flow, Sales, Technology, and other committee and management meetings as requested and/or required. Ensures weekly business development activities are completed and reinforces them with active, ongoing role modeling and coaching while enforcing day-to-day relationship-building behaviors. Facilitates effective and efficient meetings and training sessions. Job DescriptionIowa Sports Management is a company that offers a total scope of design, management and development services for the health club and spa industry. Our range of services is complete – from conception to operations. We design facilities, develop operational systems and provide ongoing management. ISM has grown to a company of more than 500 employees and manages over 30 properties, including some of the most prestigious sites in the New York metropolitan area. A longstanding client relationship is the trademark of Iowa Sports Management. Below is a job description of the Lifeguard position.Lifeguard Job DescriptionEssential FunctionsIowa Sports Management's Lifeguards are responsible for maintaining a safe environment in and around the pool area. They are responsible for the safety of all members/residents using the pool, including vigilant observation of pool users, enforcing all pool rules and policies, and performing lifesaving duties in accordance with American Red Cross Lifeguard Certification standards. They must also identify and respond to all emergencies quickly, professionally and decisively in accordance with ISM procedures, and administer first aid and CPR as required. Daily attendance is required.Other Primary TasksIdentify and report potential accident hazards and safety issues. Attentiveness to and prevention of accidents in and around the pool. Responsible for certain pool related maintenance to ensure the facility and pool remain safe, clean, and a friendly environment for all patrons, including but not limited to adding water to the pool when necessary, sweeping pool floor and skimming out any debris, sweeping/mopping pool deck over the course of every shift and as needed and other tasks as needed or directed. Monitor and record pool chemical levels on an hourly basis and keep the facility manager informed of any changes or unusual readings. Constant communication with supervisor. Secondary TaskA little service goes a long way; learn members’ routines and habits - e.g.: if you know that the resident always uses a kickboard, take one out for them. Remain thoroughly apprised and familiar with all ISM and client policies and procedures. Be available to substitute for other staff members. Fill out incident reports for any first aid or event that occurs in the facility or pool area. Clean the surrounding fixtures in the pool, including, but not limited to any stainless steel and glass. Maintain log of the daily usage/attendance at the pool. Carry out additional duties as assigned by the facility manager and supervisors. Attend all staff meetings and in-service trainings as scheduled. Be proactive – if there is a hazard anywhere in the facility, notify facility manager and correct the situation. Qualifications NeededCurrent American Red Cross Lifeguard certification or equivalent. Current American Red Cross CPR certification or equivalent. Complete ISM’s pre-employment water skills assessmentSufficient fluency in English for water safety/lifesaving purposesSelf-motivated with the ability to work without constant supervisionStrong problem-solving and interpersonal skills. General knowledge of pool chemicals. Ability to interact professionally with patrons regarding concerns, problems, or any other significant issues. To learn more, visit www.iowasports.nycISM is an equal opportunity employer.

With over 600 happy clients, Privileged Paws is the premiere dog walking and pet-sitting provider for North Dallas. Since 2015, we have believed that pet care is not a hobby and more than just a job. Come join our amazing employee-based team, where we believe in ongoing learning, a supportive management team, and competitive wages.Position:Pet Care Specialist with a strong emphasis on dog walking.Dog Walking Schedule: Monday through Friday, generally from 7:30am to 3:00pm. Please note that your schedule would depend on your availability, performance, and client demand. No two weeks are ever alike in the pet care industry.You may have dog walking opportunities up until about 5:30pm and up to about 25 hours of work per week. This is designed to be a part-time role. This next role will be in Dallas, but we also service Bluffview, Highland Park, Knox-Henderson, Melshire Estates, Midway Hollow, Northwood Hills, Oak Lawn, Park Cities, Preston Hollow, Prestonwood, Russwood Acres, Univeristy Park and Uptown. Compensation:$17 / hour (the position will start at $17 per hour before bonuses, 100% client gratuity, and future performance reviews)$1000 - $2000 / month (earnings will be dependent on your availability, performance, and client demand)Additional bonuses for overnight service (normally 8pm to 7am, working from a client's home).Mileage reimbursement (we design routes to limit driving to 10 minutes or less between clients whenever possible). Increased pay for off-peak shifts (evenings/weekends/holidays), candidate and client referrals bonuses. Paid training, including Pet CPR and First Aid CertificationsThe responsibilities:Create a safe and positive walking environment for our clients' dogs. Job DescriptionJob Summary:Are you excited about working in an environment where you can spearhead innovative research and development projects? Do you have a genuine interest in driving technological advancements and making a lasting impact within the company?Your role goes beyond achieving objectives; it's about driving transformation, creating groundbreaking solutions, and, above all, ensuring our organization remains at the forefront of innovation.As a Project Manager focused on research and development, you will be working with industry leaders, responsible for driving the development of groundbreaking solutions. Collaboration with cross-functional teams and adaptability to a changing environment are key to your success. If you possess strong project leadership skills, a history of successfully advancing research and development initiatives, and are dedicated to achieving exceptional results, we invite you to join our team.Key Responsibilities:Project Management: Lead and oversee projects related to research and development of critical power technology. Develop comprehensive project plans considering development milestones, resource allocation, and technical constraints. Collaboration: Act as a central point of coordination among cross-functional teams, facilitating the identification and communication of R&D objectives and priorities to ensure our innovations meet and exceed company expectations. Stakeholder Engagement: Maintain transparent and effective communication with all relevant stakeholders, providing regular updates on progress and any alterations to the project scope or timeline. Documentation: Create and maintain detailed project documentation, including development plans, progress reports, and research outcomes. Risk Assessment: Proactively identify potential research challenges, develop mitigation strategies, and establish contingency plans to minimize disruptions to ongoing projects. Team-Centric Collaboration: Actively engage with internal teams to gather insights and ensure that R&D projects align with strategic goals, while fostering seamless collaboration and knowledge sharing among cross-functional teams for project execution. Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in engineering, project management, or a related field. Proven experience as a Project Manager in a research and development environment. Strong understanding of switchgear and critical power systems. Proficiency in project management software and research tools. Exceptional communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills. Ability to collaborate effectively within a cross-functional team. Solid problem-solving and decision-making capabilities. Meticulous attention to detail and a steadfast commitment to quality. Additional Qualifying FactorsMust be able to complete criminal record background check. Must have a valid driver’s license. Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)Must comply with all company policies. Physical Requirements: Must be able to lift up to twenty-five pounds at times. Job Type: Full-time: Competitive salary dependent upon experience. Benefits:Health, Dental, Vision Insurance401kPaid Time OffPotential for Profit Sharing Work Environment:May work in various settings at the Maverick Power facilities, in offices, in multiple shops, and in commercial buildings. Hiring for the following area near Los Angeles CA.CoapTech is a Baltimore-based medical device company commercializing a new platform called the PUMA System, which allows ultrasound to be utilized in hollow organ cavities. The PUMA (Point-of-care Ultrasound Magnet Aligned) System enables several new minimally invasive, bedside medical procedures, substantially reducing costs while improving patient safety and experience. The platform's first product application, PUMA-G for ultrasound gastrostomy in adults, has been cleared for use in the U.S. by the FDA via the 510(k) pathway and has received a CE mark. Your role will be to function under the direction of the Manager/Director. Must be flexible with work hours to meet customer need, this may include short notice assignments and weekends. Must be dependable, accountable, and cooperative. The Clinical Product Specialist augments the sales process for all PUMA systems, partnering with sales and the current or intended customer to drive the clinical aspects of product evaluations, implementations and training needs to advance and/or maintain stages within the sales cycle, with the sole purpose of case support. The Clinical Product Specialist will also assist in tradeshows, workshops, and society conferences as needed.Activities include, but are not limited to, onsite case support, presentation delivery, comprehensive training plan development, didactic program delivery, objection handling, and solution positioning that supports the safe and effective use of the CoapTech product portfolio. This job will require 85-90% travel including overnight.You will report to our Director of Customer Experience.What You Will DoBuild and maintain relationships with clients and key personnel within our client companies.Conduct regular business reviews to ensure clients are satisfied with our products and services.Manage multiple projects at varying stages.Escalate and resolve areas of concern as raised by clients.Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure client satisfaction.Travel as needed to provide on-site case support.What You Will BringOur ideal candidate will have 3-5 years of relevant experience and the following credentials/skills:Ultrasound Imaging, Registered Diagnostic Medical SonographerInterventional RadiologyInterventional ProceduresARRT/RDMSWe Offer The Following BenefitsHealth Insurance401(k)Vacation LeaveSalary DOEEmployment Type: Full TimeYears Experience: 3 - 5 yearsBonus/Commission: Yes

Job DescriptionJob Overview:This program is rooted in Healing Center Engagement and trauma-informed care. The Youth and Family Social Worker will facilitate healing circles with: 1) youth to address mental health disparities for youth of color and, 2) youth serving colleagues to address compassion fatigue 3) generates referrals, resource and assets. They will serve as a referral and linkage specialist, linking colleagues, youth and families to resources that promote wellness, including behavioral health services. Services provided will be youth centered and offered during timeframes when youth are able to access them, weekdays, with some evening and weekend.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:Combine personal skills with assigned consultant experience to facilitate healing circles with youth to address mental health disparities for youth of color. Plan and facilitate healing circles for youth serving adults to address compassion fatigue. Provide interventions that focus on stabilizing the youth; teaching and modeling effective strategies and coping skills; identifying, increasing, and utilizing natural strengths, supports, and resources; preparing for crisis situations; improvement in overall functioning. Coordinate care with additional services such as psychiatry, nursing, medical, and educational services. Deliver, at a minimum annually, internal training to staff and external training to collaborative members on topics related to best ways to interact with the youth to support their therapeutic treatment from an HCE and Trauma informed lensed. Receive supervision that includes both regular and consistent meetings. Perform other job-related duties as assigned. This position will be knowledgeable about and actively support 1) culturally competent, recovery-based practices; 2) person-centered planning as a shared decision-making process with the individual, who defines his/her own life goals and is assisted in developing a unique path toward those goals; and 3) an HCE trauma informed culture to aid individuals in their recovery process. Community PROMISE Background:A multi-sector movement where adults keep their promise to support youth in their endeavor to be ready for college work and life (optimal health), and youth mobilize all the promise that lies in their talents, hearts and minds. Major project components will include; The Promise Collaborative; Community PROMISE Evidence-Based Intervention, and Community PROMISE events, where you will engage parents to participate in gathering their child’s role model stories for our “shoots.” As a result, these authentic stories will help us build the “Promise brand.” Stories will be distributed by teens via social media and interwoven into Detroit area communications, billboards, a website, and small-print media distributed in high schools and gathering places!ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Program Planning & Support Identify, plan, direct, and evaluate parent engagement activities, and events in partnership with educators, school staff, & stakeholders Work 1:1 with OST youth to create individualized success plans and case management as needed, Create dynamic workshops that educate parents, pilot YouTube parent education series.  Maintain a resource and referral process for in school and out of school time youthCoaching, Mentoring, Trainings Coach, mentor, train, and provide critical assistance to parents & caretakers Facilitates parent education workshops & designs new, innovative content aligns with our region’s needs Act as point person to refer parent’s to readily available supportive community resourcesCommunity Relations Develops strong community relationships to build new capacity for parents to engage in their child’s lives Provides training to help empower parents to increase their child’s participation in schoolMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  3-5years of experience in family support or community development programs Excellent oral & written communication skills; ideally training & mentoring capacity Strong background in parent/family engagement strategies and community health issues Track record of developing & managing family needs assessments to support programmatic growth Available to work some nights and weekends and possesses clean & valid driver’s licenseYOUR WORK SUPPORTS OUR CORE VALUES Heartfelt: Displays empathy for others, delivers services in loving manner, is fully engaged & present for others, acts as servant leader Youth champion: Serves as advocate for youth, engages in youth activism, acts as partner with youth that gives them a powerful voice Professional: Acts with integrity, takes ownership of your professional development, support others, display accountability and responsibility, strive for excellence and effective services Energetic: Demonstrates passion & excitement for the mission. Your positive attitude is infectious, and you serve as a role model Daring: Brings creative, fresh, and innovative approaches to our mission. You are a “game changer” that produces real solutions to current challenges, and you have a fail forward mentality the applies lessons learned

Job DescriptionMedical Equipment Test TechnicianDo you love to travel? Are you tired of sitting at a desk all day and would love for your employer to pay you to explore the U.S. while working? If so, this may be the perfect position for you.Winery’s Biomedical Equipment Testing Technicians get to travel regionally and nationally. From Washington to Florida (and most states in between), the company provides you with an exciting adventure every workday. You may even have the opportunity to work with some of our clients in exotic locations such as Guam, Hawaii and Puerto Rico! What are you waiting for?!Winergy provides testing and certification of key hospital and medical research safety equipment. More information on Winergy can be found at winergyservices.com.Winergy is seeking a potential candidate that is capable of learning new skills on the job in a unique field. As a government contractor, we are looking for someone who is willing to travel to various clients located around the country. As a growing business with a driven team, we're looking for a self-motivated individual to join us.Job Duties:Inspect, test, and certify various hospital and research equipment including:Biological safety cabinets (BSCs)Chemical fume hoodsLaminar Airflow WorkstationsHEPA filtersPharmacy clean roomsTest, balance and certify negative pressure isolation rooms as well as positive pressure protective environments. Provide guidance to inpatient pharmacy managers and develop solutions when testing problems arise. Conduct pharmacy personnel testing. Job Expectations:Winergy team members are challenged in a unique environment that demands on-the-spot critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Our clients expect Winergy to not only test and certify critical equipment and environments, but also to help them solve issues that arise within their systems. Our team members not only play an integral role as a technician, but also have the drive to seek out new clients and prepare proposals and bids for new opportunities. If selected, you will also gain critical skills in small business development and expansion. We believe in developing our team members. The selected candidate should be prepared for intense on the-job training in hospitals, pharmacies, and medical research buildings for approximately 13 weeks.Winergy technicians are willing to travel to locations throughout the US up to 14 days per month. The trips are typically not consecutive but are usually 1-4 days in length.Required Qualifications:Resides near or willingness to relocate to Chicago, ILStrong technical aptitude. Applicants with experience in testing, repairing or troubleshooting equipment or systems are preferred. Accurate documentation and technical writing abilityGood critical-thinking, attention-to-detail, and problem-solving skillsShows an eagerness and desire to learnExceptional customer service skillsValid driver's license, automobile insurance, and a clean driving recordAbility to steadily lift up to 45 lbs. Ability to effectively use hand tools commonly associated with the repair and maintenance of medical equipmentAbility to read, understand and interpret technical documentation including, but not limited to wiring and equipment schematicsExperienced with Microsoft Office applications – especially Excel. Loves to travel!Preferred Qualifications:Prefer a degree with majors in biomedical engineering, chemical engineering, environmental science, biological engineering, biology or a similar concentration. Candidates with training in other technical fields, as well as the field of business with minors in the above degrees will also be considered. While a 4-year degree is not a requirement, greater consideration will be given to those that meet this qualification. CETA Certification and/or NSF Certification – preferred, but not required. Salary and Benefits:Salaried position with bonus structure for out-of-town and extended work time. High potential to earn $70K to $95K after initial 90 day reduced rate probationary period. Achieving the CETA certification will provide employee with a $6,000 bonus and $6,000 salary increase. Achieving the NSF certification will provide employee with a $4,000 bonus and $4,000 salary increase. 40+ hours a week & some weekends requiredPaid holidays and Paid Time OffHealth insurance reimbursement & 401K BenefitsThis position could be a great job opportunity for someone looking for a second career.Transitioning Veterans are encouraged to apply.
